one_reviews_text: The "new" 128Gb Quest 2 is a welcome increase in storage space over the prior 64Gb model, as the OS eats up a fair bit of space on that storage.  Fortunately the apps and games are mostly small in install size.For a standalone VR headset (with ability to connect to a gaming PC for PCVR), it does a fantastic job at bringing you this experience.  However, the requirement for Facebook is a sour note to using it as it is tied to your real life social media account.  You can make a alias for it though so other gamers don't see your real name.. but still, the writing is on the wall that this is for personal data collection while you use it.  Take that for what it's worth, as the low cost is clearly subsidized from Facebook's personal data collection as the unit is sold at a loss otherwise.The Pros:-Small and portable.-VR capability is great.  It's not powerful to provide realistic graphics, but the games are really effective at giving you a sense of scale and being in the VR world.  Framerates are fast and colors are vivid.  It works great.-Low cost compared to everything else on the market (which requires a PC - which this doesn't).-Ability to cast gameplay to a chromecast type device for others to see.-Install sizes are small (most),Cons:- Facebook required.- The strap is uncomfortable and doesn't do a good job of keeping the weight off your face. It's essentially a fabric belt, so you'll want to invest in a better headband for more support.- Battery capacity gives you about 2+ hours playtime so it's quite low.  If you supplement with an external battery, the Quest will run off of that before it goes to it's own battery, so you'll want to invest in a battery pack for more playtime.- Lenses have a small focal "sweet spot" and this coupled with the troublesome headstrap means that you will frequently adjust the headset to reduce fatigue to your eyes.- Resolution varies in standalone games as the headset may need to lower resolution to allow for appropriate processing power - depending on the app.  While the headset is "almost 2K per eye", there will still be some blur, and in some games, you will notice a fair amount if the game drops the resolution as needed. This is not a frequent issue, but I am mentioning it just in case some owners wonder why game X is clearer than game Y.  Having said this, a number of titles have been patched for the higher processing power of the Quest 2's headset and do have increased resolution over the original Quest 1.- The Oculus game store does not have big-discount sales like Steam or Playstation for their VR headsets.  There is a daily deal and sometimes weekly deals with a couple of games in them, but the discounts range from about 9% to 30%.  Overall, games on Quest 2 will cost you more to purchase as most will stay at full price.In conclusion ..  don't look at the small list of Pros as a negative as what it does, it does great and is well worth the cost.  Just know that the cons show that it does have limitations so don't expect the moon, and the basic headset will likely need a better headband and external battery to get the best enjoyment out of it.  It's a 5 star headset absolutely - but Facebook's requirement is something to understand, as if your account is ever banned on Facebook... you will lose all your purchases and the headset will become useless.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 1, 2021
review_title: If it weren't for Facebook, it'd be 5 stars.

one_reviews_text: I had the elite strap on for a few weeks and had gotten to use my headset roughly around 20 hours in those two weeks. It was fine during that time, fit well, seemed firm. However my computer's graphics card failed, and so I left my VR headset on the desk, next to my computer for several weeks while I got the warranty for my card to replace it. After I had my computer up and running again, again after the VR headset was sitting not being touched for several weeks, I picked it up (from the front, heavy side, not the strap) and the snap just snapped in half under its own weight. This is absolutely unacceptable for the price they are charging.  I had read the reviews of others saying the band snapped, figured it couldn't be as bad as they said, but sure enough, it's true, with no pressure, no force, just leave it on a desk for a few weeks and it will snap all on its own. Extremely disappointed.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on June 13, 2021
review_title: Product broke with absolutely no force or impact

one_reviews_text: I've been having disconnect issues with the Oculus disconnecting from my PC when using the link cable, since i bought it, when playing PC VR games.  I've seen the issues repeated by multiple users all over the net the past few months, with different "fixes" or reasons, from my USB port being loose, or software updates causing the problem.  It's none of these, its the cable itself thats the problem.  Look online into getting an Anker cable, or some other cable that is up to par with the transfer rates to play using your PC.  DO NOT BUY THE OFFICIAL CABLE, it is cheap crap.  I switched to an anker cable and extension, and it runs fine now.  IT was literally the Quest 2 link cable that was disconnecting.  What a waste of $120.  This cable is a legit scam.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 24, 2021
review_title: Official Link cable is an overpriced scam

one_reviews_text: While the link cable looks nice, feels nice, and works part of the time, it's incredibly faulty to justify the ridiculous pricetag.  I bought it thinking this would ensure the best connection for using my Quest 2 for PCVR, but no, it's junk.  I can't go more than half an hour without a random "PC Disconnected" message, which is insanely frustrating when playing lengthier games like Halflife Alyx.  Whenever this happens I have to take off the headset, shut down the game, shut down Steam, restart the Oculus app on my PC and start again.  This happens regularly using either the USBC port on my 2080TI, or on the motherboard itself.  Not sure if it's a faulty cable, bad link software, or what, but Oculus has been zero help in correcting the issue.  Spent two weeks dealing with support, sending logs back and forth, over and over, went through their standardized checklist of generic possible fixes(most of which having nothing to do with link, but humored them anyway), just to have them say "will have to look into this further" and stop responding.This is what I get for buying the first run of new hardware before they work out the faults.  Don't buy this cable.  Quest 2 is still good on it's own(for low level games/apps), but if you're wanting something for PCVR I'd highly recommend a different headset.  They might be pricier, but well worth it to avoid this headache.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 7, 2020

one_reviews_text: I bought the Elite strap when I pre-ordered my Quest-2.It is much better than the standard strap that comes with the headset but at it's price point isn't that great. Yes, it does improve comfort, the strap tightening mechanism feels really cheap and it has no built in headphones (Something the Quest-2 desperately needs). Since getting this, I bought a Vive Deluxe Audio Strap and used 3D printed parts to attach it to my Quest-2 (Now called a FrankenQuest2), this is a amazing solution, yes, more expensive but you get what you pay for, this is very comfortable and the the built in headphones sound great. Personally, I'd skip the Oculus Elite strap and put that money towards a Vive Deluxe Audio Strap and make your own FrankenQuest2. :)
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 1, 2020

one_reviews_text: Initially I was planning to send this unit back, it gave me a headache after prolonged use and found the original strap sufficient, however, for programs demanding intense or medium movements the Elite strap is an absolute must. I purchased a couple of additional padding products to make it more comfortable. The back portion of the Elite strap is made of flexible rubber material which, in my opinion needs a bit more cushioning to make it  more comfortable, especially if the program demands the strap to be fairly tight to prevent movement of the headset. With these alterations I would happily recommend the Elite strap.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 7, 2020
review_title: Broke on the site, without any pressure....not fixable.

one_reviews_text: I didn't get the $70 credit with the purchase
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 26, 2021

one_reviews_text: Where are the$70. This thing doesn't work for me. Also I didn't receive the$70 as promised.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 4, 2021

one_reviews_text: I first purchased a 128GB model at the end of September and it functioned well with my use of the Supernatural VR fitness program.  Then one day after my return window expires, the right controller became unresponsive and could not connect to the headset.  Oculus customer service took forever to connect and I  didn't receive a response.  When tried to factory reset the headset following Oculus's official instructions, the reset stuck on the initial page and could not progress further, and the right controller still remained as unconnected.  Out of frustration, I contacted Amazon to express my frustration and Amazon very kindly offered me a replacement unit despite my return/exchange window had expired the day before.  Hooray for Amazon!  Boooo for Oculus.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 25, 2021
review_title: Amazon service is amazing, Oculus is not.

one_reviews_text: When I first got my Quest 2, it only took 20 minutes for it to feel completely uncomfortable on my face. Once I put the Elite Strap on, I was able to leave the headset on for over an hour. What a difference it makes! It really does help to balance the weight off your face. Highly recommend this. I did read that some people have had theirs crack, I've had no issues so far, but I'm also very careful when I take it off. I make sure to loosen it up first. UPDATE: Its only been a month and no matter how careful I was, mine ended up cracking and breaking.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 3, 2020
review_title: So much better than the strap Quest 2 comes with!

one_reviews_text: The item arrived on time, no delays. The package was well done and felt very safe for what was inside.Connecting the headset to Wi-Fi and starting up + playing a game was like breeze. There is no detailed user manual but there is a start-up document inside the package. There is a small booklet which explains about the headset but I am not sure if that will help to deal with any problems connecting internet and playing games. Best is to check online as there are a ton of videos and forums.Personally, I had no problem to start up but had lot of issues connecting to a PC. Wireless connection was a little hassle in the beginning, but found resources online.Wired was pretty easy but you need to know the steps to do it, you can find it online too.Overall I am giving it a 5-star rating. The experience is amazing, although it could be a little stressful to the eyes and will get used to it after couple of times.Good luck!!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 11, 2021
review_title: Its Oculus Quest 2 and what can I say!!

one_reviews_text: My strap broke on one arm after 5 month purchase. I contacted the Oculus Support, filled out the form, submitted all the information they required.  After a month of waiting, Oculus Support sent me an email today and it says "......Based on all the information you provided, we would like your Quest 2 Elite Strap returned for further review and have a replacement Quest 2 Elite Strap sent to you. Note: this replacement may be refurbished. "It has been a really long process and frustrating experience. The strap was broken within 6 months, and it's been over one month since I contacted Oculus. Now Oculus ask me to return it and then replace it (potentially with a refurbished one) subject to review? and I don't even know when I will be able to receive it!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 31, 2021

one_reviews_text: To start off, I want to make it known that the Elite Strap has a well-known manufacturing issue causing premature wear and cracking of the side straps. Oculus has gone so far as to pull the product off the market for a period of time, and extend their warranty to 2 years from 1. You won't need that warranty though, it will crack on you within weeks/months. Oculus tech support will also give you the run around and eventually tell you they have to "troubleshoot your issue" to figure out a way to solve it.I actually own of these straps for two different headsets. One strap failed so catastrophically that the plastic was literally crumbling in my hands, and the other side of the strap was also cracking in multiple places. The second strap has multiple horizontal hair line cracks, as well as vertical cracks developing.Is the headset comfortable? Totally, it's far more comfortable than the stock strap, but you're basically stuck once it cracks (and it will). Just buy a 3rd party product, it's way cheaper and it's not going to self-destruct on you, the warranty service will probably be better too. If you still want to buy this one, go ahead, but when it breaks, don't say I didn't warn you.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 23, 2021
review_title: STAY AWAY - buy a 3rd party strap instead.

one_reviews_text: Product is so bad, I have no idea where to start.1- the device is very heavy on your face. You feel the weight, a lot!2- unless you super tight in the strap, the device will fall. If you tighten the strap then in addition to the device being heavy, your entire head is now tight.3- there's actually no room for glasses in this thing. Even with the glasses spacer, the width is not enough for the glasses to fit.4- The PD is not well adjustable, no matter which setting you pick. You will see a lot of black sides.5- there are crazy Hollow effects and "God rays" coming from the lenses, even when you are not using your own glasses. they are worst when you put the in your glasses.6- the LCD seems very poor quality, and the image seems extremely washed out. I have not found a way to fix that.7- coming from a Samsung gear VR with my S9, this seems like a huge downgrade. I will be returning this product.8- bluetooth headphones are not out right supported, enable them in experimental features.9- as others say, the strap brakes fairly easily.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 10, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought an oculus quest 2 virtual reality headset a month ago and already have skin irritation. The symptoms are clear, I should never have bought this product.These skin irritations left black marks on my skin around my eyes. It was a product that destroyed my life and weakened my self-esteem with these marks on my face.This is a purchase that I greatly regret, the cost of this product is very high, the majority of applications are paid or free applications as a short demo.Unfortunately, I expect the company to offer a better quality product that is good for both mind and body.My personal opinion is to avoid this product if you want to protect your skin and your wallet.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 7, 2022
review_title: Product that causes skin irritation. TO AVOID :(

one_reviews_text: I wanted to like this very much. I did a lot of research beforehand and after i got the quest 2. But despite its nice packaging and relatively slick initial startup to get you playing, there were some deal-breaking flaws.In a nutshell: the sweet spot for visual sharpness is too small. What i mean by that is if you put the headset on, you have to make 100% certain that1. The ipd (distance between the lenses) is set properly. I ended up having to set it between the second and third longest setting. Though I simply couldn’t find the perfect spot2. The the straps have to hold the headset perfectly in place on the x-y plane in front of your face. Not too far left-right, nor too far up-down.3. The strap has to be tightened a lot to ensure that the unit doesn’t move. You can’t even sneeze cuz you’ll lose your sharpness sweet spot. And you have to reef on the straps to bring the device closer to your eyes also, to maximize sharpness. I had to have it so tight that i had welts on my face for an hour after taking the device off.4. If you use glasses, forget it. Even with the spacer, the device wanted to ram my glasses into my skull. The optics just wouldn’t align properly if i used my glasses.With that said, the fiddling with the device was too much. And it ends up being too uncomfortable for me. It actually hurt. Not only that, but it made me nauseated.Lastly, i tried a game via Steam VR. I found the graphics to be very poor compared to my laptop screen. I’m using a laptop 3080 rtx so it def has enough power. I just found the vr screens to lack visual clarity and fidelity… it just seemed washed-out or sparkly and strange.Overall, it was easy to setup, had great tracking and a generally slick interface. But the discomfort, poor graphical prowess and tiny sharpness sweet spot destroyed the experience for me. I actually dreaded the thought of having to use this thing.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 2, 2021

one_reviews_text: Bought February 17th and is now in the garbage on April 8th. Less than two months of use. The side plastic support strapping that extends along the side of your head cracked and eventually snapped in two. I pieced it back together and used gorilla duct tape to re-secure the side strapping. Worked temporarily until another crack developed and snapped. Got popscicle sticks to create a splint over the broken area then re-taped with gorilla tape. Last night the round cap at the back of the head strap that cups the back of your head snapped off on one side. Tried super gluing it back together. Now the tension crank handle at the back won't turn. Found it a new home in the trash bin. I am retired and only use the device in a sitting position to play PokerstarsVR, so it's not like I was doing any wild shootemup games or sword play daily.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 8, 2021
review_title: Horribly Poor Construction Materials For The Amount of Money Paid!!!!

one_reviews_text: So to begin, I'd like to say the Quest 2 is quite a blast and that Meta is literally selling the hardware at a loss due to hoping to hook you on the product in the long run.That being said it has a number of flaws, the biggest of which being that you need several other devices to make the Quest 2 as useful as it can be.To begin with, if you want to play any games that connect to your VR computer to enhance the experience, then your going to likely need a separate and long high Quality USB wire to connect to your computer.  That's $30.Then your going to want to buy some rechargeable AA batteries and a charger if you don't have one for another $30 for the Controllers.Finally you;ll really need a much better strap than the default one, the Elite Strap is an option for $55, but I prefer the M2 Pro which cost me $70 and came with an additional battery to extend it's life.  Finally you'll really want a sweatband for any active game otherwise your sweat will cause you to stop, which you can get for $5.That all amounts to another $130 CAD, and the quest starts at $450, although if you bought during sale like I did you got a $70 discount.  But even with that included I spent over $500 on the Quest 2 all in all.That being said, comparing it to it's direct comparisons such as the PS5 and such, I do feel that the Quest 2 is different enough to be preferable if that's it's direct competition, especially with how amazing Beat Saber is, and the fact that exclusives are getting less and less important, and I'd also rate it above the Switch personally although those are harder to compare, as the Switch is designed for outside use VS Quest 2 which is strictly indoors.That being said, if it's competition is something like getting a better computer?  Such as you not having a good enough computer for VR to begin with?  Then I suggest you invest in just saving the money until you can afford a better computer to be honest, especially if you also use said Computer for gaming.Overall I think I likely should have saved for a new computer myself, but I didn't realize the accessories needed or the sunk cost fallacy, but overall it's not a big loss and I'm quite emotionally satisfied regardless and it has gotten me a fair bit more active.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 30, 2021

one_reviews_text: Cons :- not impressed by image quality- image quality deteriotes when you don't look in the center of the "screen", you have to move your head, not your eyes- the "sweet spot" where you need to be looking on the lenses to get the best image quality is very small- headset is relatively heavy and does not breathe that well, it seems the solution would be to put all the hardware (CPU, etc) somewhere else (in a backpack, in a pocket or let's do the processing remotely on a PC)- I tried to play Squadrons on my PC, I had to install SteamVR, go through a few not so obvious steps, then I learned that the Oculus controllers are not supported by this game so you must use a joystick or keyboard/mouse, not really impressed- no demo as part of the setup to let you try a game but I was found a free game that pretty much does that : Echo VR (also owned by Facebook)- the Echo VR game was relatively great but I had "mild motion sickness", similar to what I get when I go to the theme park to try "spinning rides" with my kids- needs to be linked to a FB account for no logical reason- I was not able to receive sms from FB to verify my FB account to unlock Developer Mode for some reasonsPackaging cons :- does not come with a case- it does not come with headphones, only built in speakers, you can add your own but I would have preferred that Oculus/Facebook at least sell some headphones designed to fit the headset- elite strap not part of the kit (I mean it's great to have options but it would be best to have a better level of comfort by default)Cable cons :- it includes a usb 2 cable while their own software recommends a usb 3 cable ...- included cable is very short- official usb 3 cable is quite expensivePros :- got 35$ oculus store credit from being referred by a friend (he also got 35$)- I tried hand tracking, controlling the device without controllers, it worked relatively well- I tried using my computer by plugging a usb 3 cable in the PC, I was able to see my Desktop, relatively cool as an experiment but at the same time, it just look better in real life so why bother- it was fun to see the kids trying itTLDR : it looks more like a demo product to me, I think it still needs to be improved to be a great alternative to non VR gaming, it's not enough comfy nor impressive to make me want to spend time using it instead of doing other activities
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 30, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought another chinese version of the same idea and it was trash. The fit was wrong, it didn't block light. It didn't include anything but the rubber itself. This kit includes 2 sets of both foam and the rubber light blockers plus the eye rings - and they are awesome. Was foolproof and took like 2 minutes to put everything together. Added bonus my wife and I both prefer a different interface (that you're buying here) and we can swap them when we swap the headset and no one has to deal with the other's sweat.I understand wanting to save money and buying cheaper - but on amazon cheaper almost always means inferior.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 10, 2022
review_title: Always best to go to the OEM

one_reviews_text: No I don't like this product - I LOVE IT!!!  Absolutely fantastic.  One the apps I use on it is Supernatural, a fitness app.  I am excited to work out every day.  The Occulus offers travel to different places, to experience movies (Netflex), games of many kinds, wonderful meditations, thrilling rides.  Scary rooms -- and so much more.  What an incredible product and I never though I would see virtual experiences be this possible in my lifetime.  I thought they would be way beyond my grasp from a monetary perspective as a senior in my 70th year with a limited income.  So amazing, thrilling and fun!!  Don't hesitate if you are thinking of it!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 30, 2022

one_reviews_text: My first vr headset I bought this because of resident evil 4 for the quest 2 as I'm a huge fan of re games!, I'm having a blast playing re4 I am blind in my right eye and partially impaired vision in my left eye but still manage to play decently, I was expecting a Samsung phone br experience but no this is a lot better with the fov, I do have some complaints like the lack of a zoom button a d sometimes recording within the oculus the video cannot be played back and is corrupted, also I want to adjust video player sizes but can't with the native app player. Overall its a worthy vr headset for its price compared to the thousand dollar ones this one does the job just fine and also u can hook it up to steam vr and play some steam vr games but I haven't tried yet.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 22, 2021

one_reviews_text: Battery life is ~1.5 hours, the best games are half the price of console AAA titles, and the developer mode unlocks a whole community of invested gamers to broaden the scope of what this machine can do. User friendly and really intuitive, players ranged from our friends 6 yr old all the way to my mid 70’s grandfather! Everyone had a good time. The now included silicone cover is nice for when you choose to work up a sweat, this is our second Occulus as a gift to get another family member involved in the gaming. She is new to gaming, rocking it in her mid 50’s and loves this thing, I’ve never seen her so excited for a gift. Just do it, you wont regret it!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 12, 2021
review_title: Worth every penny, working out hasn’t been this fun in years!

one_reviews_text: It should be more clear in the title or something...  This is a facebook device.  Why would I want to "possibly" share all my VR crap with facebook lol... just wow.  My other HP VR headset doesn't ask for a single thing - just install and use it... Even when I tried to make another facebook account for it, it won't let me - sends me 5 digit code and once entered and click next... nothing happens. over and over, tried 20x in various ways in different browsers, etc.  This is junk to me and another way for facebook to spy on people.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 27, 2021
review_title: This is a facebook thing wth... you are forced to connect this to your facebook account

 👍🏼Pros:✔️Gets your Oculus up off the desk, couch or floor✔️Very simple to install (took me 5m)✔️Thr LED lights add a nice touch✔️Comes with a guide for the nail markers👎🏼Cons:❌You must plug the magnet into the Oculus USB port, which is fine if you never use the USB port on your Oculus. However, my son likes to use the Oculus for Roblox so he needs to unplug the magnet from the Oculus to plug it into the PC. The magnet is very difficult to get out of the port on the Oculus. Not a deal breaker by any means, but just something to be aware of.❌This mount slips off the screws when you pick up the Oculus off of it, sliding off of the wall. I remedied this by using 3M double sided tape on the mount so that it's very secure to the wall with both screws and double sided tape.Overall I'd recommend this mount. It's a bit pricey for what it is, but it's almost a must have if you have an Oculus. The last thing you want is for your $400 machine sitting on the desk or floor. This mount gets it up off the desk and also displays it nicely.

one_reviews_text: I was hesitant about VR - worried it was a gimmick I'd only use once or twice and then end up on a shelf.Decided to make the plunge when I realized I could purchase prescription lenses to go inside the headset.I wasn't prepared for the absolute Immersion VR provides.  The Quest works great wirelessly (with great Wifi) using Virtual Desktop. Rare glitches are far less annoying than the advantage of being entirely wireless.My eyesight isn't the best, in the real world I have a weak eye and frequently have double vision, but I found the binocular vision I get from the quest to be better than the real world.  That staggers me - I would have never expected that result.I love my quest and use it every day - it's my desktop computer that's been neglected!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 9, 2022
review_title: Took the plunge, wish I'd jumped in sooner.

one_reviews_text: This device is basically a data mining device. The only way you can play games on this is basically to have a Facebook account.Look, I don’t even mind website tracking or “selling my personal data”.But when I want to be online, I don’t want to be connected to my irl acquaintances or want my legal name to be everywhere on online communities.Is it too much to ask to keep online and offline separate?But no. Get a machine from a competitor instead of you’re worried about your privacy online.Device itself is okay, not the best, but definitely worth the price. The reason why the price is so low is because that’s the cost of your personal info, otherwise other devices of similar specs will cost quite a few hundred dollars more. It’s also not the most comfortable of devices, so be ready to shill out some more money to make it comfortable-ish to wear.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 12, 2022

one_reviews_text: I knew my son and the fam would love this… I did a lot of research before purchasing and yup!!! So cool… some really cool free games but the good games need to be purchased but it’s worth it… I have anxiety and this helps me to focus on other things and they have some cool meditation experiences which are so cool. I recommend it 100% if you’re looking for something that is really high quality in regards to graphics you may be disappointed but for me it’s perfectly fine… just watch YouTube reviews and make your own decision… it’s sure to “wow” you and your family.

one_reviews_text: Pros:It’s an amazing piece of technology.Love playing games. Beat saber, kizuna ai, Vader immortal are some of my favourites. I also love doing the meditation apps like Tripp . Watching movies in prime is amazing.Cons:Head strap is completely useless. Doesn’t fit at all. You have to shell out more money to buy the better head strapsOculus itself keeps hanging all the time. The device just goes blank at random intervals while playing games. Defeats the purpose of fun.Oculus app is really buggy. Cmon meta please hire better developers and quality testers.The lens is always blurry. Not sure how to clean the lens but always seems blurry even after cleaning it with micro fiber clothOverall just used for less than a month but at times felt like returning the item because of the defects and random problems
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 22, 2022

one_reviews_text: I got this for MS flight simulator. For the first month I just watched all of the videos and games before getting around to the flight sim. Then the fun began. Spent another month getting the flight sim to work with VR, eventually got the Oculus USB cable and now all okay. Flying in VR is amazing, well worth the trouble and cost.Now the cons. Bit pricey but c'est la vie. I got the 256GB vesion but now know that the 128GB would have been more than enough - can always delete and add stuff via a PC. It is a bit uncomfortable to wear for long, maybe an hour tops. Heavy (0.5kg), sits on the bridge of my nose, position matters so can't just move it. Battery life is so-so, so I use a big (26AH) external USB pack.VR is still a bit of a gimicky novelty unless you have specific games or simulators in mind. For example, amazon prime has a VR section - with 14 videos averaging under 10 minutes each inc 3 minutes of credits. Youtube has some too but resolution is almost useless. A good quality VR video will be 0.25-0.5GB a minute. Yes, 1GB might only be a few minutes (depends if 2D-3D, VR180-VR360, 3DOF-6DOF).All that said, if you want VR, don't go cheap, go Oculus or HP.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 20, 2022
review_title: VR for gaming and short videos

one_reviews_text: UPDATED MAY 5 2022 - see the end. We purchased this a month ago. We both love it. Then after an update the right eye piece failed to work. Rebooted, both hard and soft, did at least 6 factory resets but nothing worked.  We were able to log onto the chat (and after being dropped 2 times) and uploading a video of the unit not working (along with the particulars such as Serial numbers etc) just to be told we would be getting a replacement.  We were adamant that we did NOT WANT A REFURBISHED UNIT  as this was just a month old. The staff were excellent so I can’t fault them - but the company’s policy sucks.  We were recommended to get a refund through Amazon.  Nope they don’t refund things like this. Back to oculus for the refurbished unit. Sigh.  I’m starting to think oculus only replaces with refurbished units because they know of the glitch in the new original units. Admitting to said known glitch would mean a recall of extraordinary magnitude. This way they get the bad units back, send out a fixed previously bad unit to the customer who’s returned unit will be fixed sent out to the. next weary customers.  It's way cheaper than a recall but long after the sweet taste of saving a buck comes the bitterness left behind from your customers dissatisfaction.  We have long memory’s.  UPDATE - I have increased to 3 stars from 1.  Our replacement unit FINALLY arrived - Thank you.  We were delighted to have received a NEW REPLACEMENT UNIT (not a refurbished one - as far as we can tell).  So far, it is working well.  I will update this again in July or August 2022.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 3, 2022
review_title: Broke after 1 month - crappy replacement policy

one_reviews_text: I really, really, really hate the strap configuration that comes with the Oculus 2 by default.As someone whos first VR setup was a Odyssey+, I got very used to the idea of a very solid structured support system - especially with adding after market supports like the Studioform headstrap. The Oculus 2's maze of cheap fabric and velcro always felt like it was horrible, and it was very difficult to adjust.So the Elite strap is a god send - it restores that addition of a solid strap to a VR headset, and offers a built in battery. The battery addition is super convenient too: it plugs directly into the charging port, so when you go to charge the ocoulus, you just plug it into the back of the headstrap where the battery charge port is. Since its a first party product, the oculus natively reads the battery level and will report it in your menus. A solid strap isn't unique to Elite, and the battery addition isn't unique, but to my understanding third party solutions do not give in-app readouts of battery level. This could be wrong, but going to flag this to differentiate why a premium paid for the strap might be worthwhile.That being said, there is something major that must be identified: There has been a historical concern about Elite straps breaking. Seriously, give "Quest 2 Elite Break" a google and you're going to find a ton of results. Its pretty consistent that Oculus has been on the ball for replacing strap breaks with absolutely no fuss (and quite quickly), but its a concern that must be flagged. There is some discussion that its quite possible/likely that newer straps are made from a different material combination that means they're less likely to break, but its substantively difficult to tell when straps were manufactured, and there's no publicly facing information saying that they've addressed the issue.An advantage that I personally find is that the elite strap is substantively easier to clean than default straps - outside of the velcro strap over the top of your head, its all hard/plastic material, so you can clean it quite easily. The velcro strap isn't removable, but being a velcro strap its fairly easy to sanitize.In general: Highly recommend it, with a buyer beware there's a historical issue with the straps breaking, but they've been dealt with quickly/without issues in the past.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 7, 2022

one_reviews_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



 Debated between this and a new console for my daughter. Glad I went with this. Very cool and unique experience and definitely more active compared to being seated playing a consoleThe games are relatively cheap compared to the big systems as well.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 1, 2022

one_reviews_text: Here's what I like:-Games are inexpensive & use little storage space.-Impressive "immersion" vr experience-Built in sound is good at moderate levels-Controllers are light weight and form to your hand well.-decent battery life & fast recharge time-ability to charge with external battery pack while playing.What I don't like:-headstrap: can't get this to hold the vr unit comfortably on face. Found pain along cheek bones no matter where I set the strap. (upgrade is a must to the elite or other offerings on Amazon that use the turn dial adjuster on back)-lcd display has terrible black levels......this would've been an incredible experience if it was OLED.-foam around vr will soak up sweat but is much more comfortable than the silicone.....this is another upgrade point for comfort....go for the ventilated option using the pleather material IMHO.Overall, after performing the couple comfort upgrades, I am very happy with this unit and would consider another one.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 24, 2022

one_reviews_text: Quest is a nice headset & an amazing VR experience. The games are real fun & enjoyment for the whole family. The set is a bit heavy so you may feel a bit of pressure on your neck after 30 minutes of play, so keep turns short & those neck massagers handy.The worst part of the experience is the facebook account needed to use the headset. Basically, all your purchases are locked in with facebook account. There is no point of linking a social media account when you just want to enjoy games.  And who in their right mind will share their personal info and purchases with facebook, who are proven to sell your info to third parties.So, there is always a sword hanging on your head that if facebook decides to suspend your account, for any stupidest of reasons, you will lose your occulus account as well, with little to no reprieve. This is such a shame.Cannot think of any other product out there which has such limitation on their consumers. They really need to jot down a predictable way to sort out account issues so you can retrieve, transfer or moneyback your purchases (which can end up in hundreds of dollars)
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 13, 2021
review_title: Good VR Headset. Facebook Login is Pathetic

one_reviews_text: Purchased this case to hold my new Oculus Quest 2. Was great the first 3 times I opened the case to get my headset. Then the 4th time the zipper got stuck and with a lot of pulling and prodding I finally got it to release. The 6th time I tried to open it the zipper got stuck permanently. No obstructions it just would not open. I finally had to use a utility knife to cut the zipper out. What a waste of money for such a beautiful case. Would not recommend.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 22, 2021

one_reviews_text: I wasn't sure what to expect from such an inexpensive VR headset but i've been amazed at how polished the experience has been so far. I mostly wanted to use it for PCVR with Steam and originally bought a USB cable to tether it to my PC, but i soon realized the performance was not as good as expected on my older system (3930k / GTX 970) I then tried air link, and the experience wasn't much better, despite my high end network and wifi. I was able to get a very good wireless experience out of SteamVR after discovering VirtualDesktop for Quest2 however, it's an elegant solution that delegates a lot of the networking workload to the headset itself, freeing your PC to focus on the games and it's been wonderful so far. I was able to play Beatsaber on my PC at a very respectable 60-80FPS without too much input lag. VRChat was also playable even at low 30-20fps, it's not a bad experience if you mostly hang out with friends in private worlds.Do yourself a favor through, buy an upgraded head strap, the default offering is terrible for large head and will be too tight and front heavy.Finally, i was skeptical of buying a FB product due to privacy concerns, but if that bothers you, a separate FB account exclusively for your Quest2 is a good workaround until Meta goes through with removing the FB account requirement to use this headset.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 3, 2022

one_reviews_text: 59 years old and tried VR for the first time at a games room restaurant.  They had a vive pro 2 system and it was fun,  but glitchy on a simple program.  Still enough fun to make me want to check out others.  I settled on this one as most reviewers seemed to favor it.  And for the money,  this is better than the experience with the vive.  Clearer image,  great game play, easy to use and you can still connect with a computer for even more apps.  10 times less than buying a vive (with the required gaming computer).  However, you have to add the cost of a case and the elite headstrap with battery, about an additional $200.  If you are looking at a vr set, this might be your best bet.  So far, I am very happy with the purchase.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 10, 2022

one_reviews_text: If your glasses are 145mm, these won't fit. Samsung great VR fit perfectly. This is simply too narrow. That's no vision correction like gear VR either. I guess a lot of people who will buy this won't wear glasses. Thank you Amazon for a great return policy.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on August 27, 2021
review_title: Too small for people who wear glasses.

one_reviews_text: I noticed a crack starting just 17 days after the (extended) Amazon return window.  The crack is on the INSIDE face, so it's hidden from normal view. This is just from casual use, and reasonable care.Fortunately, Oculus has extended it's manufacturers warranty to 2 years, and a call ticket that I sent in yesterday with Oculus Support has already given me the details for replacement.  I'd much rather a refund though.  I've heard that replacements can also suffer from the same manufacturers problem.  At a rate of one failure every four months, I can only hope that the replacements are eligible for replacements, and that the problems in manufacture are resolved before my 2 years are up.  $80 is a steep price to be a beta tester.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 19, 2021

one_reviews_text: So far I've been having alot of fun with this vr. Setup is pretty easy and had no problems. Everything works great. Been playing vrchat a fun one and a few other of Quests crappy games and they work great. The battery lasts around 3 hours and takes 2 hours to charge. But don't expect to link up to your pc without a headache! Unless your pc is top of the line it won't be compatible. No adult vr games on the quest 2 at all. Not many good games unless you have pc link. You can sideload more mature games but you have Facebook watching what you play. I hate the idea of having to sign in with a Facebook account to use this headset! But if your not worried about that this is perfect.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 12, 2022
review_title: Fun but pc is a pain + Facebook

one_reviews_text: The video quality is very good but not outstanding. The audio quality is also very good but not outstanding.I would say that headset is good value and most people won't be disappointed. I wear large glasses and I 'm able to slip the headset on fairly comfortably with the provided adapter. Battery life is reasonable but if you have a juice pack that will definitely help. The only thing I would have hoped for would be free game demo's to try out before purchase. There is a limited amount of free interactive content, and lots of non-interactive. The overall build quality is pretty decent and I suspect that Meta probably doesn't make much or anything on the headset, it's hoping for domination of the industry I suspect.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 20, 2022
review_title: Expect to pay for good media content

one_reviews_text: As you will see if you look online this strap is very susceptible to cracking. I am 32 and the only one who uses the headset. I am very careful with putting it on and off and always hold it by the top strap or the headsets front. Never grabbing the thin sides of the Elite Strap and yet still it has only lasted four months before cracking. Do not waste your money, buy the "knock off" products they seem more durable. Fingers crossed Facebook is willing to refund me as they never have these straps in stock and likely cant replace it for months.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 24, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought the 128gb model, slightly hesitant that maybe I should have forked over the extra cash to upgrade to the 256gb model. I'm no longer concerned about it. After having bought and downloaded a dozen or so games directly into the Quest 2's memory, I still have over 90gb of storage left.  Don't sweat it if you can't afford the memory upgrade. Unless you're buying a ton of stuff off the Oculus store, it's unlikely that you would need more than 128gb.Very happy with this purchase.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 31, 2021

one_reviews_text: Bought the Quest 2 after years of waiting on the VR scene. Definitely lots of fun to use. I bought it without any accessories (no halo strap or extra battery) and I find that the battery life is more than enough for my personal usage such that my eyes will fatigue before the battery drains. My only complaint is that while the strap is comfortable enough, the face cushion is very stiff and is a bit sore on the head. The Oculus Go in comparison was a lot more comfortable on the face cushion. Other than that I like wholeheartedly enjoyed the Quest this holiday season.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 7, 2022
review_title: Good fun for 3-4 hours at a time. A bit heavy and uncomfortable.

one_reviews_text: Came with the tip bent, I didn't think much of it but while using the link if I tugged the line at all it would disconnect. Due to this, I tried to get it replaced. The replaced copy came in proper condition but after a month of use windows started saying "power surge detected" and it promptly stopped working.The replacement copy that I sent back got sent back so now I have two extremely expensive cables that don't work properly.The cable also tends to coil, pinch and bend a lot which sucks for a cable attached to your head while you move around in VR.I have worked with audio equipment before and know proper cable maintenance but even with proper care, after a month of use, I still can see damage building up. It was not enough to cause my issues but even if the cable worked properly I don't think it would last long which is ridiculous for a cable of this price.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on July 5, 2021

one_reviews_text: Definitely disappointed, I had read that Oculus had fixed the cracking Quest 2 Elite Strap problem so I ordered one and was really looking forward to getting it because as amazing as the Quest 2 is for VR the stock Oculus strap it comes with is terrible and it gives me headaches after only 30 minutes or so of playing it. Anyway the strap arrived quickly and packaged nicely, I swapped it onto my Quest 2 and it was fantastic and much better than the stock strap. I spent quite a few hours in it on multiple days with no real issues for two weeks and then I noticed a stress crack on one of the arms, and then it finally split in half a little while later. Maybe the unit I received was from the earlier pre fix production or maybe the production issues haven’t been fully resolved...(🤷‍♂️)...either way EPIC FAIL
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 2, 2021
review_title: Two weeks and then the left arm split in half EPIC FAIL

one_reviews_text: Bought this as a replacement for a USB A cable.It is thinner and lighter (uses fibre optics apparently) than the old cable, which does make a fairly big difference in the VR experience.Overall it is more stable than my old cable in terms of the connection. I use with MSFS 2020 no problem.The only complaint I have is the price. Even on sale, anything above 50 bucks for a cable is highway robbery. It doesn't even include a USB A to C adapter for connection to a regular 3.1 port on my PC.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 29, 2022
review_title: It's a cable; a very pricey cable

one_reviews_text: I wanted something to get me experiencing some VR finally. I'm sure there's better units out there but for the money you cannot go wrong with this unit. That being said its not perfect. You definitely want to get an Elite Strap of some kind, but since the Oculus ones are defective as far as I know, there are plenty to choose from on Amazon that work just fine.Also if you plan on playing with the link cable, its easy to put stress on the USB C port on the Quest 2 itself. So try to tape or zip tie it to the head strap, giving plenty of slack at the port itself. And however you anchor it, make sure its tight enough so if you do step on the cable or yank it during use, the stress is on the anchor points and not the USB C port. Mine already got a bit loose compared to what it was day one. Its fine for now but I haven't seen any videos about repairing it so you may get stuck to buying a new Quest 2 if it is beyond damaged.I've read as well that games bought from Oculus for Quest 2 are somehow attached to that specific headset so if you do end up getting another one not sure you'll have access to the library. Another reason to take care of the headset as much as you can.Overall I am more than pleased. Airlink feature works well enough to allow PC Linked games to play without the link cable. The minor stuttering I am happy to deal with when playing something like Lone Echo where you just want to spin around in your office chair full 360 degrees without worrying about the link cable. And there is a ton of Quest 2 stuff that can load right into the headset that doesn't require a PC to play.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 22, 2021
review_title: I finally wanted to give VR a try and for the money this unit is fantastic!

one_reviews_text: I was happy to see this unit comes with a Amazon credit at Black Friday sale. To be fair, VR was way overhyped back around 2015 and to play any graphics intense games you would need a $1000 level VR set and $2000 level computer which is not for most people. I am glad to see this unit has only been at $400 and does not require a PC. But in that regard, you would need to keep your expectations low. If you just want a unit to play Beat Saber or some lite graphics sports games, this is it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 16, 2021
review_title: No the most powerful VR machine but possibly the most practical one

one_reviews_text: VR is amazing! However, this machine is not powerful enough to play any fun games by itself. If you have a really fast computer and hook these up then it’s perfect. However, if you are wanting to use this as a stand alone device, don’t be shocked when games lag a lot, or you don’t have a huge selection of games to play. Other than the Meraverse and a handful of games, there really isn’t much more to do. I’m going to wait until a more powerful one comes out. It’s just too soon without a super fast gaming PC
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 10, 2022
review_title: Not powerful enough to play fun games

one_reviews_text: Overall, I am happy with the product being new to VR. The head strap is not sufficient so plan to buy a new one for about $50. Be careful with the system and remotes. They will break quite easily. I do not have Facebook, which is annoying that I had to clear an account. Games can be a bit pricey and are for the most part, one and done. Meaning once you complete them, you won't play again.I mostly gave the negatives, but it is a cool experience and system. Especially as it is stamd alone.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 12, 2022

one_reviews_text: Once you've been playing VR for a while, you will begin to realize the worst thing about it is the inconvenient. It's inconvenient to remove and put on. It's not a difficulty thing, it's just a pain. This strap is the first strap I've bought that actually fits comfortably on the base of your skull, with a gentle give for comfort. The best part is that this same flexible "cup" is suspended, so it's free to slide out of the way easily when you slip it on and off. I don't much like the original fabric strap, but it's clear that that strap holds the same theme: quick on and quick off. This will replace the knock-off "elite" strap that i bought because I was too cheap to fork out $70, before.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 21, 2021
review_title: Finally, a strap that is easy to take off and slip right back on

one_reviews_text: Great shipping as always. Those V.R. glasses are so awesome,  works great with no internet connection needed (single player)once the games are installed on the oculus. They pretty much thought of everything to make the experience as great as it could be when they built this cool piece of equipment, highly recommended!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 4, 2021

one_reviews_text: OK I’m almost 40 So I guess my brain is getting to the point where these devices kind of make me for lack of a better word nauseous other than that the straps do annoy you overtime and they are not the greatest mine has not snapped and broken off yet so I’m hoping that’s kind of not gonna happen but then if it does I don’t know what will I do because what happens after that other than that this product isn’t perfect but you do get what you pay for and if you want anything better you’re looking into the thousands so yeah
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 26, 2022
review_title: Do not stay on it long the first time you will thank me later

one_reviews_text: I find this strap really stabilizes the Quest 2 VR headset.  If there is a downside, you have to be careful how tight you tighten it because if it's too tight you may get a sore back of the head which can induce a headache.  It's all trial and error but the strap is easily adjustable so you can find the right tension for you.  It is still very stable with a much looser tightness of the strap for me.  I love it to be honest.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 28, 2021
review_title: It changed completely how I feel during game play, it's incredibly stabalizing for the Quest 2

one_reviews_text: Easy setup, easy to use, fun but takes some getting used to.Some advice though: shell out the extra money for the elite strap at the very least, and if possible the case. (I bought the elite strap with built-in extra battery and case.) Yes it's a bit pricey, but you wouldn't believe the difference in comfort. It's like night and day. Now if I can only find the time in my day to actually use the thing...
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 20, 2022
review_title: Amazing VR at a low price

one_reviews_text: Works Great - Great for kids and adults.  Expect to be buying some games right off the bat (additional cost - we spent about $200 since Christmas).  The only downside is that it doesn’t come with a case.  Hard to figure out how to delete free games and demos.  Also the hands don’t charge so if they die on me, I guess I will have to figure that one out.  I also wonder about storage space on the device, but we haven’t used up our space yet.  So far I rate it a 4/5.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 6, 2022

one_reviews_text: A great entry level VR headset.Pros:- stand-alone with good games-128gb base version, previously 64gb- wireless air link plays pc vr games well over 5ghz wifi 6-wireless-priceCons:- blurred peripheral- facebook login required (heard this is being removed?)- battery life ~2-3 hours- audio quality- head strap isn’t great (I think it’s ok but some people hate it)- inside out tracking can lose the controllers when reaching too far back- limited inter pupillary distance settingsI play in a 6x8 ft space and rarely need more space. The wireless air link works well with no major lag using a 5ghz wifi 6 router in the next room over.I am able to wear glasses with the headset without the glasses extension but find it a snug fit width wise. I have ordered a pair of prescription eye pieces to try out.Overall very happy.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 19, 2022

one_reviews_text: This is my first ever VR headset and I was amazed at the most little things that I did on it. I played games like Rec Room, Help wanted and loved every moment of it. It was an amazing experience for the first week but then I started to notice performance drops and network connection drops. This mostly happened within the quest 2 software. I tried quest link but it was slow because of the cable and laptop I had so I just decided to play on it standalone. I also hate the very low resolution of the quest 2. I know it is running standalone and it could look a lot better using a pc but the resolution is very bad. I'm sadly going to return this VR headset. I really loved it but I can't keep playing with such low resolution and uncertain software. Rec room is a light game and it didn't go well on the quest 2 because of the bad resolution and random lag that happens here and there.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 27, 2022
review_title: Laggy software. Very low resolution in games.

one_reviews_text: This is amazing, you will not be disappointed.  There is something in the App Store for everyone.  Some are free 😀, and most are very reasonable for what you’re getting.  Caution if using alone, if you stand for rollercoaster ride there is a good chance you will fall.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 6, 2022

one_reviews_text: The product is ok for the price but I have a big head so my glasses won't fit in there, the problem is that I have astigmatism which cause some parts of the images to be blury if I don't correct my vision with contact lenses or glasses, so I would have to wear contact lenses to see well which I don't have. My facebook account won't register and would freeze trying to login to the meta worlds, so because of those issues, i returned it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 15, 2022
review_title: Not desinged for people with big heads and astigmatism

one_reviews_text: This is my first time owning a VR headset and I absolutely love it, i can’t even explain how cool VR is and I love that this set is wireless so I don’t get tangled up or have to pin wires to the roof, it has a decent library of games and you can also hardwire it to a computer and play compatible VR games through PC, I highly recommend the Quest 2 for anyone who is thinking about getting a VR
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2022

one_reviews_text: Overall it is nice. It creates a virtual world for players. But there are some disadvantages. First, people will feel uncomfortable after they wear the headset for several hours. Second, compared to switch or ps5, the game on Oculus is fewer and more unitary. In addition, the battery time of Oculus quest 2 only lasts around 2 hours, which is too short. I have to say now I rarely played Oculus in my free time.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 6, 2022

one_reviews_text: It was a terrible way to start VR. On the set up screen after turning it on for the first time all I had was a frozen screen. There was no troubleshooting I could find online that could fix this. It took 3 weeks for me to receive the Oculus Quest 2 in the mail so I didn't want to wait another 6 weeks for a new one. But I did find a work around; I kept pushing the power button on and off quickly to see where my oculus touch controllers' are in the screen. It wasn't easy as I had to keep using references of the last location where my oculus touch were and the clicking sounds of the cursor moving over selectable options so I was essentially blind as a bat during the entire set up process.But after finally getting all the set up finished while blind the Oculus Quest 2 functions just fine without a frozen screen and I no longer needed to use the power button to see the last location of my oculus touch controllers are. This product could have been 5/5 stars but because of its Facebook requirements and the frozen first time set up screen it can only receive 3/5 stars from me. It works but the set up requires a very tricky work around.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 26, 2022

one_reviews_text: L’avenir de l’informatique et des ses nombreuses application passeras indéniablement par la réalité virtuelle. J’ai un plaisir fou a utilisé mon oculus. Que ce soit pour faire des visites virtuelles de lieux de ce monde que je ne risque pas de pouvoir visité, ou de jouer a des jeux très immersif. Vraiment cool. J’ai déjà hâte de voir a quoi ressembleras la RV dans 10 ans…
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 27, 2022

one_reviews_text: Edit: Oculus replaced the strap with a new one,  so that's nice, and we will see how long it lasts. However, my off brand cable no longer works, even though it was perfect for a while. I charges still so there is nothing wrong with the cable or port, my guess is they have some kind of proprietary lock out to prevent you from using an off brand cable.Product broke - seems to be a common issue. Perhaps there is something wrong with the plastic or design but It just cracked without me doing anything to it. I hope I can find an after market one because this cost a lot of money and honestly should have come with the headset to begin with. I hope they will refund me, but I doubt it. I will update if they do.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on July 8, 2021
review_title: Side strap broken after a few months (edited)

one_reviews_text: Quest 2 review (as of Quest 2 software v23):As far as VR goes, the quest 2 delivers. Image quality is great, and the included speakers do a great job. The controllers feel great, and the experiences are simply immersive to a point where it almost feels real.This is it, VR is ready for the masses. The Quest 2 is the most affordable one, and if you can get past the mandatory Facebook account issue, the Quest 2 is an awesome experience.However, it's not perfect. My qualms right now are twofold:1. Microphone doesn't work with PC VR link. It's been 2 months since launch and it's not fixed yet, that's 1 star off the score.2. The included strap is indeed pretty bad. You'll need the elite strap, so be sure to prepare to spend some more cash...Elite strap review:A must have if you buy a quest 2. The basic strap will become uncomfortable in about 20-30 minutes, completely unbearable of you're intent on playing a long session. This "elite" strap should be the one included with quest 2. Its fine, not extraordinary. It does it's job.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 1, 2020
review_title: Quest 2 is well worth it; elite strap is necessary evil

one_reviews_text: It's a pretty good case, it's fairly small and can perfectly fit the Quest 2, its controllers and even an Elite Strap if you buy one. However, any other accessories you may have and there's a good chance they won't fit here. I, for example, wasn't thrilled to buy the Elite Strap, so I decided to go with a third-party solution, but very few of them could actually fit into this case - so keep that in mind!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 7, 2021
review_title: Very elegant, but doesn't have a lot of space for other accessories

one_reviews_text: I dived right into VR without ever using it in the past and was very impressed and still am.  without the extra battery strap you will get over an hour of usage with the oculus head set.  For newbies, that's LOTS.  it will take time to get used to the weight of the vr head set and it takes time to get used to the hand controls.  I would not purchase the elite strap until you find that you are using up a full charge and still want to use it more.  keep in mind that the battery strap will add weight to system and it will take time again to build up your neck muscles so it doesn't hurt using the system.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 16, 2022
