review_title: Definitely The Future But a little Overwhelming for the Novice . But the Younger Gen understand

one_reviews_text: Product worked pretty good until 6 months into the 1 year warranty. Research Oculus’s track record with warranty claim support, they are notoriously shady and we are into our second month of a warranty claim debacle. Oculus claimed they never received the return although we had proof of delivery, then they mysteriously found our headset only to now be claiming they’ve misplaced it once again!  I just googled “oculus warranty” and this appears to be a thing with Meta.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 13, 2022
review_title: Don’t expect warranty support from Meta

one_reviews_text: 1. Not use Facebook account for 10 years because Facebook sucks2. Buy Oculus Quest 23. Go to forgot password and follow steps via confirmations through my personal email4. Successfully login to Facebook and everything works5. Update privacy settings to make things more private as lots has changed in 10 years6. Enable two factor authentication because it's appropriate security practice7. Receive notification my account may be compromised because of enabling two factor8. Requested to send selfie video turning my head side to side and copy of government photo ID9. Request accepted and goes into the void with no ETA, etc10. Start seeing the "Approve login" screens in Facebook that only give me an option to login if I can approve it from a device/computer I have used recently (kind of hard with no FB for a decade)11. Facebook replies my government issued photo ID that I can use to vote, seek medical care, provide as ID to banks is not good enough and gives no option to even try again12. Arrive at Oculus support and this ticket after 2 days. They can only apologize and offer a refund13. Have a new reason to hate FacebookI didn't expect it to be great, but this is just awful. Don't buy a Quest because it can happen to you too! I should add because Facebook does not allow ALT accounts Oculus specifically warned me not to create one and if I do I can expect both my original and new Facebook accounts to be banned. I should also not buy anything. They literally told me to not spend money and it might be easier to just not use Oculus.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 4, 2022
review_title: The 13 steps to having a Quest 2 paper weight

one_reviews_text: I don't understand why so many people claim you should order the elite strap. I didn't, and the basic elastic strap works great if you set it properly. I suspect too many people set the strap too tight or too loose and never bother to take the time to adjust it. I've lent my headset to several people with heads of different sizes - you learn to adjust the tightness to a comfortable level for everyone very quickly after some practice.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 21, 2021
review_title: Works great as-is. Don't bother with the elite strap.

one_reviews_text: I had a distorted pixel in my unit, called customer service for an exchange. First they asked me to take a screenshot in VR for dead pixel (are you kidding me??), then when I took the picture with my phone facing the lens, they accepted the issue but they said the exchange unit could be refurbished! (refurbished??). I spent 450$ to get a refurbished unit?I had a battery malfunction in my mower, the mower manufacturer sent me a new one, these facebook guys are not even willing to send a new one for a defected unit  😤
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 14, 2022

one_reviews_text: I love this headset, and would highly, highly recommend it to anyone who is just starting VR (With some exceptions)!The issues I encountered caused a bit of a finicky start up. Additionally, you NEED a facebook account (unless you have an oculus account). If your facebook account is in bad standing, I WOULD RECOMMEND TO STAY CLEAR OF THIS HEADSET!Additionally, the headset only recognized my rear USB ports as 3.0 (even though all of my USB ports are 3.0). If you purchase this with intentions to use it on PC, which most do, YOU MUST have a compatible USB C (USB 3.2 Certified, however you can use as low as 2.0, with degraded visuals/performance) cable, unless you can figure out how "Oculus Air Link" works, and you're okay with latency that way. Oculus sells a cable themselves, but it's not cheap.Overall, a great purchase, especially on sale.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 8, 2022

one_reviews_text: First off, this thing is awesome. You can't get a better deal for a VR than this right here. Yes, you have to have an FB account, but to experience entry level and even some mid to high level VR experiences for only 400 bucks AND it's completely wireless? That's amazing!A few things that take the final star away are the comfort of the strap that comes with the console. Very bad, makes switching to other people a pain. The lenses also only have 3 settings for IPD which is kind of important for VR. Thankfully you can kinda get it stuck in between two if it's really that bad for you.Tracking was good, just have to make sure you keep the controllers in front of you and that the room is well lit.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 22, 2021

one_reviews_text: My son plays with this one all the time. I also tried it and it’s amazing. I wish I wasn’t prone to motion sickness because I would love to use it on a regular basis… it really makes me sick after just a few minutes of play. I do t like the fact you need a Facebook account to use it but it’s really good nonetheless.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 7, 2022

one_reviews_text: Great device!The entire family gets a kick out of this, kids to grandparents.Worth the money, hands down.No reliabilty issues for us.  Just ensure you have a bit of space so you don't hit a wall or chair with your hands, though the safety features prevent alot of this.Really blew my mind!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 4, 2022

one_reviews_text: this oculus came open already by someone else.  I had red food of some sort that had been dropped inside the box.  We were missing 2 pieces,  it even had instructions for some ones fuji camera inside the box.  For the money I paid I was not impressed that you would send out a returned item that was clearly opened.  You really upset my grandson as he thought he was able to play with it.  But I was not keeping something that some one else clearing had and took out what they needed and sent back.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 21, 2022

one_reviews_text: The VR itself is great, but try as I might, I just can’t get the device to sit comfortably on my head, forehead, nose. Even bought a different head strap. But, it’s just too front-heavy. Which is why I don’t use it that much after the initial novelty wore off. Pity. They need to create a lighter, less bulky, version.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 16, 2022
review_title: VR is Great But Device is Uncomfortable

one_reviews_text: I bought the Oculus Quest 2 as a gift for myself because I wanted to spoil myself. I was a bit skeptical about VR, but the moment I jumped into it I was super impressed and blown away. There is so much to do and the control/detail is amazing. I can't believe VR is this immersive - I have fallen in love! There are so many games and experiences, I don't think I will ever get tired of this. I have been taking this with me to all the parties I attend to share the experience with my family and friends and they all love it. I have actually influenced 5 of my friends to purchase this because they loved the experience as well. If you purchase one you will not be disappointed! Cheers!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 28, 2021
review_title: OMG this is the greatest thing ever!

one_reviews_text: Facebook did a great job on this device. The screen resolution, the built-in sound and my favorite, being able to use the device without the hand controller.. it has 4 built-in cameras that allow the user to just use their hands four all the gestures.. there is also lots of security features so you don't bump into thinks or people.. I like it a lot.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 1, 2021
review_title: This is definitely worth the price

one_reviews_text: Very developed home setup, normal web browser, fully featured, fast. you can multitask 3 6' browser windows and see your room at the same time (b/w and grainy, but useful). Text is perfectly readable. You can use netflix, prime video, you tube with custom vr apps. As of today, it still needs a facebook account, this was announced as going away in 2022.I entered my black friday code by editing the order after it did one click, don't do this, it doesn't work, there was an email you are supposed to get, cancel and try again for any amazon promotional credits, I lost out on $70 cdn towards a future purchase, and support isn't going to help. But the device is woth buying at full price.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 12, 2021
review_title: you can see with the headset on, find your controllers, your coffee, very nice

one_reviews_text: Oculus has since pulled the item from their stores, i would hope amazon does as well.At the very least refunds are in order.This is due to a quality issue from Oculus, there are widespread reports of cracking and premature breakage.Fitment is fantastic though, it really changes the game compared to the classic strap.Very comfortable solution for a decent price.Amazon, please chime in on the return/refund scenario?mine is still holding up, but only because I am being extremely careful. Over the top for such a product...should not be as fragile as glass...
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 29, 2020
review_title: great fitment and comfort, poor quality control

one_reviews_text: Such a crazy experience. Ive had it less than a day and here are the big things ive learned.- Such an amazing experience so much fun- Beginners like me will feel a little motion sickness to start- You will lose awareness of where you are in room so the boundary thing is important.Only reason this is only 4 stars is simply the battery life kind of sucks. your getting maybe 2 hours of play time with the battery before you need to charge. Obviously using a link cable will pro long this and having an extra battery will help too. Id say anyone wanting long play sessions needs either the batter or a link cable of some kind to keep the headset charged.As well as the battery being small the requirement for a fakebook account sucks. I don't like Facebook at all they're definitely sus all the time , but i do think they are going to remove the requirement eventuallyOverall though an amazing product i hope they keep building on it
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 12, 2022

one_reviews_text: These all have a manufacturing defect that cause them to crack at weak points on the sides.  If you have one, send it back now.  It will break sooner or later.  I got ours from Amazon and I'll absolutely be sending it back.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on November 27, 2020

one_reviews_text: I really enjoy the product it definitely provides lots of enjoyment and it works great. The motion capture on the remotes is flawless. The machine itself works like a dream. Unfortunately the games available are sort of half baked video games that have been adapted for use on a vr system. Most camera functions across several games operate as a 45 degree “snap” rather than a fluid motion. There are exceptions ofcourse but this seems to be the default camera operation.The games available are all essentially the same game; a collection of community based mini games with a shooter, a sword type game or boxing. It seems motion based gaming was innovated by wii sports and since then absolutely no progress has been made. Though this complaint is more so directed at game developers rather than the product.I would recommend this product only if you are looking for a fun, low stakes minigame type of experience.If you are looking for a robust, varied gaming experience this product is not for you.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2022

one_reviews_text: This strap is a must, I don't know why they don't just increase the base price of the Quest 2 to include this. It's a night and day difference. With the stock strap I found my face and head getting sore after 30mins of use. With the elitestrap I can game for hours with no problem, absolutely worth it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 21, 2020
review_title: Night n day improvement, great buy

one_reviews_text: Use it only for PCVR, wired. Don't buy the Oculus cable, buy a Kiwi one. It works great for all types of games, the tracking is good, I don't notice any screen-door affect, and the headset is light and comfortable. For the people saying that the stock headband is bad, they are using it wrong.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 2, 2022

one_reviews_text: I like the case, it fits all the Oculus gear as bought perfectly, as well as the elite strap if you opt for that. Be careful though, there isnt much room for much else. If you plan on adding grips, battery packs, silicone bumpers, etc. Then a larger case may suit you better.I'll lake get a different 2nd for a battery pack, cleaning wipes, and a couple other things I like to have when I leave home with the headset.I do wish it was a little more rugged, its carrying around some expensive gear, i find the top cover a little flimsy. aesthetically pleasing though, and a very good footprint size wise.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 17, 2021
review_title: Good case, not much room for extras.

one_reviews_text: Get a nice adjustable headpiece and silicone face liner right off the bat.  Those parts are not great but all the money to create this has been sunk into that block in front of your eyes.  Must be a generational thing but I don't know how anyone could give this a bad review and not be amazed by how much tech has advanced.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 4, 2022

one_reviews_text: We are A non gaming family. Beginner friendly, especially using the available youtube videos forbeginers. So much fun has been had already :)))Have already Referred this product to friends :))) Once Again, fast shipping which is important to us, & we pay for! Very very happy :)
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 2, 2022

one_reviews_text: Was hard to get a pin# for purchases. Headset itself is brilliant. The birth of the halodeck. 5 stars for headset itself.Really need to get support staff more training. Hours of useless chat with support ,my son got the link I needed in 10 minutesWhy didn't support staff give me that link?
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2022
review_title: My son was more useful than Oculus support

one_reviews_text: Cadeau de Noel pour mon garçon, mais le reste de la famille en profite également.  Pour l'instant, mon garçon semble bien apprécié ses nouvelles lunettre VR.  Pour ma part, c'était la premiere essaie de lunette VR et j'ai vraiment aimé!!!!  J'aime bien les vidéos VR360 que l'ont trouve sur Youtube VR ainsi que l'application Wander pour ceux qui aime voyager et aller voir différents endroit dans le monde.  Pour les jeux, car semble pas mal intéressant également.  On va voir a l'utilisation si les commentaires reste les meme, mais pour l'instant, très satisfait.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 30, 2021

one_reviews_text: I found it's a bit difficult to play video games due to a seasickness feeling after just 10 min of playing. I couldn't get used to it even after a considerable amount of time. But I have to admit that porno movies on this device are something definitely worth trying.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 6, 2022

one_reviews_text: Unbelievable how far tech has come from my Colecovision . It's insane how realistic the experience is . My son loves it but I can only tolerate it for a short while ..I get motion sickness from it . Doesn't come with any games which is kind of ridiculous considering the price .
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 28, 2021

one_reviews_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



 LOVE the oculus quest 2 headset! Perfect way to exercise indoors, super addicted to the racket nx game. No complaints with this product
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 16, 2022

one_reviews_text: I didn't have much problems with the original strap, but I'm also used to the weight of the Quest 1.Thought I'd give the Elite strap a try and won't be going back to the original strap now.It takes even more weight off your face and is very easy to adjust.Once adjusted I don't fidget with it like I used to with my Quest 1, just adjust it once and good to go.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 21, 2020

one_reviews_text: If your a person who gets motion sickness , driving in a car looking down etc DO NOT try vr lol used it for maybe an hour over the span of a couple days and was sick for a week. Nauseous all day, head felt like it was gonna explode and just walking or turning my head faster would induce vertigo to the point of running into walls and falling over. Imagine being motion sick stuck on a spinning ride… for 7-8 days. Medication does not help tried it all, you will have to just except your life sucks for a week haha the equipment was awesome but you couldn’t pay me enough to ever put one on again haha
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 17, 2022

one_reviews_text: Been wanting to try VR for a while.  Bought a quest 2 128 GB because it is much more reasonably priced than other headsets.  Bought it through Amazon because of their return policy -- if it made me sick, it was going back.  Fortunately, I am not prone to motion sickness and VR is great for simulation games.  Remove 1 star because it currently still requires a Facebook account.  Not sure I will continue to use Facebook, err Meta products in the future, but I am very happy with the quest for now and can wait to see what the future brings for new headsets.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 9, 2022

one_reviews_text: The oculus quest 2 is amazing, I really enjoyed playing and all the awesome games that are on the platform. I used the oculus link which made it possible to play steam games on the quest. The only downfall i have is that i start getting a bit of motion sickness after playing an hour. I would really like to keep this but vr isn't for me as I almost threw up haha. Great tech to own.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 7, 2021

one_reviews_text: It's really cool but I think the lenses need more adjustments. Blurry unless everything is perfectly lined up and even then it's a bit off. The games aren't great and cost a lot for what they are. I recommend using a USB c cable and just using it to play pc vr games.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 21, 2022
review_title: Sort of blurry, not a lot of included software.

one_reviews_text: So happy I got this. Makes it a lot nicer to use the oculus quest 2.***edit*** unfortunately it broke. The plastic arm seems to have gotten hard and quite brittle over time and to much quick movements seem to have cracked the arm and then break off entirely :(Extremely sad cause it is really nice to use. Only one star off cause of it breaking.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on August 31, 2021
review_title: So glad I got this (edit it snapped)

one_reviews_text: C'est toute une expérience. Pas toujours simple en ce qui me concerne mais cela est probablement dû à mon âge avancé. C'est dommage d'être obligé d'avoir un compte Facebook. On passe des moments agréables.Je suis content de cet achat. Le casque est très performant.

one_reviews_text: Le produit en tant que tel est supérieur à la sangle de base. L'ajustement est adéquat, confortable. Malheureusement, l'item s'est brisé après environ 3 mois et demi d'utilisation normale, 1 ou 2 heures par jour. Si on veut se plaindre, il faut passer par le service à la clientèle... qui aime bien ignorer les clients, si j'en juge par mon expérience (ce n'est pas le premier problème avec l'appareil).J'aurais dû y aller avec d'autres produits, comme le HTC.

review_title: 3 mois et demi d'utilisation... déjà brisé

one_reviews_text: It's like a little egg that contains a whole other universe, lol! It's great! Everything fits nicely. I upgraded my head strap to that one with the battery pack (I forget what it's called but it adds 2 hrs to your battery life and has a twist adjust on the back) and it still fits nicely in this case :)
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 12, 2021

one_reviews_text: There are much better alternatives that are more sturdy and rigid than this junk. This is over-priced and low quality. Mine broke about 3 months in and I have applied for the warranty. It's been months and they still have not sent the return label to get a new strap. Their customer support is the worst I have seen to the date and I would never buy any products from oculus ever again.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 23, 2021

one_reviews_text: je viens d'acheter un Oculus quest 2 il étais déchargé a arrive cela fait 2 jours qu'il est sur la charge et il est à 25 % j'ai pu crée mon compte faire une zone de protection et plus batterie après 20 min :(J'utilise le câble et chargeur inclus dans la boite.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 16, 2021

one_reviews_text: This strap is on the pricey end, but worth the price of admission.  Compared to the strap that comes packaged with the Oculus, this is a huge upgrade.  Much more comfortable experience and has allowed me to play high-intensive games like Beat Saber for prolonged periods of time.  Overall, if you're serious about playing VR for extended periods of time, then this strap is a must have.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 1, 2020

one_reviews_text: Can't get over how fun this is. I bought it for my family but am secretly playing until Christmas. I can't think of a bigger bang for the buck when it comes to entertainment. I'll leave the technical details to other savvy reviewers. All I can say is I highly recommend this VR headset. And get the elite strap with the extra battery. Totally worth it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 8, 2021
review_title: It's amazing, what else can I say?

one_reviews_text: Ce casque est une technologie celons moi prometteuse, mais pas assez développer à mon goût. Seul, il n'est pas utile et semi-immersif. Si vous avez le mal du transport, éviter puisqu'au bout de 15 minutes, vous aurez très vite la nausée. Si vous désirez en acheter un, je vous conseil d'acheter les objets supplémentaires qui vous permettent d'avoir une expérience véritablement immersive. Cependant, les prix risquent de monter très vite.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 17, 2022

one_reviews_text: The controllers joysticks will fail within weeks of owning them. This is a known problem by oculus and the support is horrible to deal with. It's made by facebook, a company famous for not caring about its customers. Would not buy again
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 25, 2022

one_reviews_text: Quest 2 has became a new way for my family to exercise. The wireless VR just works well and price for the Quest 2 is extremely reasonable. Make sure to check out the fitness VR apps, they really help keep you in shape.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 8, 2022

one_reviews_text: Waste of money, very boring quickly, much too heavy on your face, headaches for all who used it for 20 min and that was sharing it, so each person wore it 3-5 min then the next personBig talk.. poor value
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 5, 2022

one_reviews_text: After barely a week of use, the cheap plastic on both sides already started breaking and forming large cracks from top to bottom. Even tried gluing the damn thing to give it an extra layer... Didn't work. This thing is so brittle it's probably cheaper than a stupid McDonald's happy meal toy. This is a joke of a product, considering the hefty price. I'd honestly purchase any of the knockoffs over this.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 1, 2021
review_title: Comfort was there... Durability was not!

one_reviews_text: It's pretty great, infinitely better than the regular strap that comes with the quest 2. A problem is that it starts to hurt when wearing for a while, not particularly great for prolonged play but odds are it'll stop hurting or you won't be playing for that long. the mechanism that loosens and tightens the strap is also pretty loud, and the strap itself feels really fragile so don't be too violent with it.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on April 22, 2021
review_title: Must have product with some flaws

one_reviews_text: The headset itself is amazing, I bought it for me and my brother to use because i have a pc and standalone mode is really good in of itself but I ran into an incident playing thrill of the fight where the head strap it came with wasn't tight enough and it just sucks in general and it slipped off my head, hit the ground, and the facial interface cracked. it still works pretty fine, I have yet to get a replacement so just a heads up, you should probably buy a new head strap along with the headset.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 25, 2022
review_title: Works well, but I ran into some issues

one_reviews_text: The quest works very well with my pc even with my low specs, I have a Geforce GTX 750, Intel Core I5 3470 (Tm), my game may not have the maximum fps i should have yet, still have a good 30 fps on a 60 hz monitor. Battery usage is low in term of hours, only 3 so far but chargable as you play which is pretty good, The only issue i've had so far is with the oculus air link not connecting to my pc. I had to buy an application which was 25$ on the oculus app for me to be able to connect myself on my pc. Very good product!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 30, 2022

one_reviews_text: Best entry level headset you can buy right now. The head strap is okay but at this price it’s hard to complain, the elite strap is worth the extra money.Almost no screen door effect on the display and has a high resolution. Headstrap headphones aren’t bad but it does have a headphone jack if you want to use your own good headphones.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 3, 2022
review_title: Great value for money, good way to get into VR

one_reviews_text: It is a very useful and necessary piece to have, but I wish they'd made the arms a bit stronger. This is the second one I purchased. When I had the first one, I tried to lift up the headset by the arm and it cracked. I glued the arm and used it for a while, but it couldn't make it. Lesson learned. Lift the set by its head.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on August 1, 2021
review_title: Necessary But Fragile - This is My Second One

one_reviews_text: Used for about a week and has a dead pixel on the top right, the calibration system is a little buggy at times. Games are very fun especially with friends and games like Swords and Sorcery are great for building muscle while having fun. Overall I’d recommend this but make sure to return before it’s too late if has any problems

one_reviews_text: So this is an amazing device. The games are fun and it’s a nice little escape. Unfortunately the reason for the 1 star is I have to keep it lugged in or it died within 10 minutes. Not fun with a 2FT cord.

one_reviews_text: A 6.5ft x 6.5ft play area is recommended, but it's smart to also consider the height. If you can raise your hands to your ceiling, it may interfere with gameplay until you're used to not putting your hands too high.

one_reviews_text: This cord deserves 4 stars due to the fact it can be ruined by getting twisted up. It’s a type of cord that doesn’t like being twisted at all, it needs to be treated very carefully. Kinda dumb for something where you might move around.

one_reviews_text: Got a pair of these and they are an amazing add on for the OQ2. The build feels sturdy and haven’t broke on us after a month and makes strapping on the Oculus a lot easier, quicker and comfortable.  I recommend this product.

one_reviews_text: Awesome experience.  Many apps, games and media content.  They really nailed the 3D effects, very realistic.  Not so comfortable.  The fabric strap doesn't hold the heavy headset for long.  Your face carries the brunt.  Will purchase the Elite Strap with Battery.

one_reviews_text: Arrived really quickly, which resulted in my kid getting his Xmas present early, but that's my own fault. He loves it, was easy for him to set up and use and it's really really fun and cool. Def a great purchase

one_reviews_text: I love the Occulas quest 2 its great, however, I have been paying into Amoazon Prime for a while. I ordered the Occulas quest 2 when it said it was available for prime shipping. My package did arrive after 3 or 4 days, but that is not 1 day or same day shipping like I have been paying for Prime for. one_reviews_text: I have to say, after my first three hours of playing around with the Oculus Quest 2, I’m impressed. I purchased the 128gb version from Best Buy but wanted to leave a review here for everyone to see.Set up is super easy, head strap adjustment is equally easy. Headset feels very durable and high quality. I could go on and on. I have loved VR Since the first time I tried it So this purchase was definitely not a disappointment. My only complaint is it didn’t come with earbuds or headphones. The internal speakers on the headset do not go loud enough to put out enough bass for my taste. I’d love to be able to connect my headset via Bluetooth to my television sound bar but apparently Bluetooth connectivity has been taken out of the menu. I guess I’m gonna have to find some headphones If I want the bass I’m looking for. Updates to come Once I’ve tried the headset with headphones.If you’re trying to decide I’m buying a VR,this one is definitely worth the money. Best part is, you don’t require a PC!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 18, 2022
review_title: Look no further for your next stand-alone VR headset

one_reviews_text: I'm not going to go deep into details like head tracking and tech specs on this review as those are readily  available everywhere. This will be more about my experience with the system and software and user experience.First off, as far as a nice entry level system to get into the world of VR this one is it. Its ability to use it stand alone, or tethered is a game changer, and the price for what you get is more than acceptable. The packaging is well designed and the materials and build quality are quite nice. The unit comes with the 2 controllers the VR unit. the head strap, charging cable, and a spacer for anyone who wears glasses. The head strap that comes with the unit is serviceable, but it's hard to get a nice tight fit and the headpiece tends to slip and slide, especially when moving around a lot. I would suggest one of the first things you do, is get an elite strap, as it makes a world of difference. Especially if you are sharing the system with others as it's can be difficult to adjust the fit with the original strap.After getting everything set up and powering on my unit I ran into the first problem. In order to use this system you must have a Facebook account. Not that big of a deal, but it does mean that everything you do on the unit will be tracked by Facebook. Any movies or games, or even websites you visit will be tracked and we all know how well Facebook respects everyones privacy…The second problem I ran into was trying to set up the wifi. For some reason it would not display any networks that were available and even using the companion app I couldn't get it to connect. After a bit of research I discovered that this is a know problem with a few suggestions fo fix it. I tried a few with no success and eventually the only thing that worked was resetting the system to factory.After that I was up and running and quickly playing some VR games. There are some fantastic titles for the unit available and finding and installing new games was intuitive and easy. Besides the few minor bumps getting everything up and running I was super impressed with the unit and it is amazingly fun to play and use. The Oculus 2 is capable of tethering to a computer to run some more graphic intensive games and Oculus sells a cable, however there are some other 3rd party cables that are around 1/2 the price that seem to work fine. All in, if you are looking to take a dive into the world of VR this unit is the perfect place to start
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 24, 2021
review_title: An amazing VR unit with a few small hiccups

one_reviews_text: My son let me try his 64gb unit and I was so impressed that when the newer version arrived I bought one.As the pictures show you I also bought a halo head strap and new facial interface but these are not must buys but I do like both purchases.The vr technology does deliver and is certainly vertigo inducing if not careful.It is worth mentioning that this is not a game console such as we’re used to. I doubt you’ll be buying 10-20 games  for this like you would a ps4 or Nintendo Switch.There are no games like Far Cry or Final Fantasy the hardware just can’t support it.Although an apples and oranges comparison it looks like ps2 or ps3 graphics might be the best if that helps.But what it can do it does incredibly well.Games like Beat Sabre, Racquet Nx, Space Pirate, and others really do envelop you in difference worlds and can give you a real workout.Just don’t expect this to replace a Switch or ps4 let alone the newer consoles and remember you must have a Facebook account
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on September 2, 2021

one_reviews_text: What an absolute marketing disaster.I have no words for how bad this product is.I can only say the following:You now need two accounts to use this device- an Oculus account and a Facebook account.Both of these accounts are forced to use two-way authentication by phone.  If your phone number dies or you get another one, you're screwed.I was with tech support for *hours* trying to solve this problem.  Email authentication is still being figured out.  Terrible product.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on October 26, 2021

one_reviews_text: I did have cardboard just to experience VR (plop a phone into a cardboard box). Of course, this is more expensive, but I think it's money well spent. It's even gotten my old man moving again with table tennis. Yes, it is THAT easy to use. Minimal setup, good graphics quality, and easy to use, I'd have to say I'm very impressed with this.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 23, 2022
review_title: First experience with a real VR, and it's absolutely impressive

one_reviews_text: While my kids enjoy the product, my experience with their customer support has been the worst I've ever experienced.  I would recommend purchasing this product from Amazon as I'm sure they will offer better service than buying direct, like I did.  We purchased a elite headset with battery and I'm certain hey sent a refurbished unit since when it broke, it was apparent the unit had been GLUED to hold it together.  Getting customer support to even reply was painful.  Finally, they sent a return shipping label, but stated we would likely get a refurbished item and not new.  To this, I complained and insisted on a new unit.  They then changed their tune saying 'of course it would be a new unit'.  We have now returned the unit and have been waiting forever for the exchange.  Again, they will not answer my messages.  When they have answered, they just say they will respond in 3-5 days (which they don't).  The last thing was they made me track down the copies of the shipping label together with proof of delivery from Purolator, which I did.  They have been "looking into it" for about 2 weeks now.  Honestly, you shouldn't buy their product.  Wait for a better VR from the competition.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on March 7, 2022

one_reviews_text: not bad for a vr but compared to my experience in montreal at zero latency, it's not worth it. the biggest flaw with it, it's de black ring that you see around the eye witch will break the full imersion and gave me some sickness.the strap ain't much conftable at all and finding the good point of view.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 4, 2022

one_reviews_text: Oculus is unable to help with simple issue that I have with the Facebook account I wanted to use for this.Customer support only available in chat and email. Takes days for them to get back at you to tell you the same story over and over again.I can not connect with my account and they will not let me return the headset, since the 30 days are up.The thing is sitting here being absolutely useless to me as you require a FB account to use it. Thanks for wasting my time and money!!!!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 15, 2022

one_reviews_text: I always make the joke that the Oculus commercials took weeks just to get the actual VR to play the game they wanted.Since I've received the Quest 2, I have found some extreme drawbacks.For positives, if you are looking to simply blow money on a product in which the total amount of games accumulate less of a value than your actual headset, this is for you.That's it for positives, now onto the negatives."Air Link" as they call it - is nonfunctioning. Your Quest App will tell you that your PC doesn't meet the specifications, though mine has a 3080 XTREME with a Ryzen 9 5900X.Clearly not the case.You can waste $100 on a cable, just for the exact same outcome.Air Link will make my PC crash almost instantly. No games work / are compatible / are even playable.The Quest 2 is mainly a very, very beginning step into the world of VR.Save your money.Buy a Valve Index.- From somebody who sold their Quest 2, and bought an Index. And hasn't looked back since.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 20, 2021

one_reviews_text: Pros:Cheap (for a great VR experience)Standalone (no PC required)Good game selection - decent pricing (compared w console prices)Well thought out safety features (Guardian + Zones etc.)Visual Passthrough to see what's around you.Lots of software updates (active development)Content quality (games, vr experiences) are very goodHeadset (even with basic strap) is very comfortable (at least for an hour I've found).Ability to stream headset content to a TV (Chromecast, Phone App etc.)Youtube VR is excellent for contentCons:Facebook account needed - though I've created one just for the Quest so no bother re: privacy etc.Not obvious how to clean foam (esp. when playing workout games)Not sure how much love already released games get.Battery Life is OK.Overall - highly recommend - definitely heaps of fun!
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 6, 2021
review_title: Great headset - excellent game selection - fun Covid pastime!

one_reviews_text: Beware! I am 3 for 3, with receiving a used unit.First of all, there was no cushioning in the shipping box. Instead, it had a single piece of parcel paper, draped over the contents. I just want meta to know how their retailers are shipping their products.This unit is clearly used and scuffed up. It even comes with some free DNA!I don't really feel to keen on putting this on my face.A little history: I have purchased the quest 2 128gb unit 3 times, now, in only the passed month or so, and every single one of them has been used and/or defective. The first 2 units I received were not from amazon, but from another online marketplace, but still through the official oculus store. They were both uncleaned and used and they both had left controller drift issues within 3 days of use, and one had display problems.This is why I decided to try amazon. I thought maybe, just maybe, I'd get a decent, NEW unit. But nope! I guess meta is just selling uncleaned returns, with fresh shrink wrapping.Have a look at my images. I have a couple macro images in there, to show the gouge near one of the cameras. There are scuffs and stains all over it. But the worst part is the nose grease from some unknown stranger accompanied by old dust and who knows what else is in that fabric.In these times, you'd think meta would take better care and clean their products properly. And maybe stop selling used stuff as new. It's bad enough that they only really give you refurbs when you call in a warranty. But now I think the refurb days are over, because my last 3 units were definitely beaten up, and anything but new, and unused. It's just sad when you spend a fortune and receive a used and/or broken product, over and over.
review_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 2, 2022
review_title: The device is clearly used and not cleaned well.

one_reviews_text: 画像の通り、ポッキリ折れました。通常の使用しかしてません。折れた時の状況を説明すると、かぶろうとした瞬間頭にかぶろうとすこし力を籠めたら折れました。使用期間は１か月経っているかいないかくらい。使用頻度は週2，3度程度。もともとプラスチック製で、ちゃっちな作りと取付方法があまりにも力任せな感じだったので細さも併せて不安でしたが問題なく装着できたのでそのまま使用してました。頭の後ろのノズルをまわすと締め付けたり緩めたりできますが、毎回調整するのは手間なのである程度ちょうどいい位置にしたまま頭の装着や取り外しを行ってました。若干力がかかる使い方をしていたのは否定しませんが、こうもあっさり簡単に折れてしまうとは思わず、正直呆然としました。純正ストラップとレンズを安くする代わりに高くてもちゃんとしたストラップを提供してくれると思ってただけに、このエリートストラップもお金をかけて作られているようには見えず、頑丈さもなく、プラスチックなので伸縮性もなく、あっさり折れるというくそ仕様でした。もともと締め付けるように使うパーツなので、きつく締め付ければその分力がかかります。でも力が分散するところがなく、特に細いプラスチック部分に引っ張られる力がかかりやすい構造上の問題で使用者全員そう遠くないうちに全員折れると思いますので、購入はしないことをお勧めします。
review_date: Reviewed in Japan on November 15, 2020
review_title: 他の方も描いてる通りポッキリ折れました。値段の価値はありません。

Guess what, there wasnt, so I have a nice cable that I cant use as I dont have a usb c port on my pc without  buying an adapter

one_reviews_text: Not a great deal i can say about a head strap so just a few pros and the one conPros....Very well made sturdy but of kit.Makes a huge difference to the vr experience on the quest 2.Makes putting on and removing  the headset a lot quicker and easier.Should stay cleaner for longer and easier to clean unlike the standard strap.Cons...Over priced for what basically is a piece of plastic although be it adjustable. No expensive electical components inside, no different sizes or fitment to accommodate, no screens. Just a piece of plastic so no idea how they come to the price tag of 49 quid.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 23, 2020

one_reviews_text: It's a lot better than the Quest1 strap and the cheap one they give you on Quest2. I just wish they put the weight on the top of your forehead like PSVR/Rift-S. Comfort should be before portability especially when all you need is a bigger case to fix the portability issue.The other issue is that the fan is working so hard the vibrations are traveling across the rigid elite strap and into my headphones. I get a constant hum from the fan vibrations.They should of used a vapor chamber or a little bit of copper in the heatsink to reduce how hard the fan has to work. And stop the fan vibrations.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 19, 2020

one_reviews_text: 正直このお値段はヘビーですよ。注文のクリックは30秒くらい躊躇いました。でも取り付けてみたらね、僕のquest2が全くの別物になってしまったんですよ。まず確認しておきたいのが、quest2のノーマルのストラップだとゴーグルがずり落ちてきますよねって事ですよ。きっとこの商品を買おうか迷ってるってことは僕と同じ苦悩を抱えてるんじゃないかなと。ずり落ちを防ぐためにきつく締めると今度は頭が痛くなるし、いい感じに納まったぁ！と思うとなんだかピンぼけしてしまっていたりと、問題アリアリなノーマルストラップなんですよね。でもこのエリートストラップを買えば、この辺の問題がバッチリ消えうせます。マジです。海外勢の方のレビューを見ると交換前後であんまし変わんねぇぜ...みたいなのがありますが、多分日本人くらい頭の凹凸具合が乏しくないんじゃないですかね。個人的にはこのお値段は痛手でしたが、今後の快適を買ったと思えば安いもんかなぁと思える出来栄えでした。以上、長文失礼致しました。 草々
review_date: Reviewed in Japan on October 17, 2020
review_title: 君のquest2を全く別物へと進化させるための追加アイテム

one_reviews_text: This is one of those things where you get what you pay for. Having bought a cheaper alternative that claims it's "This is the next best alternative to the official Oculus Quest Link Cable." I can categorically state that it isn't. In this case there's nothing better than the genuine article.  I know it's not the cheapest but there's a reason for that. If you want to enjoy your expensive Oculus Quest 2 headset on a PC you'll want to get this cable. You can always try the WiFi 6 method but that's another kettle of fish altogether.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 4, 2020

one_reviews_text: I'll start off by saying, I personally thought the original Quest 2 strap was... okay, but I ordered the Elite in advance from watching YouTube reviews.I'm so glad I did.I find the Elite strap to be a significant improvement not only in comfort but stability as well. When I'm playing games like Beat Saber, Pistol Whip or Vader Immortal I move around alot, which made stability iffy sometimes, the Elite strap solves this entirely. Highly recommended.

review_title: Significantly better than the original strap!

one_reviews_text: 100€ por un cable, pensarás que al menos al ser de tan buena calidad te permitirá jugar a la vez que tienes conectado el cable. No es así, aunque lo conectes directamente a una placa base que tenga conexión usb tipo c como es mi caso lo único que va a hacer es que la batería se descargue más lento pero eso de cargar y jugar a la vez olvídate. No vale en absoluto la pena y no recomiendo gastarse 100€ en esto, pilla uno de aliexpress por 15€
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on February 3, 2021

one_reviews_text: is it worth the price? No.  Plus I needed to install a USB-C card in my pc. I actually get a better experience using virtual desktop software for playing my PC VR games to the quest 2.  On the plus side, it does charge and 90hz will hopefully come once out of beta for the cable.  But even so, 89 for a cable is bonkers.  A good usb-a cable seems to work well enough, try that first.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 14, 2020

one_reviews_text: Was concerned about the original strap so thought it would be worthy to invest in the 'elite'  strap, to my disappointment despite the size adjustments working well, the comfort level has little to no improvement compared to the original. Love the quest but cannot justify buying the strap for anyone else considering.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 14, 2020
review_title: Not a big step up from default

one_reviews_text: Se avete soldi da buttare e siete fissati con l’avere tutto originale e ufficiale non leggete neanche quello che sto per scrivere.Consiglio di leggere l'aggiornamento in fondo.Ho aggiunto un secondo aggiornamento in cui ho tolto una stella.Spero questo serva a chi cerca un prodotto di qualità e che non ha voglia di perdere tempo.Materiali:Rispetto alla borsa del primo quest i materiali sono molto scadenti.È un uovo di plastica, non molto rigida. Al tocco sembra un cartone ricoperto di pelucchi di cotone o lana. Saranno gusti ma a me sinceramente non piace per niente, anche per una questione igienica, se lo sporcate dubito seriamente che riuscirete a pulirlo riportandolo all’aspetto originale. In più io ho i classici calli da sala pesi, non vi dico che fastidio accarezzandolo, sentire tutti quei fili che fanno attrito 😒 quasi come sfregare sul velcro.L’interno ha lo stesso stile dell’esterno ma di colore più scuro. Se entra polvere non penso sia facile riuscire a rimuoverla come lo sarebbe su una superficie liscia.I supporti all’interno sono in gomma, ottimo per non graffiare le lenti ad esempio.Il laccio non saprei dire se è pelle vera, non sono andato a cercare, comunque al tatto è simile al camoscio 👍Uso:Tanto per cominciare la chiusura: c’è un laccetto, quello è quello che dovete accompagnare lungo il bordo dell’apertura per aprire la cerniera.I separatori all’interno sono posizionati in modo intuitivo per riporre il visore, tutt’altra storia invece sono quelli per i controller, ok dopo aver visto l’immagine si fa perché c’è il posto ma non c’è quasi niente che li tenga in posizione.C’è abbastanza posto per il caricatore col suo cavo e ospita per costruzione anche lo strip opzionale col powerbank integrato.Estetica:L’unica cosa che mi sorprende della linea di questo oggetto è che in foto viene molto bene, tanto che quando l’ho ordinato non avevo il minimo dubbio che mi sarebbe piaciuto. E invece... ci sono rimasto male.Conclusione: se tornassi indietro non la ricomprerei, sto pensando se sia il caso di effettuare il reso visto il rapporto qualità prezzo pessimo.Aggiornamento:Rettifico, ho fatto bene a comprarla perché purtroppo non ho trovato altre borse in cui la disposizione interna sia pensata in modo intelligente come in questa. Ho comprato anche la fascia Elite e ci sta benissimo.Penso sia una scelta obbligata se vi è la necessità di portarlo fuori casa spesso e soprattutto se si utilizza lo strip Elite.Il mio voto non cambia, non vale 50 euro e non ha senso che una borsa da trasporto non si possa pulire facilmente come la versione precedente dove bastava un detergente e un panno.Aggiornamento 2:per 50 euro un magnete, come in tutte le custodie di qualsiasi dispositivo serio, potevano anche metterlo sul rialzo che tiene fermo il visore per indicare al dispositivo di spegnere almeno lo schermo sapendo di essere chiuso in una borsa/custodia. Ma veramente. Ho tolto la seconda stella.Questa relazione sta comportando più compromessi del previsto 😛
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on October 21, 2020
review_title: A me non mi piace mica 😕

one_reviews_text: Having read many reviews on here relating to the Oculus Quest 2 link cable, seemly many people don’t understanding or have the technical knowledge relating to dual function data and power transfer cables (not surprising really as the cable connectivity world has become utterly mind boggling)  and whilst I’d agree this cable is on the expensive side its actually totally designed to do the required task, but moreover and I feel it’s important to understand, this expense is because active cables (active cables support much longer reach than their passive equivalents), cables capable and used for both data and power transfer are far more expensive to produce than passive cables (passive cables are liable to degrade data they carry).This branded 5 metre (16.40 feet) of premium spiral shielding fibre-optic core link cable delivers exceptional performance for PC VR gaming on your Quest 2 whilst powering up the headset.  It’s lightweight and highly flexible in comparison to many of the unbranded cables available, many of which also do not offer charging capabilities.  I also found no channel impairments including attenuation, crosstalk, noise, irregular fluctuations, minimal signal loss and group velocity distortion with this cable.With Oculus ‘O’ branded high-quality link cable and the Velcro hook and loop fastener, Quest 2 feels and acts like a proper tethered headset, like it was meant to be used this way. Your computer requires a USB-C port providing sufficient current and you’re going to need USB 3 – C adaptor (which is not included in the box) if you don’t have a USB-C port. This link cable came nicely packaged in an Oculus branded box, and email order information and service by Amazon was highly professional and premium delivery swift as ever.So in conclusion, I feel this is an actual case of paying more for something, but in every sense getting what you paid for, offering blistering-fast data speeds while powering the headset at the same time, and being one of the longest USB-C 3 cables, therefore allowing you to move freely to every corner of your playing space. I’m therefore happy to submit this product review and recommendation to fellow would be purchasers.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 31, 2021
review_title: Oculus Quest - The Branded Original Link Cable

one_reviews_text: Get a high quality router and Virtual Desktop for the same price and enjoy a fully wireless experience or buy the cheaper Anker cable for £30. This cable works great, but no better than other solutions.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 24, 2020

one_reviews_text: Awful, especially when compared to the equally expensive but totally worth it Quest 1 case.Fabric is cheap and fuzzy, the zipper is tiny and glued on, and it doesn't hold the touch controllers steady when in transit, which is the one job the case has.Not to mention it's very soft and doesn't offer any protection from drops or knocks.Other than it's size, It's a step down from the box the headset comes in.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 5, 2020

one_reviews_text: If you own an Oculus Quest and a gaming PC then chances are that you might have tried out Oculus Link. I've used a selection of different cables with Oculus link with mixed success, some of the cables are too thick/heavy, some are too short, some have a USB repeater halfway through or some of them simply don't work properly at all.Being an Oculus genuine product I had little doubt that this cable would work but it is very expensive. It's unlike most other cables out there in the sense that it contains a fibre optic inside for the data so it should make the cable much lighter. It's a little thinner, lighter and more flexible than some of the other cables I own but you can't tell there's a fibre optic in there. You do need to be careful not to bend the cable too much though because that may damage the fibre optic inside.One thing that to bear in mind is that this is a USB Type-C to USB Type-C cable. Annoyingly Oculus do not provide a USB Type-C to USB A adapter with the cable which is actually outrageous at this price point! A lot of people's front USB ports on their PC are USB A and not USB Type-C, I only have USB Type-C ports at the back of my PC which means losing a metre or so of cable. I had to buy a USB Type-C to USB A adapter (ASIN B083DS8GDH seems to work).Being able to play PC VR games, such as Half-Life Alyx or Asguard's Wrath on the Oculus Quest 2 is amazing but going back to the cable is a little immersion breaking. However, I have found using this cable to charge the Quest 2 whilst playing slow paced games like Walkabout Golf or Pro Putt works well and doesn't interfere with the gaming experience too much.One thing many users don't know about is an application called Virtual Desktop which can be side loaded on the Quest 2 and allow you to play PC VR (i.e. Steam) games over 5Ghz Wireless to to your PC. I always suggest checking that out. There's a bit of config to do and it's not perfect but it's definitely a step in the right direction for wireless PC VR gaming.Pros:- It feels decent quality- Works well with Oculus Quest 2 and Oculus Link to PC and is more reliable than other cheaper cables I've tried- Can be used to charge the headset whilst playing Quest 2 games- Slightly thinner, lighter and more flexible than other cablesCons:- Expensive, like other Oculus Quest accessories- No USB Type-C to USB A adapter supplied
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 8, 2021

one_reviews_text: I should have read the reviews before I bought this however, I was a fool and thought to myself "This has well over 14000 ratings, and 4 and a half stars, this should be perfect" I was wrong.I would kind of understand of it broke whilst doing something extreme like wild head movement or dropping it, but for me it broke as I looked down to pick something up in VR, almost had the headset slide off and hit the floor before I caught it.The second photo shows the aftermath of trying to remove the strap from the headset, which I was trying to be as gentle as possible not to break anything else since removing the strap seems like it was made to be the most difficult thing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 23, 2021
review_title: Broke after less than 20 hours of use

one_reviews_text: Used this for about three weeks and then, when inserting a headphone plug and holding the Quest 2 by the strap, the strap snapped.The plastic the strap is manufactured from very brittle plastic.  The attachment point to Quest 2 is structurally a vulnerable potential point of failure (it's where my strap failed) as the thin and brittle strap can undergo large bending deformation at the interface to the headset.For me, the strap is a must purchase as it holds the Quest 2 correctly on the head.  Unfortunately, it is made extremely cheaply and a good majority of its purchase price looks to go into the fancy packaging.If buy this strap, handle with care.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 26, 2021
review_title: Very fragile design; handle with care

one_reviews_text: Wow so little for so much money. When I bought this I was expecting a decent quality case for money. It's just compressed felt and a little bit of thread where the zip toggle should be. Honestly, there's a bit of string instead of a toggle on the zip. Why? Did they run out of parts? The string gets caught between the 2 halves of the case and you have to use a pen to dig it out before you can open the case. It's an embarrassment for Oculus to be putting their name to this.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 3, 2020

one_reviews_text: I have a 2080ti so i have a type c on back of the card but keeps disconnecting and black screen. The desktop still works and can see the game and even when i move head set but still black screen in the head set. I have to close the game down and start up again. I no its only in beta for the cable but for 89,99 you think it would work when i reach above recommended specs.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 21, 2020

one_reviews_text: One of the side pieces will likely eventually crack and split as the materials used aren't durable enough for normal operation.Even if this was not the case at £50 this headstrap is hugely overpriced; particularly when you can buy a much more comfortable and durable 'Halo' strap for under £30 on AliExpress...
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 9, 2020

one_reviews_text: This cable worked fine until a month ago the desktop app began saying that I would have a better experience with a USB 3.0 connection (The port I'm using is 3.0 and it was fine up until then). However recently the cable no longer connects my Quest 2 to my PC. Ive tried all the fixes and nothing works but when I use the charging cable to connect my headset it works perfectly. This is painfully overpriced for a cable that breaks after a few months. Buy a cheaper alternative because they are higher quality.Edit : I just discovered that while the cable was working fine with the 90 degree corner plugged into the headset and the straight end plugged into my pc now the cable only works with the 90 degree plugged into my computer and the straight part plugged into the headset. This is incredibly impractical and I have not idea how this is even possible.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 13, 2021
review_title: Cable stopped working Edit : sort of

one_reviews_text: *UPDATE - Still under warranty so a replacement is being sent. Still had to jump through multiple hoops to get the end result, including sending back the broken strap. Bit of a pain but at least the customer service was good ...Only purchased this in April and by July both bands on the side of the strap have broken. Not sure why, perhaps from the weight of the device itself. If that's the case then why was this not taken into consideration as part of the design?The strap itself is really comfy but the price is a joke, even more so considering it has broken with moderate use. We don't use it daily and it isn't used heavily or excessively which makes it even more frustrating that it has now broken.Save your money and buy an unofficial one instead. A friend of ours did this at the same time we purchased this one and it has outlasted ours. What an absolute joke.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 28, 2021
review_title: Broke in 3 months!! Replacement being sent ...

one_reviews_text: I have been very careful this since reading the very common comments about the strap breaking.  Despite that, and despite very careful handling and actually minimal use, the plastic strap has failed.  There is a FAULT with this product.  I have since purchased another headset strap which, while not as "elegant", looks like it will last more than three months.  I hope to get my money back.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 3, 2021
review_title: The strap breaks.  Like everyone else says on here.  And I have been VERY careful with mine.

one_reviews_text: we already had the Anker equivalent cable but decided to upgrade to the official one as we were getting a new computer and wanted to optimise the VR link.  It worked for about a month then started having problems.  Switched back to the old (much cheaper) cable which worked great (still does).  Tried to return this one and was met with a million technical hoops to jump through.  We aren't that technical but we know that this cable doesn't work, the other cable does, heck even the oculus charge cable works fine (albeit at a lesser connection speed).  I gave up with the support request, and resigned myself to having thrown a lot of money down the drain on this overpriced disappointment.  Makes me think twice before ordering anything oculus again which is really sad as we like the headset.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 11, 2021
review_title: overpriced and unreliable with terrible support

one_reviews_text: This is very expensive for the quality you get. I received the new strap on the 22nd Oct and my the 23rd November one of the arms had completely broken off with just normal use and only me using it. The strap it’s self is easy to adjust but I personally don't think much to the fit. Even when correctly adjusted it would move around on my head. All in all very disappointing
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 23, 2020
review_title: Broke in just over a month

one_reviews_text: I’m not going to lie and say I’ve tried loads of straps, I haven’t.  I’ve tried the standard strap obviously and an add on that integrates with that strap to make it more comfortable at the back.  I’ve also tried the Bobomvr (or whatever it’s called) halo strap.  This Elite strap is by far the best one so far.I went for the Bobo halo strap as the first total new strap as I’d heard it takes the pressure off your face.  That was not the case for me at all.  I found the cushioned pad at the back kept sliding up the back of my head and left the full weight of the VR unit on my cheeks.The Elite strap is really easy to get on and adjust, takes about 5 seconds to get it right.  It does not take the pressure totally off your face but it is significantly better than the others in terms of comfort.  I have seen stuff about it cracking and breaking but, touch wood, it’s been fine so far.  I’ve been very careful though about loosening the top head  strap before untightening the main strap to ensure I’m not putting pressure on it.It’s expensive for what it is but I’m very happy with it so far.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 19, 2021

one_reviews_text: Au bout d’un mois et demi d’utilisation, la sangle s’est cassée sur le côté. Aucun enfant ne l’a utilisé et je suis plutôt du genre soigneux.  Surement un défaut de fabrication. J’aimerai savoir s’il y a eu d’autres cas comme moi ? J’ai eu de la chance de ne pas me blesser car quand ça casse net le plastique et très tranchant….  Attention donc au côté de la sangle si vous l’achetez.Sinon, mis à part cette fragilité, le produit est agréable en lui-même, mais d’après moi ne vaut pas 50 euros de plus par rapport à la sangle d’origine.
review_date: Reviewed in France on December 28, 2020

one_reviews_text: Its a lot of money, more fool me for buying it, cheaper ones available. Check you have the appropriate connections. So far seems to be of little real use. It connects the Oculus Quest 2 to my PC when you've downloaded the app. Like the Quest it comes with little in the way of helpful information. Found out about the app by doing an internet search.  I've yet to find anything that makes it worth buying in the first place. VR content appears linked to individual sites like Steam. You have to have bought the game there to play in VR. Perhaps as time goes by the market will open up. At the mo' it's a thumbs down.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 7, 2020

one_reviews_text: It's not much more comfortable than the basic strap that comes with the Quest 2, I thought it would help relieve the pressure on my checks and forehead, but it does not. At best it stops some movement of the headset when turning quickly.it doesn't fit my 3rd party case any more either, even on its smallest setting.It is also horribly expensive for what it is, I cannot recommend it at this price when 3rd party alternatives will perform the same for a fraction of the cost. I haven't had any cracks in the plastic yet, which seems a common failure.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 18, 2021
review_title: No huge improvement, and unbelievably expensive.

one_reviews_text: Ho usato il quest 2 fino ad'ora senza sfruttare bene le sue potenzialità.Con questo cinturino elite è tutta un altra esperienza, sembra di non indossare nemmeno il visore. Il peso è molto più distribuito e la visibilità è perfetta, non bisogna più star lì ogni due minuti a regolarlo di nuovo per vederci meglio. E' un must per chi possiede un Quest 2. Non mi spiego il prezzo sinceramente data la scarsa qualità del materiale, banalissima plastica che sembra anche abbastanza poco resistente. Aggiornerò questa recensione in futuro per dirvi se ha retto i movimenti veloci di un giocatore di Beat Saber.Edit:Vi aggiorno come promesso... metro una Stella, dopo circa un mese di utilizzo più che normale si è iniziata a spezzare sul lato sinistro. Problema riscontrato da molte persone su internet... reso subito. Amazon perfetta come sempre. Facebook sei una delusione. 50€ per un pezzo di plastica che si rompe? Comprate qualcos'altro di non ufficiale...
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on November 22, 2020

one_reviews_text: 3 stars not 5 as this should come with the headset as standard. The developers must have known the discomfort of the original headset and strap when it was tested, the strap it comes with is too uncomfortable to wear for more than 20 mins. Consumer shouldn’t have to cough up another £50 on a product already costing £300 minimum, just to play the £300 product. Plus you have the games on top as let’s face it everyone wants Beat Saber.Aside from the above points, the elite strap is very well designed and a necessity.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2022

one_reviews_text: Coming from an original Oculus Quest I found the basic strap on the Quest 2 to be a massive step down. I simply can't get it comfortable and have to keep readjusting it and it also catches on my ears and irritates them too. If you're constantly have to fiddle with the headset during a game then it's breaking the immersion.It's clear that Facebook have reduced the cost of the headset to appeal to more people but have cut some corners to achieve this. They also charge a lot of money for the accessories, so this Elite strap is about £50 and the Oculus Link cable is about £90.This Elite strap does transform the Quest 2 into a more comfortable device and allows you to balance the weight a bit better. The headset itself is still heavy due to the battery etc. but this strap does help to negate that. The adjustment wheel on the back makes it much easier to adjust and less fiddly than the basic strap.It is perhaps a little expensive for what you actually get but it does improve the comfort significantly for me. The Oculus Quest 2 paired with this Elite Strap is still £50 cheaper than an original Oculus Quest was though.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2020

one_reviews_text: This does provide a more comfortable and secure-feeling fit than the standard strap. By cupping the occipital part of your skull, it does take some of the front-heavy feeling from the Quest2. It's quite easy to fit too, taking only couple of minutes.With that said, there are a couple of negatives. The more secure fit means it's a bit more fiddly to quickly put on or take off than the simpler straps since you'll need to tighten and slacken it as required. The other is price - almost £50 for this is a bit of joke.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 29, 2021

one_reviews_text: Save yourself your time and money, and go with a third party headstrap.I waited a couple months for them to sort out the issues but still ended up with it breaking after using it a handful of times. Oculus was well aware that these headstraps were garbage but didn't recall them all. Don't bother trying to get a "good batch", they're all trash.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on January 16, 2021
review_title: Broke after a couple of sessions. AVOID!

one_reviews_text: Way, way more comfortable than the head strap that originally came with the Oculus Quest 2. I got a real bad headache and sore forehead using the original strap. The Elite head strap cures that problem. Seems very sturdy as well and good quality so not sure why some have been breaking. Think it was just a dodgy batch some people got. I Highly recommend 💯%
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 5, 2020

one_reviews_text: Headset (mine with elite strap) fits perfectly as you should expect ditto for charger and cable.  Controllers I'm not so sure about.  There does seem to be a special way to place them in but not convinced I get this right every time however they stay in place regardless.  I returned my first one after receiving a flattened box and thinking it looked damaged (the lid did not look a good fit with the rest of the case).  My next one looked exactly the same so I supposed that was what they should have looked like.  Really overpriced for what it is but everyone seems to be following Apple's lead on that!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 14, 2022

one_reviews_text: DO NOT buy this product. Our elite strap lasted less than 2 months before the leg snapped. Have been contacting Oculus directly since February to organise a replacement and they are less than helpful suggesting that even if I get a replacement strap that it will be a refurbished one and not a new one. Disgusted and very poor customer service.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 14, 2021
review_title: Faulty product with non-existent customer support

one_reviews_text: I expected more for the money. To be honest if it wasn't for the fact I wanted to use a set of PSVR headphones on it I'd have kept the default strap. I also must have a funny shaped head, as I find the lower rubber ring part in the back digs into the back of my head and neck and becomes uncomfortable after a while! I wish they'd just used a strap like on the Quest 1. After all if it ain't broke. Don't fix it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 9, 2020
review_title: Not worth the money buy a country mile!

one_reviews_text: This is far more comfortable than the standard strap that comes with the Quest 2. However, if it just had a weightier back end, which balanced out the front end weight of the Quest 2 , it would be pretty much perfect. That said, it still deserves a 4 star rating as it is far easier to put on and far more stable at holding the headset in place.  16/08/21 Additional:  the side of the strap now has 2 cracks in it, see picture.  Apparently Oculus will replace these FOC, so if they do, I will put the review back up to 4 stars but I have currently dropped it to 2 stars as, after only 3 months, the thing is broken and I use it about once a week.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 4, 2021
review_title: Comfy-ish, but needs a back weight to balance the headset

 Having purchased the aftermarket one’s previously and returned the both, I know it is a bit pricey but paying the extra £20-30 for this is without doubt the best choice. As the pictures show you can fit the elite headset and there is ample room for everything. Good quality case and when spending £300 odd pounds on the device this is very much worth the money, buying both as a bundle with the breakdown care is the best choice.
