review_title: Best case..worth spending the extra money!

one_reviews_text: I wanted to get the battery variant but I was not interested in the bundle with the travelling case. The product itself is comfortable but lacks the battery, thus it is simply a plastic strap.The product description clearly stated Li Battery required and was vague on this crucial detail, with a similar price tag as well it is quite difficult to get the right item.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 6, 2020
review_title: Be aware, misleading information! No battery variant

one_reviews_text: I purchased the Oculus Quest 2 Elite Strap for Enhanced Support and Comfort form Amazon on 24th November 2020, and the return window was closed on March 1st. However, without me present, I noticed the strap snapped and broke. I was really disappointed because it cost £40 and I expected a good quality product (that's why I purchased the original Oculus one). I checked 10 times, and was surprised there is no serial number on the head strap, the only information written is "Made in China" (see photo), which makes me feel I wasn't sold a good quality product (it comes from Oculus though).I need to clarify, I was always careful with the headset, I NEVER dropped it or forced it in any way, and it did not break while I handled it, but while it was sitting on the side. I would like some explanation and I would appreciate compensation/replacement.I changed my review from 1 star to 3 stars because Amazon allowed me to return and get a refund.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 25, 2021
review_title: Broke just by sitting on its own overnight, soon after the return window closed.

one_reviews_text: I purchased the link cable as the oculus site describes the cable as 'dual function'.... Blistering speed while charging the headset.This isn't true, the cable was not charging the headset sonincontacted their support team.I was told:"We have an update regarding on our request, they have updated the Oculus Link as it is not for charging purposes because mostly it cause the headset some trouble on the battery issue later on but it somehow maintains the device from not turning off when it is connected to a computer. Also please do note for your safety purposes please refrain from playing VR while charging it's just for precautionary measure for I care about your safe.In line with that, I would suggest I you want a longer span of playtime, there is an Elite Strap with Battery that serves as an expansion for the battery of the headset.I apologize that we are not able to give you a possible replacement for the issue will always be the same as the Oculus Link is typically not for charging purposes.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2022
review_title: Link cable does not charge headset

one_reviews_text: Slightly less comfortable than the halo strap of the rift s I am struggling to understand why this is not the default strap to ship with the quest 2.  It feels good but I can understand why they break so easily as you can overtighten this on your face quite dramatically.  Would I recommend it to anyone?  Yes and no.  Yes it does the job and is good, no as there are literally dozens of alternative straps at a cheaper price point that do nearly the same thing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 24, 2021
review_title: Why is this not the standard?

one_reviews_text: Really REALLY disappointed.  I gave away my £35 unbranded strap to my some thinking I’ll have Ruhr ‘official’ strap.  Within a couple of weeks the plastic strap cracked and snapped!  They are way more brittle than they should be, leading enough to believe that either there is a manufacturing batch problem or it wasn’t a genuine article.  Compared to the quality of the oculus quest 2, I have to believe I was sold a fake!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 21, 2021
review_title: Can’t have been a genuine article!

one_reviews_text: Same feedback as most others that this makes wearing the headset a lot more comfortable and more balanced, weight wise, on your head for a nicer gaming experience.I’ve no idea how other people were snapping their headset arms as replacing the standard strap is a piece of cake and very simple to do.Glad I got this despite the extra expense, it is worth it & I love the packaging so will keep it for putting bits & bobs in.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2022
review_title: Much better than basic head strap

one_reviews_text: The elite strap makes using the quest 2 massively more comfortable, I've owned my quest for just over a year now (boxing day 2021) and I had never once played it long enough for the battery to go flat purely because it would get uncomfortable long before that. Now I've got the elite strap I wish I'd gotten it long ago at the same time as the headset itself, because it's completely unbelievable the difference it makes, plus it's much easier to adjust the fitting of this strap in my honest opinion.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 13, 2022
review_title: Honestly amazing how much of a difference this makes.

one_reviews_text: Despite there being a lot of alternative cables on the market which claim to do the same thing for a third of the price - I decided to buy the official version because I just wanted it to work properly. I also have a usb C port on my pc so all the negative reviews about it being usb C didn't put me off... Well, even so - it just doesn't work well at all. I set it all up in the Oculus app, but every 5 minutes it says my headset is not connected. I'm sure if I were very technically minded I could troubleshoot and change a few settings and get it all to work - but I'm not, and if I pay £90 for a cable I expect to be able to just plug it in and have it work without hours of faffing and watching tutorial videos etc. to work out why it doesn't seem to work.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 18, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought this more for the comfort of the strap rather than the battery (though the longer battery life makes a huge difference too). I have only had my Quest 2 a month or two but in that time I struggled to play for more than half an hour because of the throbbing headaches I'd get from having the headset strapped tightly to my face. With this elite strap, that issue has now gone. With the support at the back which moulds around your head and the dial to tighten or loosen the strap you can now easily have it sat snuggly around your head without being too tight, and no more headaches!I would say that this should really be part of the base headset. It's much sturdier than just the strap and the weight of it counterbalances the weight of the headset so it feels much less like it's pulling down on the front of your face. It's a little pricey for what it is but it does make a huge difference.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 29, 2022

one_reviews_text: Definitely an improvement on the standard strap and makes the weight distribution of the headset more even.Easy to put on and take off as it has a dial to loosen the headset at the back. A small part of me still firmly believes this elite strap should have been part of the original headset, as its unfair to make consumers pay extra for a strap to fix the inadequacies and flaws of the original headset
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 23, 2021

one_reviews_text: Ho fatto il reso perché il cavo non merita 99€.Ho un connettore Type-C sulla scheda madre (MSI MORTAR MAX) ed il test di velocità segnava la corretta velocità di 2.3 Mbps.Dopo 3/4 giorni però non faceva più contatto disconnettendosi e riconnettendosi continuamente.Il connettore Type-C del cavo Oculus stava rovinando la porta sul PC.Consiglio al produttore di sostituire il Type-C lato PC con un Type-A (sempre a parità di specifica usb 3.1) per poter reggere il peso, anche parziale, di un cavo di 5mt (adattatori da C ad A sono sconsigliati poichè potrebbero guastare il segnale).Il Type-A è anche sicuramente più diffuso.Rispetto per il cliente : un cavo a quel prezzo deve essere perfetto.Ora utilizzo il cavo di Amavasion sempre venduto su Amazon che è molto più stabile in aggancio, costa 1/3, ha velocità di 2.2 Mbps e la ricarica batteria in gioco è accettabile.Amazon perfetto come al solito.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on November 11, 2020
review_title: Il Type-C non è adatto per la porta PC

one_reviews_text: I'm really glad I bought this case. The Oculus Quest 2 is an expensive piece of kit, and I was keen to get a rugged case that I knew would be protecting my investment. Needless to say, this case delivers the protection I was after. It's a hard shell with appropriately sized compartments to hold the headset, the two controllers, and the charging cable.Sometimes when I'm lowering the headset in, it does feel like the foam surrounding the eyepieces is getting caught on the hard plastic interior of the case, but this is a minor comment.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 18, 2021
review_title: Perfect Protective Case for Oculus Quest 2

one_reviews_text: so had it a while but not used it due to busy work schedule decided to finally get in some game time in and this happened must have used it less than 20 times and it breaks shocking how cheap and weak the plastic is would not recommend
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 25, 2021

one_reviews_text: I managed to buy this on offer, but now  having seen and touched it, it's well-worth the full price.Surprisingly compact and well designed, with  even the zipper line being mostly hidden.Extremely tough and rigid, but light and nice to the touch.Inside it's similar, with simple design and well crafted moulded rigid plastic. Everything sits well and holds the headset and controllers snuggly.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 23, 2022

one_reviews_text: The driver was incredible. He told my mum he needed the delivery code but she didng have it and since I'm usually in lunch at this time my mum tried calling me but it had changed and was now a 3,2 split. She got the school to give me a message and I called her in-between lessons, she said she needed the code and the driver had said he would come back later. He came back again and she still didn't have it. So he said he would come back at the end of his round. I looked I my email, screenshotted the code and sent it to me mum. Then, later at 4 o'clock the parcel was delivered and my mum gave him the code. Also the vr headset itself is incredible I am already a huge vr fan after only days. I put it on and instantly am taken into a brand new world and it often feels strange to go back to reality after being so immersed in a game. It has incredible service. It is an incredible product. Overall, its just a really good buy. Definitely worth the money.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 9, 2022

one_reviews_text: I am amazed at how poor the build is on this.The zip is controlled just by a tied on piece of thread, and the actual zip is flimsy and catches.The finishing in the edge of the case is a bit ragged tooWithout a doubt not worth even half the price paid
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 23, 2020

one_reviews_text: I don’t know why the elite strap isn’t the standard strap it’s such a massive improvement over the fabric one that comes with the quest 2 holds the whole thing on your head so much better you can look down without it trying to fall off and the extra up to 2 hours of play time is great and with the extra weight it has it provides a nice little bit of counter weight on the back of your head to off set the quest
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 30, 2021

one_reviews_text: If you are going to be using a Quest 2 on a fairly regular basis, you need this for comfort and ease. I stream VR games at least once a week, the elite strap is much more comfortable and user friendly. I can tilt my headset up for a moment to see the real world and it won't fall back down, the turn handle to tighten and loosen is easy to use and have found I get a much better fit.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 4, 2021
review_title: A must have for regular users

one_reviews_text: デザインを重視ししすぎてエッグシェル状の形態ばかりを優先したため使い物になりません。第一に持ち手がリング状でこの重量の物を持つには持ちにくいです。最大の欠点は蓋と本体の隙間を狭くしたいがために、ジッパーの持ち手部分が通常の形では幅が大きくはまらないので紐で代用したことです。買って1週間で紐が脱落しあまりの隙間の狭さに二度と装着できません。開閉不能となったので直ちに返品手続きをとりました。純正にもかかわらずコントローラの収納部分も収まりが悪いなどいいところは一つもありません。サードパーティ製のものを買い直しましたが、圧倒的に安く作りもしっかりしています。絶対に購入ボタンを押すべきではありません。追記　買って一週間でジッパーが壊れて開閉不能になったため返品としてアマゾンに送ったところ「使用感あり、内側に汚れがある為返金処理できない」とのメールが来ました。商品に問題があったから返品しているのに使用感があるからダメってどういうことなのか。カスタマセンターにクレーム電話したら返金処理を続けますって、だったら最初からそうしろよって感じです。
review_date: Reviewed in Japan on October 27, 2020
review_title: このケースは買ってはダメです

one_reviews_text: The Oculus cable is a ridiculous price, I hoped it would make life easier if there were queries, but the cable never worked as a link cable only as a charger. Initially Oculus were like USB converters not supported, then on new PC with native USB C they claimed the cable was never intended for VR Link. We are about 8 months in and much cheaper 3rd party cables are working fine, but Oculus support still grinding along not come to satisfactory resolution.Moral buy the cheaper cables.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 30, 2021

one_reviews_text: I like a lot of other reviwers here, did not take notice or read the news regarding this product, after just 2 weeks of use my strap started to develop cracks down the left hand strap, this was not due to over using product or stretching over the head as some other reviews suggest. These fault lines seems to develop on "mis-mouled" plastic seams. this seems to be a design error or poor manufacturing process. Amazon however has already sent me a new unit and the new one does not have the same plastic mould lines as the last so it should be fine.dissapointing that Facebook would allow such product production with such a high purchase price. Also the amount of packaging with this item is insane !!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 4, 2021

one_reviews_text: I had the Quest 2 headset for a few days before ordering this and found the standard issued straps awkward to put on and take off with my glasses and it eould keep slipping no matter how much I played around with them but this is leaps and bounds better.  I can only assume it is not included with the headset as a cost cutting thing
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 2, 2022

one_reviews_text: Improves the comfort / ease of fit of the headset quite a bit over the stock headstrap, however is still very front heavy.  Despite getting a strap that was released supposedly after the straps materials had been improved i have noticed small hair line cracks in the plastic appear where it clips onto the headset.  Now that we have cheaper alternatives on the market id avoid this strap and go for a cheaper third party version.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 29, 2021
review_title: Expensive for what it is and still plagued by durability issues

one_reviews_text: Para comenzar, mi primera impresión debo hacer hincapié en que la pantalla es pequeña, comparada con las vive. Soy de fusionar la el visor a mi cara, cual careta de buzo (que después de minutos, dejan un tatuaje permanente enrojecido en las zonas de contacto) ello ocasiona que vea los bordes de la pantalla y sus esquinas "redondeadas" (entiendo que son bordes tratados por software, para ajustarse a los 3 IPDs). Vengo de una pantalla Amoled, así que pierdo colores sobresaturados pero atractivos y negros negros, bien negros, super negros... no grises... pasar a un panel LCD se nota, colores más pálidos y negros más grisáceos.No obstante, nada de esto es capaz de eclipsar lo bueno. Pantalla casi sin SDE (no comparemos con mis antiguos visores... es una pasada poder leer con claridad sin dejarte la vista en el intento), con una resolucion escandalosa, que en PCVR hace sudar a mi equipo, y en standalone te permite ver una pelicula en netflix, o un video de youtube, con una calidad excelente y sin que te duela la vista.Mi IPD no tengo ni idea de cuanto es, en las vive lo ponia en 63mm, aquí lo pongo en posicion 2 y veo perfecto. Un punto dulce bastante amplio cuando le coges el centro, y con un glare mejor que el de vive. La mejor manera para obtener un buen punto dulce es colocar el visor en la cara, ajustarlo al centro donde veamos mejor, y ya luego ajustar las cintas. Aunque recomiendo el Halo Strap de chinolandia.En cuanto al tracking, hecho de menos la fidelidad de los lighthouses, sobre todo con luz escasa, o cuando se pasan las manos detrás de la espalda, pero los sensores internos de las manos, y las cuatro camaras de las gafas, hacen su trabajo a la perfección. Hasta la fecha no me ha dado ningún tipo de problema en ningun juego.Como guinda del pastel, tracking de manos. En su época fui backer de leap motion, me encantó, a pesar de lo poco práctico que era esa barra metálica pegado al visor DK2. Este tracking de manos, funciona de manera similar (aunque sin sus camaras IR, pero usa varias cámaras para discernir profundidad), no es perfecto, pero es un añadido gratuito que metieron los desarrolladores para sacarse la minga frente a los demás visores quedar por delante de visores más caros y/o modernos. De momento no me ha dado fallos al usarlo y se agradece que cada vez más aplicaciones lo vayan incluyendo como modo de manejo alternativo.Los mandos son excelentes, tras hacerles una cinta al mas puro estilo Valve Index (por supuesto, con coleteros, mas gratis imposible) hacen que la sujecion con mi mano sea perfecta. Me encanta la disposicion de los botones, gatillos y el joystick. Como otra guinda, sobre la guinda, tiene sensores que te controlan dónde pones los dedos y qué presión ejerces en los gatillos. Brutal!La batería me dura algo más de dos horas con los dos juegos que tengo de momento: Blaston y Pistol Whip. No he tenido ningun problema de apagón en mitad del juego, ya que siempre dejo cargando el visor cuando acabo, tarda aproximadamente dos horas en cargar al 100%. Se puede usar cargando, pero no es nada practico. La bateria de los mandos es eterna, dicen que dura uno o dos meses con unas pilas normales. No he gastado ni el 1% en el tiempo de uso que llevo.El sonido es muy bueno. No es tan malo como otros dicen. ¿Por qué? Porque no te anula el exterior, si no quieres. Si subes el volumen lo suficiente, puedes anular el ruido del exterior, pero vas a provocar que TODOS se enteren de a qué estas jugando. Pero tiene un compendio muy bueno entre graves y agudos. Para mi gusto personal, OJO! para mi gusto personal es mucho mejor que el sonido del Deluxe Audio Strap de HTC.Bueno, la guinda, sobre la guinda de la guinda, está en el Oculus link. Ese cable largo, pesado y caro (si no recurrimos a nuestros amigos asiaticos) que te permite convertir un standalone en un PCVR casi en condiciones. Digo casi en condiciones, porque en ciertas aplicaciones o juegos se nota la compresión. Pero con la ultima actualización y un poco de optimizacion manual cacharrera, he conseguido que se vea de escándalo. Cualquier aplicacion, juego, ya sea de oculus o steamVR, se puede jugar con total normalidad.Conclusión a este testamento.¿Me arrepiento de comprar las quest 2 de 256 por algo mas de 400€ gastos incluidos porque vivo en Canarias? NO!!¿Si tuviera 300€ más me compraría las HP REVERB G2? No! no tengo gráfica para tanto. Con la RTX2060 voy raspando en ciertos juegos más demandantes, sin embargo, he tenido que trastear por los ajustes de link para que no me haga mucha distorsion por compresión y poder mantener un buen equilibrio entre calidad grafica y rendimiento.¿Hecho de menos mis antiguos visores? No. Es un salto en tecnología desde que salio vive en 2016. Sin embargo, si tuviera el quest original, quizás si me replanteaba el cambio.Con esto no quiero decir que las HP sean peores. Simplemente quiero decir que para mi juicio éstas cumplen con mis expectativas con creces. A pesar de dos o tres desventajas que le veo, el resto son todo ventajas.Si tuviera que ponerle una nota, quizas le pondría un 8/10. Calidad precio es rompedor, pero habria invertido más tiempo y dinero en algunos aspectos, como las lentes, o la pantalla, ya que el microled da mejores resultados que un panel LCD.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on January 13, 2021

one_reviews_text: I wasn't sure about spending so much on this strap but it seems well worth it, I no longer have to keep adjusting it to fit different heads and as I wear glasses it's so much easier to put on and remove the headset. Just turn the dial at the back and tilt the headset upwards and it's so easy to lift off.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 22, 2021

one_reviews_text: Perfect for the extra play time and feels just as good as the quest headset, not as convenient as cheaper headsets that can easily slip on and off without having to twist the rear control to release and tighten, this becomes an issue when other people use it, as it cups the back of the head, they risk breaking it by yanking it off, still best option for extra battery
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 10, 2022
review_title: Great battery life, great quality, twist to release can be anoying

one_reviews_text: The strap which comes with it, although adequate was proving a bit annoying for the kids to adjust for their varying head sizes. This has solved all of that and its much comfier as well. Annoyed it took me so long to find out this even existed.Easy to swap out, much better fit. Personally its a no brainer.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 8, 2021

one_reviews_text: This is a good strap - but I found the cupping straps at the back to be a bit hard and they did cause discomfort. I fitted the rear strap padding available from VR Covers (Gauss Tech) that they produce for the original Quest.The velcro fasteners are not ideally placed, but it stays in place just fine using just the bottom ones and the two together make the Quest 2 extremely comfy.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 10, 2020

one_reviews_text: I've seen some criticism of the official elite strap but for me it's been brilliant.A much more comfortable fit than the original strap, quick and easy to tighten and pretty solid.I've been using it for Months now and it's still going strong.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 31, 2021

one_reviews_text: When I first looked at this item the price seemed a bit steep! It was to accompany an Oculus as a Christmas gift. After already spending £400 on the Oculus itself I was slightly out off spending another £50.However, spending that £50 was worth it as it’s was a great gift. The receiver was able to unpackage their Oculus and put it straight into this case.It’s a high quality item and looks very classy. My only issue was I would of appreciated a picture of how the Oculus went into the case. I did have to Google it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2022
review_title: Very good addition to an Oculus

one_reviews_text: This is far superior to the standard strap and I was thrilled when I first started using it. Sadly, it broke within a couple of months. A quick Google search revealed it's a very common problem :(  Shame as it was so much easier but I can't afford £50 every other month.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 18, 2021

one_reviews_text: Bought in January and is used probably 2 to 3 times a week. Noticed that the side straps are made of very thin plastic. After 5 months these have become brittle and you can see them cracking. Today one has side failed leaving a razor sharp thin plastic edge where it has broken. Looks like a few of them go this way. Amazon have directed me to the Oculus support site for any warranty enquiries. Whilst it's a good strap - it's made of very poor materials
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 24, 2021
review_title: It's broken after 5 months. Plastic has become brittle

one_reviews_text: So having bought the oculas quest 2 for my son and the official head strap, I have to say what a waste of money!. My son complained after a few uses of it hurting his head at the back. Needless to say I returned it to buy a cheaper version that works perfectly
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 14, 2022

one_reviews_text: The strap has a plastic defect and it’s common across these, contacted oculus and not response now I have a broken strap ... this is not good
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2021
review_title: Shocking quality the plastic is defective

one_reviews_text: The standard strap is uncomfortable. This Elite strap fixes that, but it is overpriced for what it is and should have been supplied as standard.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 3, 2020

one_reviews_text: Ridiculously expensive for what it provides, and it (no longer) charges the Quest 2, which was my main reason for buying it. Various forums threads on Oculus about it, doesn't sound like it's something they'll fix anytime soon.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 9, 2022
review_title: Link cable doesn't charge the Quest

one_reviews_text: Good case. Bit disappointed that the zip isn't a tight fit. There is a bit of give between the two shells when all zipped up. I'm sure they are equally good if not better cases out there for better value for money. Probably paying for the name.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 23, 2022

one_reviews_text: This replacement for the standard strap is well made and easy to attach. If you can afford the elite strap with battery pack then buy that instead but for those of us a little strapped (no pun intended) for cash this is a must buy. It makes the Quest 2 more comfortable to wear for those long sessions of Beat Saber. 😉👍
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 10, 2022
review_title: A must buy for your Quest 2.

one_reviews_text: Works great but one accidental pull and that baby no longer works. Shame my 80 quid went down the drain. Please make sure you get warranty.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 21, 2020

one_reviews_text: Seems I have been sold one of the Elite straps with the mentioned defect of a fragile strap that breaks easily. Have reported the issue to Oculus directly as Amazon the product return is outside of the return policy date which is of1 month and I purchased the strap 2  months ago. Fingers crossed Oculus resolve the issue promptly.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 15, 2021
review_title: Strap broken after 2 months of use

one_reviews_text: Essential strap for Quest - the basic strap is awful but this is easy to adjust and very comfortable indeed.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 12, 2020

one_reviews_text: £0 for an official cable in an official box, and the cable is not a stable connection. I have connected a couple of times to my Unity developer programme with some issues, but mostly i get a blank screen in the Oculus Quest 2 headset. Funnily enough, Unity is following the tracking of the headset so there is some information getting through, but the important visual information from the computer to the headset is missing. Perhaps 5m is too long for a steady connection but my 2m bog standard cablehas no issues whatsoever other than not being ergonomic and flush with the power insert on the OQ2 headset.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 30, 2021
review_title: Does not work as a link cable

one_reviews_text: Disappointed that I spent £90. Plug was weak and bent after being caught. Partly my fault but £90 wasted and should be better protected
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2021

one_reviews_text: Purchased this for my son's Christmas at his request to enhance the experience of his new Oculus Rift Quest 2 bundle. He was delighted and says it allows so much more freedom to move around while in game and it works brilliantly so was certainly worth paying the extra money for a cable. Highly recommend.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 15, 2021

one_reviews_text: The strap is very comfortable and way better then the stock strap. Sadly the build quality seems poor.It cracked after less then 3 Months with ~20 hours of non-heavy usage.If they fix the quality issue, the product would deserve 5 stars.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 14, 2021

one_reviews_text: The case looks very nice. Well made. Can’t compare to any other as it’s the only one I have. I have an elite strap (made by Kiwi) and the hand straps (threw them controllers too many times!) and it’s quite difficult to get the zip all around. It’s just a little fatter than the box. That said, it’s quite possible to stuff all the things they promise in.4.5/5 since it costs 15-20 quids more than the competition.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 12, 2022
review_title: Well made case. A little crowded with the custom back strap.

one_reviews_text: As you can see from the photograph the strap broke with little over a month’s light use. Thus rendering the Oculus unusable. Massively disappointed, I’d chosen to go with an Oculus product as I thought it would be better constructed, how wrong I was.

one_reviews_text: I got this as a carrying case for my sons oculas 2. Nice colour and quality. Does the job and it is good fit to put vr headset and controllers in. I'd like it to be able to fit headset/earphones in but there isnt space for this. Shame really as it's a nice case and be good to keep it all together.

review_title: Good case, shame no space to fit headphones in.

one_reviews_text: I used this for a total of two days and the cheap plastic sides cracked, I made an attempt to return it to Amazon but it has to go back to Facebook. This turned out to be a nightmare so I didn't bother they obviously need the massive amount of money it costs more than I do.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 23, 2021

one_reviews_text: Poor product and for the price we were expecting better quality. Brittle plastic that snapped in multiple places inside 3 months of light use, very disappointing would not recommend.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 14, 2021

 Great strength to this product feels nice and strong. Stays on and is very comfortable on the head Highly recommended if you have a oculus quest 2. This is a must to have with it

one_reviews_text: For such a great headstrap, it's longevity wasn't so long. Like many others, it snapped seven months after purchase. Buyer beware on this one! Could have been five stars, but poor choice of brittle plastic means I'm leaving instead a generous 1 star.

one_reviews_text: For something that's pretty simple, it's too expensive. This wire uses fibre optic or something for it to be able to be this long, but means that you'll pay a ridicilous price for it. The better option would be to get a copper wire instead, which if you want a type c to type c, then there's one with an a relay between two 3m cables. Just get someting like that instead.

one_reviews_text: A vast improvement over the stock strap..Altho the price is Disgusting for what it is and the honest truth is this is the quality of strap that should come as standard on a £300+ game machine..Sheer profiteering nothing less!

one_reviews_text: While not as comfortable as PSVR’s halo strap, this is still a massive step up from the elasticated nylon OG strap. Ostensibly, it clamps the Quest 2 to one’s face, to provide an optimal VR viewing experience - if not always the most comfortable one. £50 is taking the proverbial, though! It should be included as standard to the absurdly cheap headset so one doesn’t feel like they’re being rinsed on accessories
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2021

one_reviews_text: A great improvement on the original strap but you shouldn't have to spend the money on extras just to get the VR unit to site on your face in usable manner.

one_reviews_text: Broke after a 4 days of use!

review_title: Don't buy it yet it's so low quality

one_reviews_text: La correa que viene por defecto en el visor a los 6 días ya se está poniendo fea y no parece que vaya a aguantar el año/año y medio de vida que vaya a tener el visor, así que si no es el Elite Strap habrá que buscar una alternativa.Su instalación es sencilla: primero quitamos la cinta blanca grisácea tirando de los laterales y quitando el velcro de un pasador tras retirar el "antifaz". Al ponerlo en el Strap nos indican en la parte interna con L y R el lado donde debe ir cada parte y el proceso de montaje es apretar los laterales, pasar el velcro por el pasador y colocar la almohadilla.Pros:✔️ La sujeción es buena y hace que no haya que estar reajustándose las gafas cada vez que se mueve la cabeza.✔️ Aunque se incremente el peso sobre la cabeza, se siente mejor distribuido al apretar sobre la nuca en lugar de la frente.✔️ No molesta en la parte superior de las orejas.✔️ Es de bastante mejor calidad que la cinta que trae de fábrica y fácil de limpiar.✔️ Muy rápido de poner y quitar con el sistema de rueda.Contras:❌Me resulta algo incómodo en la parte de la nuca ya que hay que apretarlo considerablemente para que quede bien fijo y no se mueva el visor.❌ Estaba usando una funda pequeña que tenía de las antiguas Quest y con el Strap ya no me sirve. Aumenta las dimensiones del producto en un par de centímetros.❌ Me parece algo caro y seguramente salgan alternativas que lo superen más baratas. Sin embargo, si hubiese venido de serie y el visor hubiera costado 30 euros más no hubiera habido pegas.Conclusión:Creo que la cinta original prácticamente todo el mundo la acabará cambiando. Esta correa es una buena alternativa si no nos importa que aumente las dimensiones del dispositivo ni que la presión se ejerza sobre la nuca. 4/5Edito a día 23 de octubre de 2020: Está habiendo muchos reportes de problemas de calidad, en reddit mucha gente ha posteado que se le ha roto jugando a beat saber. De momento no me ha pasado porque llevo poco usándolo, pero recomendaría para nuevo NO COMPRARLO hasta que se esclarezca el tema. Cambio la valoración a 3/5.
review_date: Reviewed in Spain on October 19, 2020
review_title: Buena sujeción y presión en la nuca

one_reviews_text: Despite hearing this strap is night and day to the default in terms of comfortability, I found this much less comfortable. one_reviews_text: Hi All,I have had a few third party usb c cables that claim to be good for the quest 2 using the usb Type A ports and to be honest third party cables can't hold a candle to the offical oculus fiber optic cable for oclus link.The main benefits are you head set will charge and it will charge fast, how ever you need a REAL usb c port on your computer  NOT AN ADAPTER I do think alot of the issue with people having problem are before there computer is not up to date, mainly there MOTHERBOARD if you have cheaped out on the motherboard in you PC built, you will most likely not be able to use this cable. Only get this cable IF YOU HAVE A MODERN MOTHERBOARD that is decent with usb c ports on the back.Over all I am blown away how good the quality of graphics are now that oculus link are out of beta and the link cable shines, you want PC gaming to be lag free this is your cable handsdown but only if your PC has a USB C port, if you don't have that don't bother getting this untill you upgrade you motherboard or buy a pcie usb c port card.This cable is for people that don't cheap out on motherboards and get the latest IO on there boards.I have also tested this cable out on a macbook pro 16 inch intel in bootcamp windows and works great too.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on January 6, 2021
review_title: Worth it, USB C port required for benefits

one_reviews_text: The elite strap is great in terms of added comfort for longer play sessions. I could barely play for an hour with the original strap due to the lack of support from the back of the head.Due to the multiple reports of the elite breaking, I was hesitant in getting the product, but now that I have had it for a bit it is clear how the design is flawed. Pretty much the main thing to avoid when using the elite strap is do not hinge the strap and headset by grabbing the rear and pulling up/down when putting on or taking off the headset. This will put too much stress on the plastic arms, which have no real strength or reinforcement.My advice is, only put the headset on/off by significantly loosening the strap via the knob and lift off by holding the headset itself. I have been sticking to this and always being cautious on how much stress being placed on the arms and my strap is still break free after months of using it.Other pros:- easier to put on vs original strap- easier to get the headset in the best position for visuals.- comfort- better for holding a link cableCons:- weak design requiring caution and care but can prevent breaks if treated right- can’t really use over ear headphones with the strap
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on May 9, 2021
review_title: It won’t break if you avoid certain things

one_reviews_text: Parto col dire che è un semplice case per il Quest 2, i controller e per altri piccoli accessori che possono essere inseriti nello scompartimento laterale, ed è come me lo aspettavo. Il case è probabilmente più grande di quanto ci si possa aspettare ed al tatto restituisce un buon feeling di solidità: praticamente sembra un grosso sasso vuoto rivestito di peluria. Gli inserti sembrano di alta qualità, e il laccetto per l'apertura non sembra così fragile come lo descrivono. Chiaramente tutta questa ricerca di materiali, design e feeling si paga 49€ (nel mio caso), costo non totalmente giustificato secondo me, dal momento che la scocca superiore risulta essere stata incollata un po' male sul tessuto: il risultato è che, quando chiuso, il case non risulta essere perfettamente simmetrico come nelle foto, cosa che mi lascia l'amaro in bocca. In buona sostanza lo consiglio solo se trovate soddisfazione nel possedere accessori originali, altrimenti indirizzatevi su altro.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on November 19, 2020
review_title: Solida, bella e buon feeling. Con un piccolo difetto.

one_reviews_text: El ordenador tiene problemas para identificar el oculus con este cable, desenchufando otros puertos se solventa (ha vuelto la era de los IRQ's ?). el conector al pc podria se demasiado corto debido al escudo de la placa basealgunos datos de OculusTIPO Cable óptico USB activo completo. USB 3.2 Gen 1 tipo CCONECTORES Visor: USB tipo C en ángulo derecho. PC: tipo C rectoBLINDAJE en espiral de alta calidad con conexión a tierraREQUISITOS DE SEÑAL USB 3.2 Gen 1 con señal de 5 Gbps USB 2 (compatible con versiones anteriores)FUENTE DE ALIMENTACIÓN 3 AANCHO DE BANDA 5 GbpsCARACTERÍSTICAS ADICIONALES Compatible con puertos USB SuperSpeed

one_reviews_text: Ce type de sangle rigide est indispensable pour assurer un bon maintien du casque. Le côté très rigide de la sangle permet d'ajuster le casque en le serrant moins sur le visage. De plus, beaucoup de sacoches de transport sont dessinées pour être compatibles avec cette sangle.CEPENDANT, le plastique utilisé pour les tiges latérales ne résiste pas aux flexions et à la force de serrage. En effet, au bout de seulement 2 mois d'utilisation (environ 200h de jeu) une fissure importante est apparue sur la branche gauche (comme pour beaucoup d'autres clients, cf. tous les autres commentaires sur le sujet). La sangle est donc inutilisable sans risque de casse.J'ai formulé une demande d'échange au SAV Oculus directement, qui est assez réactif, et suis en attente de ma nouvelle sangle, en espérant qu'elle soit plus solide, car pour le prix demandé, la qualité n'est clairement pas là.

one_reviews_text: J'ai acheté cette sangle en vue de remplacer l'horrible sangle par défaut, qui compresse trop fort l'arrière et l'avant du crane. Surtout que j'ai des cheveux longs, qui n'aident pas au maintien.Premier essaie de cette sangle, j'ai senti immédiatement le surplus de confort, indéniablement une must have.Par contre, j'espère ne pas avoir de problème de fiabilité dans le temps, j'ai hésité longuement à l'acheter, mais fasse à l'inconfort de la sangle par défaut, c'était impossible d'attendre plus longtemps, il faut donc savoir que Oculus à la date ou j'écris, à retirer de la vente la sangle élite, et la sangle élite avec batterie, car il y a des problèmes de qualité sur le plastique employé, beaucoup de retour de client mécontent après des casses du plastique, qui ne supporterais pas la pression du serrage.J'ai quand même céder, car avec Amazon, le service client est au top.à voir dans le temps.

one_reviews_text: Much more comfortable than the original strap! Lasted 4 months with gentle care!But a split open through the "Right strap Clip-on" when it wasn't in use, while sat on the table and it developed overnight. Very strange.I contacted Oculus Support about warranty replacement (Not Amazon vendor), given all my details and proof of purchase. It's been a week with Quote: "We are going to look into this and will require more time to look into possible options available to you."For reference, mine was a Pre-order and it has No date codes or serial number. It just has "Made in China" printed inside.Update: a replacement was sent from Oculus free of charge. Very happy with the service!
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on March 20, 2021
review_title: Lasted 4 months, failed over night while resting on the table.

one_reviews_text: Eigentlich klasse, viel bequemer als das Originale. das Gegengewicht durch den Akku macht es auch angenehmer und der Akku selbst eben, mehr Laufzeit.Bringt nur nicht viel wenn es nach 8 Tagen schon kaputt ist. Dieses Rädchen mit dem am einstellt wie fest es sitzen soll rastet nicht mehr richtig ein... bedeutet, wenn man zB nach oben guckt lockert es sich und wackelt auf dem Kopf herum. 92€ für nen Akku und ner Menge billigen Plastik.

one_reviews_text: Not sure what the deal with this product is - and alot of online posts seem to indicate others have this issue - but this doesn't seem to work well using it with a usb c to usb a adapter the software doesn't detect the oculus being plugged in - plugging it directly into the usb c port in my pc it keeps connecting and disconnecting - however using a 3rd party cable works perfectly - for the minor benefit of charging while playing at a very slow pace it would be better to look at cheaper options to avoid the headache
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on January 13, 2021

one_reviews_text: 値段が高いのは電線ではなく光ファイバのためだと思いますが、1～2千円の通常のUSBケーブルと比較しても体感上の違いは分かりません。速度もほぼ同等です。音楽用のＵＳＢケーブルでも、高価で品質がよいのは光ファイバではなく電線なので、光ファイバにするメリットはほとんど無いと思います。むしろ光ファイバだと足や椅子で踏んでしまうと破損してしまいそうです。また、ＰＣ側はType-Cですが、これは相性がありそうで、私のデスクトップの前面と背面のtype-Cでは認識できませんでした。ノートPCのtype-Cコネクタでは認識できたのでケーブルの不良ではないことが分かりましたが、最初はUSB2.0 0.3GHzで認識されました。これを左右ひっくり返して接続しなおしたらUSB3.0　1.8GHzで認識しました。ただし通常はデスクトップで使用するため、現在はType-Cからtype-Aの変換アダプタを使ってデスクトップのtype-Aコネクタに接続しています。ただしこの場合も最初に数百円の安物のアダプタでは認識できなかったのでCableCreationのアダプタに交換したら認識できるようになりました。結論としてはこのケーブルを1万円で買う価値はありません。1～2千円のPC側Type-Aの電線ケーブルをオススメします。
review_date: Reviewed in Japan on March 20, 2021
review_title: 値段ほどの価値はない

one_reviews_text: Akku vom Strap lässt sich nur zu 100% laden wenn das Strap mit der Brille verbunden ist, während des Ladevorgangs.Brille zieht vom Strap Strom, auch im ausgeschalteten Zustand.Also unbedingt ausstecken bei seltenen Gebrauch.Ansonsten ist das Strap hochwertig verbaut und lässt sich gut am Kopf tragen.Vielleicht kann wegen des Ladens und entladens des Akkus ja Softwaretechnich noch nachgebessert werden. Bis dahin gibts nur 3 Sterne.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on December 11, 2021

one_reviews_text: Nada recomendable. Para el precio que tiene no esperaba que se fuese a romper en menos de un mes. Numca ha sido forzada, golpeada ni se ha caido. Siempre se ha abierto a su máxima extensión antes de colocar el visor en la cabeza y aun así se ha roto.

one_reviews_text: No lo recomiendo , un mes de uso moderado cuidandolo a sabiendas de que se rompe y pues en eso no decepciona se rompe y el servicio de garantia de Facebook almenos a Latinoamérica no contesta , se dice que tiene una garantia extendida en noticias sobre su relanzamiento , llevo 4 dias esperando a que contesten , es comodo , si la verdad es muy comodo , pero un mes de comodidad por lo que cuesta , es preferible quemar mejor el dinero o regalarlo
