one_reviews_text: This thing is awful, plain and simple.  Want to feel like you have your head in a vice grip?  Want MORE prominent lines on your face after a playthrough?  Want to make the headset more difficult to store, risk damaging the side speaker ports during installation, and pay $50 for the experience?!?  THEN HAVE WE GOT THE ELITE STRAP FOR YOU!  Enhanced comfort and support?  Only if you consider increasing your neck pain as increasing your comfort.  I'm dumbfounded as to how this was ever produced, as it was clearly never tested pre-production.I bought this stupid thing because I was enjoying my Quest 2 so much I actually wanted to play longer and thought this "enhanced support" headset would make the headset more comfortable so I could easily do so.  At first (first 30 seconds) I was like, "wow, I can see how this thing IS more comfortable!"  Then the neck pain started from the base of my skull, radiating outward.  I thought I had it positioned poorly or something?  Nope.  No matter how you adjust this thing, you can't make it comfortable for longer than 30 seconds.  It redirects the stress of wearing the headset and puts it all on your neck.  I was actually having a mental battle telling myself, "you'll get used to it, just keep wearing it, just keep wearing it."I would liken wearing this POS to wearing bad ice skates.  You know they're supposed to be somewhat uncomfortable and people keep telling you things that don't reduce the pain, like, "they're supposed to be tight," and it's not until you get a pair that kinda fits you that you're like, "man that pair I was wearing was awful!"  This "elite" strap is that bad pair of ice skates.  Unless you've used the original flexible strap that comes with the Oculus, wearing this thing would make you write off Oculus and never want to play again.Putting BACK the ORIGINAL flexible strap that came with the Oculus fixed everything.  Now, I'm gonna see if I'm allowed to return this POS or if I'm stuck with it.  Guess I could use it as a vice grip in my shop, if nothing else?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
review_title: DO NOT BUY THIS- I regret my purchase

one_reviews_text: I don't think the Official link cable is worth it after using it, especially because when you go tethered after being wireless, you really feel inconvenienced and totally RUINS INMERSSION, so get yourself a wifi 5/6 router (for the same price that this thing costs) and set up Airlink or virtual desktop.Also when using this cable with SteamVR games, It's all laggy when I open up the oculus link menu.Also, I would not recommend anyone without a USB C port to get this cable as a means to play PCVR games. First off, this thing does NOT include a USB A adapter. Secondly, your Quest 2 will most likely discharge if you use an adapter because it won't get the 3 amps that it requires, so you will have 2-3 hour playing sessions at max. What I recommend is: get a third-party strap with a battery, or get a battery pack and a Wifi 6 router and enjoy the best of both worlds. This product is definitely overpriced for what it does compared to other solutions. NOT recommended.If ever you are looking for a link cable, get yourself a third-party one that could even include a USB A adapter.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022
review_title: Overpriced considering you could get a Wifi 6 router for about the same price

one_reviews_text: I didn't do anything special with the strap or the goggles, and one day, while they were not even used, the strap broke! Obviously, it is made of an easy to break material, while it should be more flexible and resist some stress. I will try to return it, though I am not sure they will accept. All I can say: you should try to get something else with a more flexible material that can resist more than just a few days.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2021
review_title: Bad material (or design issue?), just broke, I was not even using it!

one_reviews_text: I still bought this head strap after seeing all the negative reviews thinking people were just rough with it. I can attest this strap is comfortable but it will snap on you. I used mine three times and one of the arms broke in half by touching it. I took extra care knowing that others had issues with them breaking and mine still broke. Avoid the headache and find another solution.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021

one_reviews_text: The solid head straps (this Elite Strap included) are usually going to offer a much better experience than soft head straps because the headset does not shift with motion as much. This reduced shifting translates to less motion sickness and an overall clearer experience. When playing active games, it is highly recommended to have the headset as rigidly secured as comfortably possible. This particular strap is what I have on my Quest 2. It has an adjustment nob on the back to get a firm tightness dialed in while on the head, foam padding to reduce unwanted pressure spots, and a top band with Velcro to set the sitting height. This strap is easy to adjust on the fly and has worked well for demoing as most users can quickly set their desired tightness without the need for the height adjustment and get on with playing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021

one_reviews_text: Everyone is complaining about how it breaks but I have had it for a while and it hasn’t broken. I will admit, I don’t play it a lot but I’ve had multiple different people wearing it and switching it to others peoples heads. I’ll update if it breaks
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
review_title: It doesn’t break if you take care of it

one_reviews_text: This thing is freaking adorable and classy looking. I love the felt texture, the hidden zipper, and the whole look of it. It gives off kind of a futuristic vibe, while still looking classy enough to not be out of place in high end homes.The interior is a bit problematic, however, in that it is specifically designed for the official Oculus accessories, and even then just barely. You'll find after having an Oculus for only a short period that you will be buying all sorts of accessories for it. New head straps, face padding, chargers, etc. None of that stuff will fit in this case. The case is just large enough for your headset with its original fabric headstrap, the controllers, and the charging cables. Anything more than that, and you have to start getting really creative. I have managed to get it to fit the Elite headstrap and an additional silicone face cover as well as a couple of extra cables for other accessories, but it's tight.Basically, this looks nice and would be a good travel case for minimal setup, but if you hope to use it as a 100% home storage solution, it's probably not going to cut it unless you are just a minimalist by nature and also happy with the standard Oculus equipment. I prefer the Kiwi headstrap, which absolutely will not fit in this case. So I really won't be using it unless I travel with my Oculus, and that is not likely to happen much. I probably would have just saved my money and not gotten this case had I known at the time of purchase which accessories Id want versus which will fit in this case. But I can hardly blame the case for that.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022

one_reviews_text: Besides how flimsy this thing is I do actually like it. Its conferable and secure. I'm having a replacement sent and if that one breaks I guess I'm just going to return it all the same. But alot of people are reporting this issue So I guess we'll see.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020
review_title: About to break after very little use. less than 10 hours.

one_reviews_text: So, the Quest 2 is able to be sold for so cheap, due to a bunch of cost cutting decisions that they made, including the fact that the default strap, and the general type of strap used with the Quest 2 are utter garbage. To get a decent fit, you need to tighten the included strap like crazy and crush the headset against your face, which is extremely uncomfortable.This "premium" version is only a barely noticeable improvement over the stock strap. For all of the billions of dollars that Facebook (I know they want to change their name, but it will never not be Facebook, in the same way that Alphabet is only known as Google) has, they couldnt design a premium strap that is properly comfortable. This should have been the included strap with the headset, as it looks and feels cheap anyways, it may have increased the bill of materials for the final product by like... $2 at most? I doubt they are selling the Quest 2 for a profit anyways, so I dont know why they didnt want to try to actually impress to some degree. You still need to crush the headset against your face for it to fit well and stay put.You know that Facebook has failed the market when the 3rd party accessories sell a MASSIVE amount more than the official stuff, and that people rave about the 3rd party accessories. Its not a mark of shame to have the 3rd party stuff, instead, its a mark of shame to have the official items.Go get a nice halo-style strap from a 3rd party manufacturer. I will almost guarantee that it will be many times more comfortable and well designed. The halo straps dont actually push the headset against your face, they just hold it in front of your face, so you dont have nearly as much problem with comfort.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought this cable thinking I would have a better experience than using Airlink. I recently got the oculus quest two and upgraded from the oculus rift. So I’m used to using a cable and I don’t mind it however there’s simply no point in spending $80 on this useless overpriced garbage. if you have a 5 GHz Wi-Fi connection then just use air link. The cable does not charge your headset while playing, and there is no noticeable improvement over Airlink. In fact my VR experience is worse using this cable. I thought there would be less than the occasional stutter I get with Airlink and better latency using the cable. But every game across-the-board performs worse when using the oculus link cable. there is also a black screen glitch that happens pretty often when are using the link cable. The glitch happens once or twice every time I play and I’m not sure what causes it but basically whenever you boot up a game sometimes your entire display is just black. I do not have this issue with Airlink. When this glitch happens I have to restart my headset. There is already a little bit of set up and inconvenient factors of playing VR so experiencing this glitch is a little frustrating when you just want to get in the game. So basically there is no noticeable improvements over Airlink and performance is actually worse with the cable.  my specs are rtx 2080 super, i7 9700k and 16gb of ram.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022

one_reviews_text: This headstrap is definitely an improvement over the jockstrap that comes with the Quest 2. However, it's baffling why this isn't the default strap as opposed to a $40 upgrade. To those that would make some comment about the Quest 2 already being a low price as it is, I don't think including the elite strap as the default would have been too much of a financial hit for Oculus since apparently the materials are very low quality (if previous reviews are anything to go off of).
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022
review_title: Makes the Quest 2 more comfortable, but...

one_reviews_text: I got this in February 2021. I got it at the same time as my Quest 2. It worked great until I came up and pulled it out of the case and the arm snapped. I didn’t think I was especially hard on it. When not in use it was in the case. The case wasn’t abused either. The plastic just snapped. I don’t know what else to say. I gave it two stars because if you had asked me yesterday it was a great product. But it broke in a little over 7 months, with probably 30 uses. Not great.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2021
review_title: Broke in 7 months of light use.

one_reviews_text: The support on this is much better. My and my friends are much more willing to have play sessions longer than an hour long!I heard there was a batch of manufactured units of this product that the plastic wasn't treated right and that's what has caused breaking in some units. If I remember correctly, Meta said they had fixed this issue in recent batches.I bought one, it hasn't broken on me yet! I better go find some wood to knock on

one_reviews_text: Even though this is probably the most expensive cable to use as a link cable for Oculus Quest, it stopped charging the Quest after about 3 months of use.  Oculus "support" has been giving me the run around since the defective cable failed.  The Oculus support representatives keep asking me for the same information over and over again.  Each time they tell me that they have lost my support ticket and handed my case over to a different representative when I supply the requested information.  I am finding the experience rather frustrating.So far, I have been unable to obtain a replacement for the defective cable.  Originally I purchased this cable thinking that the official Oculus cable would work best and I would get the best support.  Meanwhile, the cheapy cable I first purchased when I got the Quest still works.

review_title: Expensive Cable, Failed Within a Few Months, Poor Support

one_reviews_text: I love my Oculus Quest 2 and thought this was going to be a great upgrade.  It fit well and was easy to adjust until it snapped.  The hard plastic on the side just snapped while I was putting it on.  I had the elite strap less than 30 days and maybe had 10 to 12 actual VR sessions using the Elite strap.  I am very disappointed because it snapped two days after my return window closed with Amazon, and I have yet to receive any reply on my support request to Facebook.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
review_title: Was nice while it lasted (less than 30 days)

one_reviews_text: This is nowhere near the comfort of the PSVR or Rift S halo straps. I love the halos for those headsets and was hoping to add that same level of comfort to my Quest2 but that is not what I got. The attachments to the speakers is janky at best and there is almost no adjustment for where the headset sits on your face with this strap. It doesn't transfer the weight very well either, during play the headset is constantly sliding down my face slowly. I've tried all sorts of adjustments on the top strap and halo tightness but it's never worked better than the Q2 elite strap from oculus. On top of all that the band of the halo strap blocks my headphones from sitting in the right place on my head so I can't use my good headphones for VR with this strap. The quality is definitely there and I will buy another one if they fix some of these design issues but in its current state it just is not there yet.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021
review_title: Good quality but not so good design.

one_reviews_text: When I first bought this, it was much better than the original head strap that the headset came with.  It was more comfortable and provided a more secure fit to my head.  After a while though I noticed that when looking around, it would easily come loose.  Just the weight of the headset alone seems to loosen the strap when looking around quickly.  The wheel on the back that tightens the strap doesn't seem to have the strength to stay tight even from just a light tug on the headset.  Ideally, that wheel should be the only way to tighten and loosen it.  I shouldn't be able to lightly pull on the thing and have it loosen up.  Kind of makes it worthless as the whole point of VR is to look around and be surrounded by your environment.  So, that's my experience with it.So, 3 stars since it seems to be built well and fits nicely.  It worked well in the beginning.  Much better than the original strap, but I'll need to find a way to make this thing stay tight on my head.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2021

one_reviews_text: I decided to go with the Oculus Link Cable, even though it is expensive, since it is the official cable for the Quest 2. As a link cable and to use SteamVR it works fine, however, it does not charge / slow down discharge for the Quest 2 AT ALL. The headset died in less than 2 hours, which was quite annoying and forced me to end gaming sessions / VR Raves far too early.After a quick Google search, I found that TONS of people were having the same issue. some possible solutions offered were purchasing a Type A adapter and plugging it into a USB 3.0 type slot on your computer, however that did not work out for me.I ended up purchasing an Anker powerline USB 3.0 type c cable and it works faaaarr better at 1/4 of the price. I attended a 5 1/2 VR chat rave and the Quest 2 battery percentage barely reached 70%. I am very impressed with the Anker cable and deeply regret purchasing the Oculus link cable.if you need a link cable for your quest 2, go with the Anker powerline type c cable.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2021

one_reviews_text: We do not use our headsets very much, maybe 3 to 4 hours a month. We purchased 2 elite straps and this one is falling apart.  The side of the solid plastic support is cracking in multiple places and is no longer able to be used.  It's most likely a factory defect since my other elite strap is still mint condition despite being used the same amount as the defective one.  I guess just be cautious when purchasing and look it over thoroughly before using.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
review_title: Does not hold up over time

one_reviews_text: This product does what it is supposed to do and it does it well.The price is a bit steep in my opinion but it is a high quality cable and delivers very fast transfer speeds.As others have stated, you will need a usb c connection on your pc to take advantage of the high speed transfer rates. Using an adapter to usb 3 will throttle the connection but it does work. I used an adapter at first and then installed a true usb c port on my PC. The difference was noticeable to me.The one thing to bear in mind with this cable is that it is heavy and subject to getting twisted up.I would highly recommend using a cable support system to suspend the cable from the ceiling or another high point so that the cable does not drag while you are playing.Better yet, use SideQuest and Virtual Desktop to run a wireless connection. You will need this cable in order to connect wirelessly so definitely pick one up.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020
review_title: Works great but heavy and gets twisted up

one_reviews_text: This Product is a waste of money. I'm upset that I bought it. It performs worse than third party cables, and has the added deficit of only being a type c to type c connection. Type c is a horrible connection especially for vr you are moving all the time and the poor grip from the type c connection will loose. The quest 2 is a great product, but this chord is not, and I would recommend a third parties chord. One with usb 3 to type c.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021

one_reviews_text: The battery life supplements normal use very well: you get an indicator of Oculus battery as well as the % of the extended battery which is very useful. It also doesn't have the problems 3rd party batteries have where you have issues with Oculus using the available power efficiently (or at all occasionally). In short, it just works.The strap sucks so hard. It very brittle. It is SO UNCOMFORTABLE. I can't overstate that enough. It was so uncomfortable that I didn't even want to play. You can't slip it on and off like you can with the fabric straps. They are also super anti consumer and have glued the entire elite strap together. You can't disassemble it without breaking something off. I saw screws and thought I could disassemble it; WRONG. They're there for appearances only. You have to break this thing to take it apart which means it's a paper weight after warranty, or if you aren't covered by warranty like if you buy from a 3rd party seller or ebay.I ended up cutting the straps off and I velcro strapped the battery to my fabric harness. It is way more compact now, more comfortable to wear and I get a better battery for AirLink use.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2022

one_reviews_text: I bought this after oculus restarted selling them after they paused to address breaking issues.  I thought they would’ve sorted it out by then but less than a month of using it it broke in a similar way as others have reported.  I think what finally did it was when I was trying to tighten it for someone with a much smaller head then mine.  After they finished using it the crack appeared.  Besides the cracking issue it has so much better than the standard strap.  I was able to workout with supernatural which requires a lot of physical movement without the oculus moving around so much.  Since I sent my elite strap back i went back to using the standard strap to workout with supernatural and the amount of motion it has while working out makes me feel sick.  You have to do squats in the game and sway side to side and for me without the elite strap it was unbearable.  I’m in search of another strap that won’t break.  Currently waiting for the eyglo strap that had the same cupping concept behind the head as the elite strap.  I believe that played an important factor in how it limited the oculus from swaying around while working out.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
review_title: Much better than standard strap until it breaks

one_reviews_text: One of the side plastic parts had broken after a few months of light use, around a dozen uses in total. Oculus is aware of the quality issue (just google "broken quest 2 elite strap"), but won't ship the replacement part to a "warehouse" address and won't explain why.I'm basically forced to pay full price for another copy of the same item, which makes the already expensive part waaay too expensive.Going with a 3rd party alternative this time - hopefully these are made from higher quality materials...Super disappointed with their support.Whoever is interested in the details:I live abroad and, while I can easily buy the part from Amazon, Oculus provides support.They won't ship abroad even at my expense and I don't have a residential address in the US, so my only solution to use a 3rd party service that has a US address and can forward the package abroad.For some reason they treat this address as "warehouse address" and refuse to ship there, leaving me with no solution.FWIW, the support people are very nice, but they just repeat "can't do anything without a residential address".
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2021
review_title: Broken after a dozen uses, won't ship the replacement

one_reviews_text: 9 out of 10 for comfort....1 out of 10 for durability.Looks like just preaching to the choir now..but the original strap was such a nuisance I told myself I would go with the elite strap and be "very careful"...despite all the cracked strap reviews (folks must be shortcutting the loosing to take off part and getting  too aggressive).  Thought it was a game changer...very comfortable and easy adjusting between different folks.  Recommended to many. But then it happened...snapped like a potato chip after 2 months of use...shocked me because it really wasn't getting stressed when it snapped.  You would think for the price it cost they could use a more durable material ( i swear is must have be purferated the way it snapped)  Now I wish I would have used a strong duct tape to give the straps some reinforcement skin to prevent this ( though im not sure how much more life that would have bought me)  Back with the awful original strap until I can find a better more durable alternative..not going to burn another $50 with this again.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
review_title: 9 out of 10 for comfort....1 out of 10 for durability. Waste of $ in long run

one_reviews_text: My husband and I both got Oculus as an early Christmas present from my in laws. Mine had this strap but my husband's did not.After trying both the standard elastic one and this solid one we both agree that the elastic one give us pressure headaches if we play for any slightly long period of time.But not this solid one. It adapts better to your head without having to setting up super tight to keep your eyes in the right position. Oculus have a very specific spot in the googles that your eyes should be lined up with to see things well and not blurry. So with the elastic one there's no wiggle room. Either you put it very tight so it stays in a good position or it tends to move around (causing everything to look slightly blurry) while you play.If you get headaches or have issues with the standard elastic strap I highly recommend buying this one. It helps a lot.I get headaches very easily (sunglasses, headbands, headphones, etc ) and this strap really makes a difference.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2021

one_reviews_text: Only had this for a little over three months and just noticed a crack n the band. You can see it in the photo provided. I am afraid to use it now for fear of it breaking it completely. I am now forced to go back to the  original cloth head strap, which I found uncomfortable and difficult to keep the headset in place.I would like to return it for a refund so I can hopefully find a head strap that I can trust. It just seems it is not a matter of if, but a matter of when one of these straps will break. For some reason, I no longer have a link in my previous orders list to instigate the procedure. Also, I cannot find a contact link to the seller either.Now it is just a matter of whether I can find someone to fix this issue.

one_reviews_text: Have used my headset for weeks without this strap and always held off since the reviews of them breaking and cracking after short periods of time. Decided to go ahead and buy it anyway and wow! The experience is SO much better with this. No more fatigue on my forehead or my nose after hours of use and I feel more comfortable knowing my head is supported. Definitely recommend.

one_reviews_text: What makes this strap different than the original is that in the back - there is a turn know (like a construction hardhat) that allows you to tighten or loosen the strap.  I like the design but it is not designed for people with 'fat heads' (I'm 6"6" adult male) and the pressure on my cheek bones (even at the 'most open' setting) was too much.I wish they would include a 'max suggest' size so that you can know in advance if it will work for you.  OR maybe if they made other sizes!?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_title: Neat design but not designed for 'fat heads'

one_reviews_text: This is exactly what I expected and what I needed. I had bought the Vive custom audio strap and it was big and bulky and would not fit in any of my cases. I had bought it for the head phones that come with it but now that I have my gaming chair, I don't need the head phones. If I need to be quite and not make any noise I can always use my Bluetooth headset, which fits comfortably around my VR headset. I prefer the chair because of the extra entertainment value and the way it sounds that also includes vibration.The Elite strap now fits perfectly in my case and I was able to secure the VR Power battery onto it with no issues. The battery actually sits much better on this strap because of the way it sits on the strap. I can push it down into the case in the center of the strap as opposed to the Vive custom audio strap that was stationary and was not possible to move down into the case and thereby making it positioned to high for the case to close. All in all, this is what you want for a perfect fit into the case, a more comfortable fit, because it's lighter and just fits around my head much more ergonomically. Last but not least, it has the adjustment knob indented into the back part of the strap. This is important for it to fit just right into the case. Don't cheap out and buy any of the Frankenstien versions of this strap. The knob on the back sticks out making it more of a challenge to fit into a case. I hope this helps. Rock on!Update: Wow! This keeps getting better and better. I've found that while using my stand for the Oculus, it's much easier to take on and off the stand. As I continue to use it I find other advantages. I've discovered that the control wheel on the back that's used to adjust the fit around your head works much faster. I can adjust the fit in a matter of seconds as opposed to the Vive, which was harder to turn the knob, took more turns to adjust the right fit. The adapter that's required for the Vive kept sliding off if you tightened it to much. I had to wrap velcro around it to keep in place but even then, it would slide off just not as easy. I just thought I would add this information to help you make a better buying decision. This is really a no-brainer. I know I'm siting but for those that are standing, I would seriously consider buying a good set of headphones, or hooking it up to your home theater receiver thru Bluetooth.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021

one_reviews_text: I purchased one of these to try it out, and was at first quite happy, as the fit was much better than the included elastic strap. I quickly purchased another and that was our defacto strap for our two Oculus Quest 2s. I did noticed that it was fatiguing on the eyes/face/temples, so I bought a third-party "forehead" strap, which I prefer; my kids prefer the Elite Strap.Unfortunately, I can say that after a few months of use, one of the Elite Straps snapped. Thankfully, we had the spare, since I was using the third party one. I have been attempting to repair the broken one with some epoxy and plastic supports this weekend. As I did so, I examined the other Elite Strap. It, too, had split halfway on one side! For a $50 strap, this seems a poor design, and I definitely won't be replacing either with a new Elite Strap. The third party one is working like a champ, so that's where my money will be going.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2021
review_title: Decent for, but breaks after repetitive use.

one_reviews_text: Purchased this Oculus Quest 2 Elite Strap on Mar 20, 2021 for $49, played it once a few weeks for a while and it was OK. I didn't play it recently though. Today I opened the case and just found the strap to be broken like this!! How can it break like this when it was just sitting inside a cardboard box?? Did the plastic just decide to biodegrade or something?? Or is it the cold weather?? No idea. I'm off to buy a new strap from Kiwi, at least that one's side straps are flexible and not cheap brittle plastic like this! Meta (previously called Facebook) should stop making this and release a better version!

one_reviews_text: Does the trick, better than the strap the quest 2 comes with. Not the best balance, doesnt completely balance the front woth the back weight but if you did want that much weight overall on your head it would start to feel too heavy if you wanted the front and back of quest 2 to be completely weight balanced. one_reviews_text: I received a cheap offbrand TNE link cable that came in a black bag.  It is NOT the official Oculus link cable.  Has the letters TNE on the end of the cable.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021

one_reviews_text: Broke after a couple of months of use. Same story you read from others. The left side started cracking and eventually it broke. Now I am in contact with Oculus to get a replacement, hopefully. Too bad Im beyond the 30 days for a refund. I would advise others to seek out other straps from 3rd parties. The Elite Strap is more comfortable than the default one, but in my experience, there was still some noticeable discomfort, specially because it doesnt support the front portion of the headset that well, and it weighs down on your forehead. However, it is easier and faster to put on than the original strap thanks the dial on the back. If you are a glass wearer like me, I can say it's not that much more comfortable than the original, and because this weighs on your forehead, you will want to tighten it a bit more to your face so it's not dangling, which will push your glasses back and into your eye sockets. It all depends on the size and shape of your head, and how big your glasses are, but my head is average, and I got small glasses to play VR, and I still had issues. Like I said, look into 3rd party alternatives.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
review_title: Broke in a couple of months

one_reviews_text: This gets a 1 star.. No way in heck this item was quality tested. No sir.. We've all been the idiot who disregarded people's comments thinking the error was on the user.. But this product here has some real flaws. Mainly from the long hard plastic strap that connects the headset itself, to the circular crank in the back..Unless you want to be the annoying guy who is always lecturing people on how to take on and off the headset properly, then this isn't for you.. We brought this product to easter this year, and it passed through many folks hands, without the disclaimer of "Blah blah blah you have to put it on and take it off like this blah blah blah". Let alone, i'm not going to spend my evening cracking down on people putting it on and taking it off properly.. I'd rather not be annoying and just eat the $50 cost, which i have now done.TLDR- The strap is a hard plastic, where if you don't put it on or take it off properly, it will crack. Ours had 1 major crack after the night, and a plethora of spider cracks all the way up and down the strap.A family member replaced it after they found out it was broken at the party, i told them to return it and keep their money cause the product isn't worth it.. Survived about 2 months with just me, and only 1 family function.. Back to the stock strap which is the better strap at the end of the day.. Sad..
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021

one_reviews_text: The USB-C cable ecosystem is a mess and it's hard to find proper cables for linking Oculus, or to know whether a given generic cable would work; this one's primary value is that we know it will work for sure. I would recommend trying something cheaper but from a known brand, and then relying on a seller's return policy if it does not work out. I will say that the wired Link experience that this cable enables is OK, but I think a completely wireless (AirLink) situation would be much, much better. If your home wifi isn't fancy/new enough to support Airlink though, then a cable like this one will be needed. I would recommend a cable like this to every Oculus Quest 2 owner who also PC games as it is very neat. Again, this is guaranteed to work which is why I spent the money, but there are much cheaper alternatives.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022
review_title: Works but is very overpriced and there are cheaper options

one_reviews_text: This strap was pretty sweet for a few months. I preordered it with my quest. It’s way more comfortable than the elastic cloth strap that comes with the headset, and it fit over my gargantuan head with glasses pretty easily. Which was a huge relief. Then people started reporting them breaking. So, naturally, I started babying the heck out of it. At this point I was sure it was going to be okay, but better safe than sorry, right? Finally, the day after Christmas, I go to put it on and I notice it’s feeling pretty loose and unstable. BOOM! Right by the back where it tightens, it’s hanging on by a thread and looks like a cracked window. So that sucks. Especially since I bought the same setup for my wife and now know it’s only a matter of time.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

one_reviews_text: Lasted 1 month and snapped. Be very delicate when picking it up or it will break. Very weak side straps. Plastic has no give and snapped
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021

one_reviews_text: Got this so I could develop VR apps on my Quest 1 running the Unity dev environment on my PC for fast scene iteration and play exclusive Rift / Steam VR games.I had bought some other compatible Link cables before the official Oculus cable was available/in stock which worked but these cables were a lot less convenient as they were fairly inflexible and shorter at around 10ft so I felt tethered to the PC by something that could do double duty towing fully laden oil tankers.The Oculus cable worked great initially, plugged into a powered USB C expansion card so it was able to keep the headset charged even during heavy use and was flexible so there wasn't the same degree of annoying drag on the headset. The Oculus PC app also reported I was getting full USB 3.2 speeds so performance was spot on.My issue is similar to other reviewers, I wasn't super careful with this cable and recently saw a right angle kink in the cable where it probably got caught under something and then yanked or bent. When I foolishly tried to straighten it out I felt/heard a nasty "tink" noise, which I assume was one or more of the fiber optic cables cracking and now the cable doesn't work correctly.I'd love to replace my broken cable with another Oculus Link cable as it really is the best wired Oculus Link experience I've tried but at $80 (or ~$70 on sale) every time I or my family is momentarily careless around one of these cables that could turn into a really expensive hobby so I'm probably switching back to the cheaper, heavier, slower but more robust cables unless I can get AirLink working?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021
review_title: Great, while it worked but possibly a little too fragile for regular klutzy folk?

one_reviews_text: Oculus has not yet fixed their quality control issues with this headstrap. There are alternative and highly reviewed straps available here and you should steer clear from this product. Not only because it will break, but because the replacement process is arduous for a product with known defects.My headstrap broke within a week of normal use, down the center of the left piece. I contacted Oculus customer service and proceeded to be asked to provide a picture of the broken strap, the serial number, the serial number of my Quest 2, my name and address, and several bits of personal info. I was handed from one rep to the next and sent 7 emails over the course of a month to get a replacement.Instead, they sent me a friggin code to print out a shipping label and ship back the strap after all that and asked me to provide my own shipping package. No. I'm not finding my own box, printing a label, and taking 15 minutes of my day to head to the Post Office because of how terrible you're product is.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
review_title: I wish I had known to AVOID this product

one_reviews_text: I ordered this "Elite" Strap and recievedit on 10/19/20.  And tonight it just snapped in two.  I'm extremely disappointed after how much it cost!  I'm not a big gamer and only use it 2 maybe 3 times a week for about an hour.  Some weeks I don't use it at all.  So it isn't like I'm using it constantly.  This was a complete waste of money!!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021
review_title: Waste of money, does not last.

one_reviews_text: So I pre-ordered this because all of the reviews said that this was a must have for the Quest 2. So I got it it is an improvement from the original strap I did have problems with getting like tension headaches and I don't know if that was user error or not.I would've given this a 5 start review if not for 2 things. The first being the price. 50 bucks was a bit of a hard pill to swallow for this headstrap. It is made of plastic and is not anything particularly fancy. I was going to wait to see if there would be any third party solutions but there doesn't seem to be any as of yet. The second thing is the thing broke!!! I have seen that this is a common issue with the elite headstrap. It snapped right at the connection point. I am a college student and haven't had much time to use the headset since receiving it so I was shocked when I put on the headset and heard the snap of the strap.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020
review_title: Better than the clothstrap but not worth the price tag

one_reviews_text: I have tried using the official cable since day 1 with Steam VR, but it is consistent in disconnecting me at random only to ask if I want to enable the link again from the Quest Home. I have searched online and none of the solutions currently available resolve this issue. I bought a third party cable for a fraction of the price and have not had any issues with it dropping me like this, but I sacrifice the ability to fast charge while playing and no access to my mic for speaking to others. In doing this, this confirms for me that the issue is the cable itself. I do not recommend the official cable for the quest 2.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
review_title: Do not spend your money on this.

one_reviews_text: In less than than 10 total hours of total (light) use, the strap developed a crack.  Must have happened when tightening or taking it off.Return process took 1 week, four emails and five pictures to get authorized.Had to provide my own box.Been waiting a week for confirmation they recieved my strap...Thoughts:  looks great and fits securely, but places too much pressure on the face.  Should be more halo-style.  My Samsung Odyssey Plus and HP Mixed Reality tethered helmets are far more comfortable with halo straps.  Also needs a rethink of stress points and material composition.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_title: Developed a crack in first two weeks of use

one_reviews_text: I bought this and have tried to make it work for 2 months now… and I’ve absolutely failed. The zipper (CHEAP) is constantly snagging due to the shape and design of this container. The zipper also, if that wasn’t bad enough, has an extra small strap on it meant, I guess, to make zipping easier, but with how small and thin it is, and with how often the zipper snags... what it really seems to be made to do is cut into your hand and/or fall apart at any second.And if any of this wasn’t enough, since the exterior is a fabric.. exterior which slowly but surely gets dirtier with no reliable/simple way to actually clean it.. making this day by day look worse and worse.Well it’s obvious that Oculus has an absolute blunder here. Look elsewhere and you will save yourself time, effort, and frustration.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2022

one_reviews_text: The fact that this didn’t come with a USB-C to USB-A adapter after dropping $75 on a cable and $400 on a headset is quite annoying. Not only does Facebook censor everything, but they also want to take all your money too apparently. Absolutely ridiculous. Cable should have came with the headset in the first place. Tired of wasting my money. Please explain why you couldn’t include these items?!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
review_title: Don’t get this item or an Oculus

one_reviews_text: You will want this cable over the unofficial link cables if you want low latency tracking. The fiber optics and fast two way data transfer rate make this cable the only choice for a quality VR experience with the quest 2. The differences are particularly noticeable on higher end hardware at 120hz, and in fast paced games like beat saber which was completely unplayable for me on expert + wirelessly with air link/ virtual desktop or with the unofficial link cables. Just be aware that this cable will not charge your headset, so gameplay time will be limited (heavily at 120hz to about 2 hours) but the quality is quite good after forcing bitrate to 500mbps and turning off dynamic bitrate in the oculus debug tool. There are almost no video compression artifacts present after doing this! A much better experience visually than wireless play and the only way to experience pcvr with solid tracking on the quest 2. I have yet to do quest 1 testing, but I assume the results would be similar.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
review_title: Great for quality VR and fast data throughput

one_reviews_text: We appreciated the comfort of this elite strap.  It was delivered to us in mid February and it's now early May and the strap just literally snapped.  We aren't hard on our equipment and we take care of all the components.  I have no idea what caused this to snap but I'm really unhappy that we didn't even get to enjoy this for 6 months and it's out of the return window.  I'd appreciate the manufacturer and/or seller replacing this defective item for us.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021

one_reviews_text: As others have mentioned the plastic is inferior and will break.  I assumed when I read about others issues that they were heavy users or were simply careless.  This I think however is simply the type of plastic that takes very little stress to fracture and you'll not have used it for a while and suddenly notice a new break in the side straps.  I'm an extremely light user and yet multiple breaks have appeared.  Its reasonably comfortable but thats of little use with this sort of quality.  (Updated to 1 star as the plastic has continually broken down.  Unless they've changed the plastic, AVOID!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021

The sounds it makes is really annoying as well. If your moving around a lot it sounds like plastic parts grinding against each other all the time. Not very “immersive”. Mines now just collecting dust now.

one_reviews_text: The top negative reviews for this cable are laughable... They don't know what they are doing and don't understand modern technology... This cable will allow you to max your bitrate out in oculus debug tool to 500 mbps, making it exactly like a native display vr headset (oculus link compresses the video, etc.)... It will also allow you to keep 100% battery charge the entire time you are using it... I only use it for PCVR so the battery not draining is a huge plus.... Also the weight is half or more than any other non-fiberoptic cables... Have had this cable for over a year and it's the only one you need....
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
review_title: Only cable for native VR and 100% battery

one_reviews_text: I just recently bought parts for my PC so that I could run my Oculus better on it and I wanted to top off the great experience with a better cord to run VR with than my actual charger cable. This cord from my experience with it is well worth your money!!! It is a very long cord so if the area your playing the Oculus in is far away from your PC you have no problems there and it is a very high quality piece of hardware as well! It runs my PCVR experience perfectly and is a very well built cord as well! If I could give this cord 10 stars I would because it has really changed my VR experience for good!!

one_reviews_text: Thought about the cheaper ones but glad I decided to get the Oculus brand!  It should have came standard with my Oculus.  I use it for working out with the Supernatural app and it works perfectly for the amount of movement that I do, it sits nice and tight to the face.  The cup design at the rear of the strap cradles your skull like a baby.  Love the sleek design and the inconspicuous knob for adjusting the fit.  Unlike other no name designs where it looks like a bulky knob, the Elite has it integrated with the design so you don't see it.  If you're thinking of buying a replacement strap, LOOK NO FURTHER cause you found it!

one_reviews_text: One of the most disappointing purchases I’ve made. This product was supposed to be a game changer in comfortability, it is listed in everybody’s “must have” accessories for the oculus quest 2. However I’ve only had mine for about 5 weeks and it clean snapped in half while I was putting it on. I hardly applied any stress to the straps, as I’m always careful with my oculus, but as you can see in the photo it just snapped while I was putting it on to play today. Not to mention I only play my quest for about 3-5 hours a week. There isn’t a single scratch on the headset as I try to take care of my things. The only explanation is that this is made from a pretty cheap plastic. It is very comfortable and noticeably stopped the headset from wobbling, but we are about 7 days outside of the 30 day warranty window. I would not buy this again. I’d rather try my luck with a 3rd party option that is cheaper.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
review_title: Headset snapped from light use 5 weeks after purchase.

one_reviews_text: I made this purchase because the standard battery life for the Oculus Quest 2 is subpar. I felt like I couldn't have any extended gaming session without having to plug my headset in and stand near the charger - a completely unintuitive way to play.Installation was very simple. You just unsnap the old head strap from the sides of the Oculus and remove the strap from the loop on top.Additionally, the Elite head strap fits much better on my head and is easier to adjust, thanks to the dial on the rear that you can twist to make it fit perfectly.The extended battery life is great. I wish this was included with the Oculus straight out of the box, but since it isn't, this is the best purchase for those seeking added battery life and comfort.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
review_title: Perfect add-on for extended battery life and comfort.

one_reviews_text: This strap is super nifty while it stays in one piece. I was wary of buying this after reading some of the negative reviews, especially with it be $50. Turns out, should have gone with my gut. This thing started falling apart less than a year after buying it. Contacted Oculus support, and they said it is outside the 30 return window, so there is no way to return it. Still communicating with them about it. Will try to remember to update this post later on the outcome.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021
review_title: This strap is great until it falls apart!

one_reviews_text: Very useful for streaming when Wi-Fi connection is poor or nonexistent. Hooked up to my PC with this cable, I can use Side Quest to cast to my computer and then connect an HDMI to the TV and everyone can see me play. No lag whatsoever — very good quality image and frame rate. I appreciate how long it is, yet still very durable. It’s definitely pricey, but I hesitated to trust any 3rd party cables due to reviews about their data transfer speeds not being up to par.

Broke as soon as I plugged in. Was wondering why I couldn't connect, went to check cable and when I went to remove metal stayed in port... Again...And the port is fine... I use it frequently...

one_reviews_text: This strap works fine, but I quickly switched it out for the Kiwi strap and am far happier with that one. I will still be using this one when I travel because it fits in the official travel case, while the Kiwi strap does not. But for comfort level, this one just does not cut it. It works far better than the fabric strap the Oculus comes with, but the back is not large enough to really cup the back of the head and prevent the weight of the goggles from pressing down into your cheeks. As a result, wearing the device with this head strap causes face fatigue much faster than with the Kiwi strap.

review_title: Better than the fabric, not as good as Kiwi

one_reviews_text: Went through 2 of these in less than 6 months.  Look VR is accident prone.  One hard tug on this chord and it is toast.  The end that isn’t elbowed, the one meant to go Into the PC, yeah it’s super fragile.  I took steps to avoid a break with my second, but that didn’t save it.Save your money, buy a USB-C to USB 3 cable.  The ones with really high data transfer rates do a good job of keeping the headset charged as you play linked to your PC.  Your battery still drains but you’ll be fatigued well before that happens, trust me.  VR is best played in short stints anyways.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
review_title: Break Easily, Something Anathama to VR Products

one_reviews_text: Pro: much more comfortable than the original head strap.Con: Like many others have reported this broke with under 50 hours of use. This has never been dropped, over tightened, or stored incorrectly. Around the 30 hour mark the back rubber head strap randomly detached (picture 1) after playing one day, but we continued to use it. Yesterday around the 50 hour mark the plastic band just broke while putting it on.In short: you would probably have better luck getting a different brand. I loved the headset before it broke, but an item of this price that breaks that easily, without any sort of rough handling, is not worth your money. I definitely wouldn’t get this for a kid that wouldn’t be as careful with it as I was.

one_reviews_text: Wow, these really do break easily. Even when always handled carefully. Crazy that this got past the testing stage. You can feel how thin and weak the plastic is. Wish I would’ve known about this issue before buying but luckily I’m still in the Amazon return window. They really should stop selling these completely and trash all of the Elite Straps in circulation. There shouldn’t be a return window since this is a known issue. Seems like the best VR head strap by far.

one_reviews_text: I bought these for my boyfriend to pair with his Quest 2 because when he was just using the stock headset, there wasn’t enough support in the back and the headset would put a lot of weight abs pressure towards the front. He would come upstairs with his forehead peeling so we needed to give these a try and this has made such a huge difference. He said it’s like night and day. They help support and he no longer feels uncomfortable. I’m super happy with this purchase knowing he can enjoy his VR time better. Also there’s been a lot of comments on this breaking, but we have had this for a week and are careful and have not had issues.

one_reviews_text: Fabric-wrapped cardboard, and a zipper that won't happily go all the way around unless I smoosh the case to subtly realign the seam between top and bottom.It does its job of bundling everything together well enough, but it's clearly not going to protect much, and it doesn't even feel particularly luxurious, so... why on earth did this run me $50?My best guess is that charging far and above the actual value of this thing in some places (such as here), is subsidizing the bundles at Costco and the official Oculus website where this case is thrown in for free on certain purchases. Glad I could get someone else a good deal, but if you're not feeling so charitable, I'd probably just go 3rd party for your storage/transport solution.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021

one_reviews_text: Charges great but bleeds off in a short period of time if not used.  Guessing the board must have something that checks the batteries and discharges the battery on board and this extended battery at the same time…. Likely check or something is working while unit is not in use and drains battery.  If you unplug it from the headset when not in use, it will store the charge.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2022

one_reviews_text: I wish this just came with the Quest 2 out of the box. it's worth the extra 50 bucks. With the cloth strap, the pain in my forehead would linger for a day. It's that much pressure. (Might also be that I have a big melon.) With the elite strap, the pressure is still there but it doesn't cause any pain. It sort of splits the pressure between your forehead and face. I'm definitely staying in VR longer and more comfortably with the Elite Strap. I wish the comfort was more like the PSVR where the headset sort of just hangs in front of your face and putting zero pressure anywhere but I understand that's probably not possible for a stand-alone device.I've read that it would probably be even better with the one that has a battery built in but I'm probably gonna get a third party battery.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
review_title: A true must for the Quest 2

one_reviews_text: I've had this almost 6 months, the plastic in the strap is garbage.  Mine has started to crack and will ultimately fail.  I get that the Quest 2 is cheap to start and you can build upon it, liked that when I purchased...HOWEVER, you can't market a item that doesn't last under 6 months of light use as elite or any kind of upgrade.  I'm glad I held onto the original strap because I'm going to need it soon.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021

one_reviews_text: This is definitely a much better and more comfortable setup than the soft strap. Where the soft strap went over and hurt my ears this takes most of the weight and distributes it evenly through the top rather than the sides. It’s much easier to adjust and take off and put on than the original soft strap that comes prepackaged with the Quest 2. If you wear your VR more than once in awhile this is a must have addition as it makes it much easier all around and more comfortable, allowing not only longer gaming sessions but peace of mind.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2022
review_title: A must have if you use your Oculus Quest 2 often!

one_reviews_text: Avoid at all costs. Having gone through three of these things now, handling both with kid gloves to the point of absurdity, I've come to the conclusion that whatever process they use to manufacture these things is fatally flawed. They will snap on you eventually. It may take two weeks, two months or several, but there is a high chance they will break along the side, even if you treat them very delicately. They stopped selling them at the end of last year to fix the manufacturing process, or so they claim. Having gone through two of them since they began to resell them in late December, I see no difference in quality. Avoid, go third party.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2021

one_reviews_text: Mine snapped on the side, lasted under 2 months. By the looks of it, that made me one of the lucky ones. Felt great with the VR Power for extra battery and balancing, but sadly not good quality.

one_reviews_text: The big selling points here are a) official cable and b) charges while you play. Well as far as a) goes it's still really janky, connecting whenever it feels like and for b) it BARELY charges. You'll get maybe an extra 30 minutes of play. For this price, it's absurd. And with a decent router you can have a nearly identical experience that is wireless. Also, this cable loves to curl up. Just a big time rip-off.

one_reviews_text: I'm changing my review after using it for a couple months.  The strap started to become brittle and cracked then broke.  Very poor quality and I was extremely gentle and careful with it.  I reached out to support but it looks like they won't be contacting me for a couple days.  I will update my review if support is able to do a good job at least covering the warranty.  It's disappointing because the strap makes a big difference but if it breaks after only a couple months what good is it?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
review_title: Update - Disappointed not a Game changer

one_reviews_text: The Elite Strap functions well, and is a far better and more comfortable choice than the standard strap that ships with the Quest 2. However, I still find that I struggle to find a balance between too tight and too loose of a fit. I think some of the issue is balancing, and that can only be corrected with counterbalancing in the back to compensate for the weight of the unit in the front. So in retrospect I do wish I had purchased the battery pack model of the Elite Strap rather than the standalone model. The battery pack would provide a counter weight and also obviously provide more hours of use. Keeping that in mind I still give the strap a 4/5 because it functions as designed and does provide a significant upgrade to the stock strap.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021
review_title: A worthy and significant upgrade that still doesn't quite solve all my issues.

one_reviews_text: My goodness I cant say how much it feels so much better to wear this than the crappy base strap, oh boy does this feel nice. 10/5 is how good it is, no more teeth grinding or headaches or none of that miserable neck pain no more! I mean you will probably feel pain eventually if you are on it for freakin 10 hours a day. But for the average human being that touches grass and has a real life, this is excellent! All you need now is a battery pack so that your headset doesn't die so quick and it turns off right as you are on a poker match and YOU WENT ALL IN!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022

one_reviews_text: The unit fits nice and snug and it's well protected. Wish they'd other colors. I think it should be more like 25 bucks. I've read the reviews, I'm not sure what people are looking for, but I don't plan on sitting on it, or throwing it up against the wall. It functions well as a protective case. The only thing that was wrong with it was the zipper function, and the price. The unit does what it's supposed to do, protect your investment. It's the same with the elite headstrap, if you rip it off of your head rather than adjusting it by unscrewing it and removing it by grabbing the headset, of course it's going to break. It's not a pair of glasses it's a plastic strap. I cannot recommend this until they drop the price but it does do what it is supposed to do.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_title: Pro Good Protection Cons The Zipper and The Price

one_reviews_text: Pros:- The most compact way to carry the headset, controllers, charger with cable,  and spare batteries for the controllers.I even added a 5$ aftermarket strap padding to the headset - and it fits inside.- tough hard case, even the zipper is half internal and protected.- the carrying strap is positioned so that the case will be carried easily with one hand,  while keeping a low profile.Cons:- external and internal material that my cat likes to sharpen it's nails into...- the "accessories" compartment is a little too small, and can BARELY fit a 2A charger, 9 feet usb cable, and spare batteries for the controllers.- cannot contain any aftermarket replacement for the original "Elite" strap.Bottom Line:- definitely recommended (if you don't need extra room for "halo" or aftermarket "elite" strap) .- does exactly what it should,  in the most efficient way.- not buying a case for the headset - is like buying a 1,000$ smartphone and "saving" by not spending another 50$ on a good case...(Only for brave people)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021
review_title: The most efficient carrying case for the Quest 2

one_reviews_text: This thing is made very poorly. Most of the design and build is ok, but the side pieces that connect it to the headset, are very cheap and weak. I have had mine barely over a month and the side piece cracked, very easily, rendering it useless. To put on or take it off, you have to snap the side pieces, over the pieces on the headset. You literally have to force it in and they made that part paper thin. I assume they did that on purpose. Amazon conveniently does not accept returns after 30 days. Don’t waste your money on this, buy a good one made by a small business.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021

one_reviews_text: 3/17/21 *update:Today the strap broke in the 2nd spot. I've taped together with gaff tape until off brand head strap arrives. My elite strap must have been in the original batch with faulty material.I assume the majority of people breaking their Elite Straps are simply applying too much pressure. Granted, you do have to apply more pressure than you should have to especially if you wear glasses like me. Its a constant annoyance balancing/adjusting or removing the headset but no reason to exert more force than necessary. The Elite strap is infinitely better/more comfortable than the stock strap

The most critical review here makes mention of this and Gabbi is exactly correct.RESTATE:  Do not purchase if you intend to plug into your computer, The product text is misleading, unless you have a USB-C port, (small, flat, smaller than a PC USB standard port.)

one_reviews_text: I have HTC Vive, Valve Index and two quests. I highly recommend quest 2 for a first VR headset. You can play games with no cords or desktop needed. I personally have been using my quest 2 for testing my VR games. Being able to put on the headset and play a game without having to have base stations or cords getting in your way is a dream. I hate that you connect your Facebook to oculus but it is what it is. I’ve locked down all my privacy settings to their max. My personal and online lives stay separate and I’m able to play with friends online without dealing with cords!

one_reviews_text: The moment I put my Oculus Quest 2 on, I knew I was not gonna be happy with the strap out of the box. There’s just too much wiggle room and it was hard for me to find that “sweet spot”The Elite Strap which is what should’ve come standard is perfect! All very solid and the cup on back fits around my head perfectly and I don’t have to mess around with it at all to get it positioned just right. Very happy with this one n

one_reviews_text: Note the listing right here on this very site: "The actively powered USB-C cable charges your headset’s built-in battery as you play, so it’s ready to go as soon as you go cable-free. "This is a lie.  It does not charge at all, even when the device is in standby mode let alone under any use that draws higher consumption.Just another case of Facebook, excuse me... "Meta", lying to people in order to keep collecting their money.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
review_title: FALSE ADVERTISING.  Power drain happens in use.

one_reviews_text: The title says USB C to USB 3.0. It's not. It's USB C on both ends. Sending this one back and seriously considering just shelving my Oculus Quest altogether. Trying to get a link cable to work has been a nightmare.

one_reviews_text: The only reason this strap is highly rated is because people are comparing it to the default strap which is garbage. One of the sides of my headset snapped randomly when I was putting it on yesterday. I have only had it for two months and have never dropped or damaged the headset in any way.This headset is only worth about $30, and that's if you get lucky and it doesn't break. Your money is better spent somewhere else.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021

one_reviews_text: I preordered this alone side with my oculus. If I could turn back time I would've waited for third parties instead of buying this hot garbage.5/10: (Mehhh)+ Looks good+ Good customer support is broken+ Kinda comfortable but I've seen better+ May break anytime while using it, which could send your Oculus flying+ There are BETTER 3RD PARTIES OPTIONS+ If you want to waste $50 be my guest9/10 customer support on Oculus website:+ Got a free replacement for the strap but I did have to spend time contacting them, boxing and sending back to Oculus factor, and waiting for a replacement

review_title: Test your luck with every use

one_reviews_text: Though at first, It worked perfectly fine, And it felt amazing. About a month in the way to tighten the strap to your head starts to loosen by itself while you are playing and makes the whole experience uncomfortable. I have not been able to use the headset with this strap without it almost falling off. Honestly, the whole thing looks and feels cheaply made for a 50$ price tag. id suggest this thing is worth about 10 or 20. not to mention some other people (NOT ME) have had their straps snap, rendering them totally useless. Id's look for some third-party head strap if you have a real issue with the stock strap it comes with.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020

one_reviews_text: In case you were wondering if it was safe to buy now.. No. These will still crack and break without any abuse or misuse. Just the tightening and loosening on your head over about a month will develop a crack on these. Beware.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021

one_reviews_text: So I tried these out on my desktop and it was a smoother quality like a regular pcvr but for reason it would drain my battery rather than charging it. I dug around online and it seems asus motherboards don't work too well since most or all of there ports are 5v which apparently isn't enough power to charge and play. The motherboard I was using was a zenith rog extreme alpha ii. I returned it for now and see if there are other alternatives.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022

one_reviews_text: When I bought my Oculus Quest 2, I got a package that included a link to PC cable, the same cable you can find on Amazon for less than $20. It wouldn't stay constantly connected to the PC and would disconnect at the worst times (like landing on XP11). I decided to get this official Oculus Link cable and it hasn't disconnected a single time, and the graphics quality seems to be more stable than just using Air Link, plus it let's the headset stay charged when doing longer flights, whereas AirLink only lasts about 1½ hours.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021
review_title: Don't go cheap! This cord does what it's supposed to!

one_reviews_text: I am very disappointed in the brittleness of the plastic. It developed hair line cracks and then broke. I am getting a replacement from Oculus but wanted a refund.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021
review_title: Brittle plastic, cracked and then broke after 30 days.

one_reviews_text: After using this strap, I will never be able to use the strap that comes with the stock Oculus Quest 2 again!So, so, so much more comfortable and it helps balance the weight of the whole unit on your head.If you're going to play your Oculus for more than a few minutes, you really should pick this up this strap upgrade. You won't regret it.My only complaint is that Facebook gave me that garbage strap with my Quest when I bought it in the first place. This upgraded strap should be what they ship with.Careful with it though. The plastic strap snapped because I mishandled it and now it is wrapped in duct tape. Looks trashy, but who's looking?

one_reviews_text: Had it 4 days and this happened ....If it was made of higher quality materials it would be great, as it does a good job of keeping the OC2 on your head. If using it moderately in 4 days causes this, how can they stand behind it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021

one_reviews_text: The Oculus carrying case is great because it is soft and smooth on the outside and zips up.  However, if you dont want to spend the money on it, dont worry about it if you get the Oculus Quest 2 because the packaging it comes in works great as a case.

one_reviews_text: I purchased it in Feb 2021 so it did not even last a year but a lot longer than most (maybe because I am far more gentle than most gamers) and I was crushed to have it literally break in my hand while simply holding it. Oculus will replace it for free; it’ll just take some time. However, I hope this doesn’t mean a repeat in 10 months.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021

one_reviews_text: I've had this cable for about a month now. After the first couple times using my headset I noticed that free use without this cable was fine. Whenever I use this cable to plug it into my PC suddenly the graphics begin to mess up and I have theses weird pixel/discolored lines across my vision.But as soon as I disconnect the cable? It goes away and my vision is totally clear!This is NOT cool and after several tests I've figured out it's the issue. I also cannot return the item sadly, but I hope you will see this review and think twice about buying this! Something that costs THIS MUCH shouldn't cause this kind of issue!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021

one_reviews_text: This strap cracked. I read reviews and didn't think it would happen to me but it did. Trying to get a refund!
