one_reviews_text: After only 5 months the plastic had cracked and snapped. I made an attempt to glue it back together but it will not hold. This product is cheap. It was not worth the price, if it will not last longer then 5 months. I do not use my oculus that much and never take it anywhere. I see no reason why the plastic on the strap would just crack and break unless it just cheap and Poorly made.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
review_title: I would like a refund I paid too much for something that doesn’t last more the 5 months.

one_reviews_text: I have the elite head strap (which also has its own quality issues) and wanted to make sure that the case I bought could accommodate the headset and that strap along with the controllers and a pair of earbuds. The official case was the only thing available and I needed a case so I pulled the trigger and ordered it. Both the case and the zipper do not feel durable. I'd wait for some after market vendors offer cases. Hopefully mine will hold up.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020

one_reviews_text: It is absolutely ridiculous that for a $300+ purchase, the original headband is restrictive and painful and you have to spend an additional $50 for a comfortable headband. For the price of the Oculus, the headband should not have to be replaced just so that wearing it can be tolerable. The kid wasn't playing much with the original because it hurt his head too much regardless of adjustments being made. However, once we bought this and put it on, he has begun using the Oculus again.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021

one_reviews_text: and both of them broke in half just behind where it connects to the set.Low grade junk. I treated the second set with kid gloves. Gently raising and lowering the strap.It still broke.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021

one_reviews_text: It's pretty obvious to anybody who spends more than 2 seconds looking at this that $80 is definitely overpriced. Many reviews state as much.However, this being said, it is absolutely a fantastic cable for what it is. Everything about its construction is fantastic, and it's easily the best C to C cable I've ever had. If it was in the $40-50 wheelhouse, it'd still be on the pricey end, but I could easily justify its cost for the quality to anyone.As is though, you'd be better off looking around. Other C to C cables can easily be used for the Link, and you can find some good 10ft+ ones for a quarter of the price of this. Only spring for this if you're wearing through cables quickly, or you really need the full 16 feet (most people won't).
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022

one_reviews_text: I own both the Quest and Quest 2 and I have to say this is the best of the straps.The first Quest strap was pretty good but just needed a counter weight and to cup the back of the head better. I’m a female so maybe a smaller head was the issue.  Anyway, it worked right out of the box with little issues that could be fixed. But the Quest 2 elastic strap is just painful.  The two plastic pieces bother my head after awhile and it wasn’t very secure moving around.  I have long hair and it didn’t stay at all.  I used the VR Power battery from Rebuff Reality to try and stabilize it but it didn’t help.  And the Studioform VR strap wasn’t going to work at all with no structure to hang on to.This Quest 2 elite strap is very comfortable.  It cups the back of my head nicely for a secure fit.  This helps with the weight distribution.  But I still added the VR Power battery pack to it for more balance.  It’s a must buy. Or you’ll have to wait to FrankenQuest it. For me this is the cheaper buy and  it’s very comfortable.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020

one_reviews_text: There is some pressure below the eyes but in general this is a comfortable and simple strap.I was happy with this product for 4 months, until the strap just cracked in two different places. I was very careful handling it but still it broke with normal use.I contacted Facebook and they asked for pictures and all possible numbers and promised to evaluate the case so maybe I can get a replacement.I don't want a replacement. This product is obviously defective and must be recalled.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review_title: Cracked after 4 months of normal use

one_reviews_text: I purchased this to help with the face pressure but I feel Like this head band so much worse! You have to tighten it in order for it to not shift and sit properly, but it just feels like it mushing your face while pulling your eyes. Super uncomfortable. Not worth it in my opinion
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022

one_reviews_text: The original strap is good if you plan to use your vr for mild things and or play for less than 1hr but keep on using your vr for longer than that and you get a head ache that starts at the front of your forehead because of all the pressure you apply with the original strap.This item aliviates that issue as it places some of that pressure towards the back of your head and it makes the over all fit more snug.Definitely recommend if you plan to game on the vr or if you are afraid of the vr flying off your head. If you are only gonna watch movies or something very mild then i still recommend, though not necessarily.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021

one_reviews_text: Though I could have got 10 dollars off for ordering it 48 hrs later than I did, the 50 dollars I did invest was well spent.The form factor reminds me of an old school UFO, and the case is sooooo damn light; and yet, the form factor is very convenient and the case is sooooo damn durable.It’s a pleasure to do business with you.(I was not compensated I’m any way for this review, (even though I should be) I just enjoy when I buy products and they live up to my own hype.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
review_title: Doesn’t get much better than this @ this price point

one_reviews_text: the plastic strap broke within two weeks! Thankfully, he's OK with the strap it came with.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020

one_reviews_text: I have read over and over again how this band changes the way the Oculus feels on your head. I thought people were exaggerating but let me tell you this thing is awesome!It's rebalances the weight to mostly the back of your head and barely some on your forehead your nose or cheeks are pressure free!. Because the band is also plastic and sturdy it doesn't shift around on your head.I cannot recommend it enough , pull the trigger, get it now!!!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2021

one_reviews_text: This is an awesome design over the original strap that the Quest 2 came with. It fits really well and alot easier to take off and on....BUT! I have to give this a 3 star, maybe even a 2 star rating, for the fact that only after 34 days of moderate use it had began to crack on the side strap. I was soooo careful with it after having got the word that this issue has been reported on numerous customers and videos on YouTube about it. I was SO careful that I wanted to seriously be the one to not have one snap on me... but was wrong. So no matter how careful you are this thing will break so fair warning! Ok, rant over!Now, regardless what others have said that has had this problem and that Oculus was "unable to be reached" or "they just don't support their own products", these claims are wrong! Despite me having bought this through Amazon and being beyond the 30-day return policy, the day after I noticed the crack, I was able to contact them and sent over my receipt, pictures, serial numbers, and contact info to Oculus customer care and they are processing my replacement strap... for FREE! Have all your info and they will work with you every step of the way!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2021

one_reviews_text: TL;DR Keep the box your quest came with. better case.Sure it's nice to have an optional carry case that looks nice however you could just keep the box it comes with and call it good enough. The zipper sucks, snags like mad. the material is... meh? nothing to write home about. the controllers don't sit properly where they're supposed to and it's just not something you need to buy.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021

one_reviews_text: It was my fault I guess but does not work with the strap I bought.....it would not close......the original  strap it would work  and it looks like the elite strap would work....just be careful that it will close if you have an aftermarket  strap like mine. I'll share pic.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021

one_reviews_text: I had heard that this strap is prone to cracking and breaking, so I was very careful with it.  But in less than a year the strap has started to crack. I contacted Oculus and they did offer a replacement, but it was going to a refurbished unit.  I am honestly shocked that this product has not been pulled or updated to fix this issue.  I am very disappointed with this product and will not give this design another chance.I would try a 3rd party over this product.

one_reviews_text: Carefully consider all the reviews the Oculus Elite strap has before purchasing it.  I bought mine back in March of this year and went to pick up my quest 2 today only to see the left strap broken!!!  I didn’t think it would happen to me but it did.  Luckily I still have my fabric strap that came with the quest 2 that I can use until my new strap arrives.  I didn’t go with another elite strap.  Once bitten. Twice shy.  They won’t get my money again for this piece of crap!!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021

one_reviews_text: I love the design of the strap, compared with the one that comes with the Quest 2. It worked great for a while.Unfortunately, after a bit over three months and treating it carefully, avoiding adding too much pressure on it broke. I was not even using it when it happened. I just grabbed the headset to use it (always from the middle band), and it broke in my hand.Was this a bad batch? A design flaw? A poor choice of material? Not enough testing in QA? A combination of all?Maybe it was bad luck; who knows.The idea behind the design is great, and I truly like it. I mean, if it wasn’t for that, it feels comfortable using. I never pushed it because I heard lots of stories like mine after I ordered.I’ve been using the fabric strap that came with the Oculus, and I have to say it is surprisingly good, and even if it looks more durable than the “elite” version, although it doesn't fit as well as the "elite".UPDATE:I contacted Oculus Support, and they offered either a refund or a replacement. As I bought it through Amazon, the refund must be handled by Amazon; but as I like the strap design, I requested a replacement. They emailed me a UPS tag to return the broken strap (so make sure to keep it if you one to go this route and its original box). A few days after, I received confirmation that a new elite strap was sent at no cost, so I want to express thanks to Oculus Support for taking care of this problem.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2021
review_title: It works great, but treat it carefully.

one_reviews_text: This item is defective and will break, I'm on my second one and I've never dropped either of them, veeeeeery loosely tightened on my head because I was paranoid of it cracking, to the point where it could almost fall off. Fully unscrewed before taking it off as well as following every other longevity tip, neither lasted a month. The strap actually seems to crack itself if it doesn't like a temperature change in your room because the second one cracked without even being touched

one_reviews_text: My boyfriend and I both have an oculus (his on the left, mine on the right). He got his before mine and bought an elite strap to go with it and suggested I do the same. I’ve had this elite strap for almost a year now and haven’t realized we had a different brand this whole time. My boyfriend’s unofficial oculus strap is 1000% better than what the oculus store is offering and $15.00 cheaper. This official oculus strap is very uncomfortable with a silicone/rubber padding and leaves all the weight of the oculus hanging on your face. My head is left sore and cramped early on and my playtime is therefore limited. I also find the muscles in my face start quivering after trying to hold the oculus up without any real support. My boyfriend’s strap on the other hand is padded with extra support in the back to balance the weight of the device. I wish I could get a full refund for this item but the return window has unfortunately closed.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022

one_reviews_text: While I love the Head Strap, it is not very durable.  My strap, or the band whatever you want to call it has broken in several places, I find it extremely brittle.  I have had mine since Oct 13, 2020 and it has already broken.  What I find even more troubling is that while I am still within the Amazon return window, they don't have any in stock for a replacement.  Because of that I have used some superglue and some 3D printed parts to use to try to keep it together.  I really do like the band and would give it 5 stars except for the durability.

one_reviews_text: Very good comparing to the standard cloth strap. The back of head still may ache due to pressure if not adjusted right. one_reviews_text: I find this very comfortable and easier to put on than the cloth strap. I much prefer something like this compared to a fabric.I thought the back part was padded, I was wrong there is no padding. I still find it comfortable, but I also have a counterweight so your mileage may vary.This was easy to install, I was scared I was going to break the plastic side pieces but they come off and snap on just fine.  It hasn't even been a month and this thing cracked. I play about an hour or two at most a occasionally, and no one else in my family hardly ever used it. Come on Oculus, what the hell!? This has been an issue for so long and you guys even stop selling them and then started back up again just for the same problem to accure. For 50 dollars, this is completely unacceptable. What an absolute waste of money. I will try to apeal for a free replacement and see if that thing breaks as well.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021
review_title: It broke with light use in less than a month

one_reviews_text: Bought as a bundle with the oculus but would have bought on its own in any case. Has already saved the oculus from damage when it was dropped and its designed well enough you don't have to fight with the headset or controllers to get inside.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

one_reviews_text: Not much to say about this guy. Very handy, very sturdy. Great way to transport your headset around (fits the headset, controllers, and charging cable).
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021

one_reviews_text: This is a cute compact case and easy to carry on the go. Any time I travel I take my VR with me I use this bag and I am glad I purchased this as it comes in handy. Its worth spending some extra money on this accessory.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought the Elite strap with my Quest 2 upon reviews that read.  I'm new to Oculus and never used the original straps that come with the Quest 2.  While comfortable, the fitting and comfort is not perfect.  The comfort is great but I don't have experience to compare to.  My concern comes after I purchased the Quest 2 and Elite Strap I started reading other users experiencing their Elite Strap breaking after a short period.  My wife and I have been using our Quest 2s with our Elite Straps for a couple months now with no breakage.  I suggest doing more research on your own.  Good-luck.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021
review_title: Fits great but I have concerns

one_reviews_text: One of the problems I had with the off the shelf straps was neck strain at the back of my neck. This has immediately resolved the uneven weight distribution and actually makes the headset feel a lot more comfortable to wear.With it's well made construction it would obviously jack up the price to say it should be standard, but I wouldn't advise using an Oculus Quest 2 without this. Night and day difference, well worth the $50 bucks I paid for it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
review_title: Better weight distribution - No Neck strain

one_reviews_text: The Oculus was a family gift this Christmas. While the headset strap worked fine for my teenage kids, this was PERFECT for my 8 year old. He was having a hard time getting the original strap to stay on his head which was making it hard to see the games. I highly recommend getting this add on. Well worth it!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022

one_reviews_text: Fits the base oculus and the controllers nicely, even with grips on them. However it cannot fit the oculus with the elite strap. I bought a third-party one that was a complete pita to get on, so having to take it on and off to use the case just isn’t worth it. I’d rather keep the strap on and find a different case.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021
review_title: Doesn’t fit the oculus with an elite strap on

one_reviews_text: I had issues with the default strap putting too much pressure on my face, and rubbing against my ears. The elite strap fixed all of these issues. Installation was super easy, and took about 5 min. I did hear about some users struggling with removing and snapping on the strap, so I came into it expecting I'd need to "snap" off the old strap. The only trick to putting on the new strap was mentioned in the quick start. Something like starting with the front tip when snapping the new strap in.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020

one_reviews_text: 5 stars because quality. It is a great case. BUT it will not work with the adjustable straps that are modeled after PSVR headset straps. The ones that tighten down with a dial and strap to forehead instead of on your face will not fit inside sadly. But if you use the standard or elite strap style, this case is a must.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021

one_reviews_text: If the cable was manufactured incorrectly or with faulty materials, that could be one issue. It seemed to work at first, but it stops working after about 5 minutes sometimes. The third party HDMI cable I have for the phone is much more efficient, sturdy, and reliable. The error could be internal or with the Verizon phone or with Windows.  Rather than place blame, I'd rather find the solution. Thankful the technology exists, but if you want to save money, my personal experience is to purchase a 3rd party cord that is not a double Type-C connector for playing and transferring data. Thank you and I hope this review helps others deciding on the best option for them.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021

one_reviews_text: Overall I'm happy with this purchase.  It fits my Oculus 2 headset, hand controllers, and a 30 ft charging cord and wall dongle plus extra batteries easily.  My only complaint is that the zipper sometimes gets stuck and it seems a bit fragile.  It did this from day one of receiving it.  I've had it for several months now but I'm not sure how long the zipper is going to hold up over time.  I would like to see a sturdier zipper on future iterations.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2021

one_reviews_text: that said$80? for a USB C cable? Really? I had a coupon for one half off when I bought my quest 2 and even then it feels like you are paying way too much. It works very well and is extremely light but man you cannot justify that price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021
review_title: Works great and is very light

one_reviews_text: Welp, there goes my money, I thought it only come with 1 side is USB-C, but turn out BOTH of them USB-C.Base on what I know, not everyone who have PC, have USB-C on their pc. For the price, I thought maybe they have an adapter probably inside the box. NOPE, nothing at all. Not only it's expensive, now I need to spent extra to get adapter for my VR. Not really recommended unless your PC come with USB-C
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021

one_reviews_text: This makes such a difference with playing VR that I'm suprised it's a separate purchase from the full VR kit! it actually holds the Quest 2 firmly in place and provides a far more comfortable experience which helps with longer play. Plus it's sturdy enough for wired play through Steam VR and doesn't slip like the elastic strap does. Why the hell isn't this sold with the VR Set, why is it sold separately? Why do customers continually have to pay extra for the full experience?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022
review_title: Why the hell isn't this part of the original package?

one_reviews_text: Didn’t work out for me, had to send back.  It was faulty.  Bought a new one from Target and I’ve had no problems to report.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021
review_title: Returned. Purchased from target with no problems.

one_reviews_text: This is a cheap plastic headband you are buying for $50. Plastic will dig into the back of your head, you will try and convince yourself it is comfortable.It is disappointing this is facebook’s only offering considering every highly regarded head strap has padding.I wouldn’t recommend supporting this with your hard earned money
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2022

one_reviews_text: Broke in 3 months and we take really good care of this headset. We switch between family members so having the knob is a lifesaver. I just ducted taped it. Lol Definitely not spending $50 on another.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021

one_reviews_text: This strap wi 100% break no matter how careful you are. And Oculus will do everything in there power to make your replacement/return process as slow, stressful and drawn out as possible. 1/10 customer service.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021

one_reviews_text: Can’t believe how extremely flimsy this thing is. It worked well enough, but after a couple weeks of gentle, occasional use, it broke when I simply picked it up off the desk.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021

one_reviews_text: Broke after roughly one month of use. The plastic is very brittle and in my humble opinion cheaply made will not be buying again. Buyers beware
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021

one_reviews_text: Very good travel/Storage case for the Oculus Quest 2! Lightweight but very sturdy and trustworthy. Plus it’s very attractive, with the grey felt material on the outside! Overall I would give it a 5 out of 5 stars. If your on the fence about buying this case, then go ahead and buy it!  You won’t be disappointed.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
review_title: Trustworthy, Sturdy and very attractive!  5 out of 5 stars!!

one_reviews_text: I bought this around 2 months ago and it was a blessing. It was so much more comfortable than the stock strap, but a slight crack along the left strap started to form after use. I use my headset for beatsaber, onward, and not too intensive games like that. I did not drop my headset and took it off with care. I have no idea if it had a crack in shipping or some other point, but now it is completely torn off and I have to go back to the stock strap. If this elite strap breaks just from head movement then maybe this isn't the way to go.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
review_title: More comfortable than stock strap, easily breakable

one_reviews_text: After 6 months my elite strap plastic broke and I do not find anywhere to get help for a replacementUpdate 9/3/2021:  I found support on a chat link on Oculus (It just popped up) And I had to sent my strap back and they are now investigating it.  I am hoping I get a replacement.  I really wonder why so many of these Elite Straps break so randomly.  Is there no quality assurance with the manufacturer?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
review_title: broke on both sides after 5-6 months

one_reviews_text: Broke in normal use after one month.  And my relative also had break in same exact way.  It broke while simply tightening the strap with regular tension.  It breaks by the connection to the oculus in a 45-50 degree angle approximately.  It broke same exact pattern and place for me and my relative!  Design flaw due to tightening putting stress on that part of headset because headset sits at angle on head.  Bad design… NOT ELITE.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2021
review_title: Do not buy!  Breaks!  Design flaw!!!

one_reviews_text: The must-have for the Oculus Quest 2 headset. This cable is an active optical cable that uses 2x fiber optic strands for the data and copper for the charging power. (AOC hybrid casble). Don't bother with third party / generic cables for the Oculus Quest 2. They're almost all copper for both data and charging and sketchy. USB 3.0/3.1/3.2 at long distances is unreliable at best. We had constant "your headset is disconnected" randomly during use with the generic third party cable. This one works flawlessly.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2021

one_reviews_text: I’ve had this for less than a month and it’s already broken. No rough use or anything like that I literally just took the headset off and the side snapped, and there’s a crack in the other side. Thankfully I think I’ll be able to get a refund but still, for how much it costs, it  shouldn’t be so flimsy. But I really liked it otherwise!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021

one_reviews_text: After just one week, it broke. The screws that held it in place just came off. Returned it through Amazon and got a 3d printed headrest. Works just as good.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
review_title: Broke after a week of light use

one_reviews_text: Broke after about a month of medium use. Something is wrong in the manufacturing process. I haven't yet shipped it back for RMA (because shipping stuff is a pain in the butt).When it was in one piece, it's great. It makes a very big difference in the comfort of the Quest. Instead of pulling down on the front of your face, as it does with the elastic strap included with the Quest, it squeezes the back of your head and pulls straight INTO your face, which is MUCH more comfortable.Fix the quality issue and this would be wonderful.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021

one_reviews_text: The small tiny screws come out after a certain amount of use. I bought this on December 31st and it's now, February 15th and both screws on both sides have come out and are lost which have rendered it useless. We are now 10 days past the return date.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
review_title: Rivets or screws on black strap to the white strap....

one_reviews_text: like many other reviewers ours broke. first one side and last night the other side. sad part is that it made our oculus far more comfortable but they must have used the cheapest possible plastic for the straps.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021
review_title: snap city. amazon should not allow such low quality goods to be sold on its marketplace

one_reviews_text: While reading Reviews before purchasing the Oculus Quest 2, there were mentions of the headset strap that comes with the unit not quite getting the job done. I purchased this upgrade as part of a bundle after reading that. If you’re going to buy…or even already have the Quest 2 without this upgraded Elite Strap (more than just a strap really)….do yourself a huge favor and GET IT !!! You won’t be disappointed!It dials in to a perfect fit with every sized head….it also made a difference with potential fatigue. Keeps the headset from moving around while you’re active….and it just feels more comfortable
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
review_title: Yes, this Headset strap upgrade delivers!

one_reviews_text: Update 4 months later: it is still really comfortable, but we now have 4 cracks in it from just handling it. The plastic is super brittle. I have duct tape around several parts to keep it in place. It is rather expensive to be so flimsy.Original review: Honestly worth the money. It fits all the heads in my house (from really big to really small). Perhaps some of the cheaper options are good, but I am glad we just decided to get this one.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021

one_reviews_text: complete and total waste of time. facebook is a multi billion dollar corporation but somehow doesn’t know how to use a usb port. if you have a normal computer DO NOT BUY THIS. it requires a USB C port which normal computers DO NOT have.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2022
review_title: biggest waste of money every spent.

one_reviews_text: Got this in the bundle with my Quest 2, so I'd assume since it's gonna be worth the $79 I paid for it. Instead, I got a faulty wire. Doesn't charge my headset while connected to my pc. Worse than that, it regularly and spontaneously disconnects the Oculus Link even though the cable is firmly plugged in to both my computer and my Quest 2. Strangely this wasn't a problem until recently (No, I didn't step on the wire or pull it or anything). No clue what's going on with this, but it's not worth $79.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
review_title: Stopped working, never charged my Quest 2

one_reviews_text: This was a gift for my daughter. She researched this product as well as talking to her gaming friends who have this Oculus. They told her it's the best on the market to purchase  She really enjoys playing the games. She is a gamer so this fit right in to her game plan so to speak. Highly recommend.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021

one_reviews_text: The head band that came with the device is fine but this accessory definitely provides a lot of comfort especially when leaning your head against a chair with a good headrest.  If i had to make any complaints when you remove the VR googles one, sometimes I would have the habit of trying to put in on again but would need to make adjustments.  Still its worth the extra 50 dollars
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021

one_reviews_text: Most everyone agrees you need a better strap on the Quest 2 than what comes in the box.  I first ordered a third party head strap that was $10 cheaper, but couldn't get it to click onto the Quest.  This one was back in stock and I haven't regretted it at all.  It fits the Quest perfectly and is extremely comfortable.  I can finally get a tight fit so that the screen doesn't go blurry because the headset moved on my head.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021
review_title: Great fit and a must have on the quest 2

one_reviews_text: Don't buy!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020

one_reviews_text: I caved in and bought this cable after the anker one I bought was defective upon arrival. And like the title said, it worked great and never gave me an issue. Until yesterday while I was playing Pavlov on my quest 2 and I accidentally had the cable get caught on my arm and tugged on it while turning a corner in the game. Surely an $80 cable should be designed to withstand being tugged one at least a couple times. I can’t believe that at the price you pay for this cable you get a cheap plastic non-reinforced housing for the connectors.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022
review_title: Worked great until it broke from getting tugged once

one_reviews_text: I knew this was a common complaint but bought it anyway because the Q2 default strap was just so bad compared to the Q1. Only getting two months out of it was still a disappointment. Otherwise a good headset strap, but too expensive to buy as a disposable over and over. This was with me treating it carefully bit perhaps wearing it on the tighter side (which the dial enables)Edit: Second one broke after a year of being careful not to over-tighten or lift from the back. Also during the colder months so that's probably a thing with the cheap plastic. Superglue doesn't help. Gonna try some other straps now that there's more options.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021

one_reviews_text: This might be the best upgrade you can make to the Oculus Quest 2.  It makes switching between users very convenient.  More importantly, it actually keeps the Oculus in place during more physically demanding games and apps.  It does little to improve the comfort of the Oculus pressing against your forehead - so don’t expect that design flaw to be solved with this accessory.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2022

one_reviews_text: Complete waste of money oculus and Amazon should refund anybody who purchased this junk.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021

one_reviews_text: I'd been using the strap that comes with the unit and didn't even realize there were accessories available until I watched a YouTube video. This is definitely worth it. It's makes for a more adjustable and comfortable fit. There's a wheel in the back you turn to adjust the snugness of the fit and you can get it 'just right'.The strap that comes with the Oculus isn't horrible, but this is definitely a worthwhile upgrade.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021

one_reviews_text: Unless you have a high-end super-fast wi-fi router, if you intend to play any PC-based games via Remote Desktop + Steam VR, this cable is a must. I don't know if you need to get the original one or if something cheaper would do the job equally well, I just wanted to play it safe.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
review_title: A must have accessory for PC-based VR gaming

one_reviews_text: Oculus should likely include this as the default rather than the elastic strap that comes instead.  The elastic strap required so much pressure to keep the headset in the right position on my face that it caused pain after just a few minutes use.  After replacing the elastic which this, wearing the headset seems almost effortless.  The weight of the headset is carried on the top of the wearer's head rather than the face.  In addition, the rear-head support comfortably balances the headset to prevent it from sliding down the wearer's face during most movement.  As a result, the headset only requires moderate pressure to keep in place with this strap installed.Installation was a piece of cake as well.  No tools required.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
review_title: Make the Oculus Quest 2 pleasant to wear

one_reviews_text: so, i wear glasses, and was told by oc\fb to buy this headstrap in order to combat this. this did not help, it bent the hell out of my glasses, gives me neck pain the day after im done using it, and can also caise headaches. the elite strap does not compare to the original q1 strap which had a tilt on the backing to help distribute weight, this does not. IMO, both the base strap and this one are equally bad but for different reasons. Also these only cost FB 10 bucks to make, so why is this 50? it will work for some but not for everyone, also the craftsmanship is shotty at best, Get the franken one for best comfort and stability, or just 3d print this one for way cheaper if u think it will work for you.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021

one_reviews_text: BUYER BEWARE. The side snapped in half maybe the 10th time I used it. I am a casual VR player who used the device well within reasonable limits of very light, near-stationary gameplay. I had only owned the headset for a few months when it snapped while I was just standing there, not even doing anything.The appearance is fine, the set up was easy, but it's just so incredibly flimsy. I wouldn't recommend anyone buy this.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021
review_title: DON'T BUY. Broke after 3 months of light use.

one_reviews_text: it was comfortable, better than the default, but it was sitting on a shelf for a while, and shattered into pieces, I got a third party head strap, and this one is much more easy to use, much more comfortable, has a spot to hold a battery, and is better in like every way, also has not broken on me yet.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022

one_reviews_text: I read all the stories about the strap breaking, so I was diligent with it.  Didn't matter.  Less than a month and it is in pieces.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020

one_reviews_text: I ordered this with my Oculus Quest 2 in hopes that I would be able to use it as a link cable. However, the cable won't work with my graphics card on my laptop even though I verified that it's supposed to. It won't stay connected for some reason, it's not loose, it just has some internal connection problems with my graphics card. So now it's just a really long charging cable... The only reason I haven't returned it is...well I missed the return window... and I'm hoping that the Oculus team find a way to fix it. It's a high quality cable, but doesn't do what it's supposed to do for me.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021
review_title: Glorified charging cable for me unfortunately

one_reviews_text: Got it for a new quest 2 I got to try. Guess the connection isn't fast enough? some graphic tear at the edge of the screen on any game I play from VRCHAT to Pavlov. shimmering an such (also have a rift S it has never done that.) Got a powerful pc  12 core Ryzen 9 3900x processor  64gigs of ram and a AMD Radeon 5700xt graphics card. Hope there's something better because this is oculus brand. If its not the best then what is for its own device.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

one_reviews_text: I have an ASUS duel GPU laptop. This cable works well for transfering files, SideQuest, and charging . But not well enough to play on my laptop. I've had to resort to using Virtual Desktop and ALVR to even play PC VR games on my laptop. My 5G internet and wifi makes this ok most of the time. Though you are subject to radio inference which happens a lot in the trailer park I live in. Makes me wish I had a good VR ready Desktop, but sadly can't afford that.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020

one_reviews_text: This strap did work a bit better than the strap the headset came with, but it did not addess the issue I was having with way too much pressure on my forehead.  I realized I had stopped using it because of that, and it is too expensive of a toy with oo much potential to let it just sit like that. the halo one distributes the weight a lot more evenly and basically removes the problem entirely.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021
review_title: Get the one with a halo it works a lot better

one_reviews_text: I was very skeptic on purchasing these, but my co-workers raved about how much better these are then the default straps. I felt like the comfort of the original straps were fine and an upgrade over the Oculus Rift. However, after receiving these and trying it on the biggest upgrade isn't comfort, but strain on my eyes.The headset isn't' jostling around as much and moving slightly off center focus. I noticed this when moving my head rapidly for games such as beat saber the notes are more clear and I spend less time trying to focus my eyes. Huge upgrade and a lot less headaches!

one_reviews_text: Fragile, broke after a few weeks of light use.

one_reviews_text: Everyone knows the standard strap is booty. As someone with a large head, it was necessary to get a higher quality strap. The thing feels weightless when it's attached. one_reviews_text: i love that this case fits everything including the charger! i recently bought my husband an oculus and he would leave the charger in the wall and place the oculus and controllers on the dining room table. this gives him somewhere to store it safely when it’s not in use!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021

one_reviews_text: I bough this cord specifically to extend the battery life of the head set as it said it would keep it charged if plugged in while using. Complete BS.First, the c type probe sticks out of this huge, poorly molded clump of plastic so little that It will not reach the factory c port on my pc. So I was forced to use the USB converter anyways.After 22 minutes of use, I was down to 83% battery. Same as the cheap cords. Oculus is just another company peddling cheaply made crap for top dollar and you still only get cheap crap. May as well save the money and buy the cheap cords because their $80 cord work no better than the $16 cord.

one_reviews_text: the original quest's case just plain looks better. this one is certainly durable, but you can tell they cut corners. the surface is a rough scratchy fabric and the zipper only came with a little bit of string rather than an actual pull tab. the insides also aren't nicely molded anymore to hold anything and everything just kind of sits in there. honestly, i don't trust the controllers just free floating inside. certainly better than just tossing the device in a backpack, but nowhere near as good as the price would suggest.

I looked up solutions online and they worked as far as straightening the head-strap back to normal, but now the slipping happens almost immediately when i begin tightening the strap and I can no longer tighten it enough to fit properly.

one_reviews_text: This strap did a great job of holding the Oculus more securely and comfortably than the original strap.  But one of the side straps snapped the other day when I reached to pick it up.  I'm a very light Oculus user - maybe 1-2 hours a week, and I've only had this about 6 weeks.  It has never been dropped, banged, or been subjected to any stress other than normal wear.  The hard plastic side straps are either too thin or just a bad material to use for that application.  Very disappointing that something that cost $50 broke after less than 12 hours of normal use.  Now I need to find and buy a different one.

one_reviews_text: I bought the Elite Strap back in October when the Oculus Quest 2 came out. It held up great for a couple of months, and I don't use the headset for several months. I will be reaching out to Oculus to see what kind of warranty they have.I have seen MANY other reviews complaining about the headset snapping, so do yourself a favor and DO NOT buy this.
